post.summary: Triggers a Web Services AutoSupport bundle
post.description: Deprecated since 7.00. Allows a user to trigger a Web Services AutoSupport bundle asynchronously and retrieve the bundle locally or dispatch the bundle to the AutoSupport backend server. This operation will create a job that can then be used to query status of the bundle request. The AutoSupport feature must be enabled to dispatch bundles to the AutoSupport backend server.

get.summary: Get a subset of raw controller statistics
get.description:
This API is available on SANtricity OS version 11.30.20.xx/08.30.20.xx or greater for all supported platforms.

This API will either retrieve a cached, previously collected statistics snapshot (default), or it will attempt to retrieve the statistics from the storage-system directly. If no previous statistics collections have been successful or have occurred, the statistics will be retrieved directly from the storage-system.

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

parameters.name: idlist
parameters.description: A comma separated list of controller id's

parameters.name: usecache
parameters.description: When true, the statistics data will be returned from the cache. If there is no data in the cache then the storage system will be queried directly for the statistics data.

422.description: Failure retrieving the requested statistics

get.summary: Retrieve results of a previously initiated discovery operation
get.description:
Retrieve the results of a previously initiated discovery operation. Recent previous results can be retrieved using their requestId, otherwise we'll simply retrieve the most recent results.

If you run multiple POST /discovery operations, the results will not be aggregated; you may retrieve the results from a given request by providing the applicable requestId.

This operation may take some time depending on the number of addresses. You can query the discoverProcessRunning attribute to determine if the process has completed.

This operation is not standalone, but must be initiated using POST /discovery. See the documentation for POST /discovery.

post.summary: Discover storage-systems over a range of IP addresses
post.description:
Initiate a discovery operation on a range of IP addresses.

This API allows you to scan a large (or small), range of IP addresses and discover E-Series systems. You submit the initial request with the POST and then request incremental results with GET /discovery. Discovering the systems doesn't automatically place them under management. In order to place the discovered systems under management, you can add individual systems using POST /storage-systems.

Currently, only a single discovery operation may be run at a time, regardless of the number of users. If a second operation is initiated while the former is still in progress, an error status will be returned.

202.description: Discovery request accepted

422.description: Discovery already running or unexpected error

delete.description: This API will allow you to cancel a running discovery operation.

422.description: Error cancelling operation

get.summary: Get a list of audit log messages.
get.description:
The audit log uses zero-based indexing.

beginTime and endTime can be the following formats(UTC):
'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ',
'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ',
'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss+|-hh:mm

EXAMPLES:
'2018-01-15T05:06:08Z',
'2018-07-12T17:57:14.922Z',
'2018-07-13T14:59:52+00:00'

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

parameters.name: startRecordOrdinal
parameters.description: Starting record ordinal inclusive.

parameters.name: endingRecordOrdinal
parameters.description: Ending record ordinal inclusive.

parameters.name: beginTime
parameters.description: Beginning time in the form of 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ'

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Ending time in the form of 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ'

404.description: An error occurred when attempting to retrieve audit log messages

422.description: Invalid Parameter

post.summary: Retrieves the requested list of audit log messages as a private file.
post.description:
This API will return a URL path to the file to be retrieved in the response. This API will also returna fileID to be used with URI files/private/{id}. The audit log uses zero-based indexing.

beginTime and endTime can be the following formats(UTC):
'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ',
'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ',
'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss+|-hhmm

EXAMPLES:
'2018-01-15T05:06:08Z',
'2018-07-12T17:57:14.922Z',
'2018-07-13T14:59:52+00:00'

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

This API is designed to return a file. It will only return a content-type of application/json in cases where the file retrieval did not succeed.
This endpoint is available on SANtricity OS versions 11.40 and later.

post.summary: This endpoint is used to install a Key Management Server (KMS) Signed Certificate or a certificate in a chain on the server. If a Signed Certificate is installed, a private key may also be provided. The supplied private key will replace any previously generated private key if a Certificate Signing Request (CSR) was generated.
post.description: This endpoint is available on SANtricity OS versions 11.40 and later.

post.summary: This endpoint is used to request a Certificate Signing Request (CSR) for a client certificate. This certificate is used for authentication with the external key server. Each CSR request triggers the generation of a new public certificate and private key, replacing existing key material. If there is an existing connection to a KMS server, this operation may cause communication failure.
post.description:

This endpoint is available on SANtricity OS versions 11.40 and later.

post.summary: This endpoint enables, disables or modifies the external security key on the storage system
post.description:
If ekmsOption is set to enable, the storage array will communicate with the KMS server to obtain a security key and install it on the storage system. For this operation to succeed, the following prerequisites must be met:

1. The KMS server IP and port must be set
2. A CSR must be generated and uploaded to the KMS server to retrieve the client certificate, or an externally generated public/private key and CSR must be used to obtain a client certificate from the KMS server.
3. Both the client and server certificates need to be installed on the storage system.

- If ekmsOption is set to disable and external key management is currently enabled, the storage array will switch to internal key management and a new security key will be generated on the storage system.
- If ekmsOption is set to changeKey and external key management is currently enabled, a new security key will be generated on the storage system to replace the existing key.
- If ekmsOption is set to changeKeyAndDelete, the operation is the same as the changeKey option, but the existing security key will also be deleted from the KMS server.

This endpoint is available on SANtricity OS versions 11.40 and later.

get.summary: Get a subset of raw interface statistics
get.description:
This API is available on SANtricity OS version 11.30.20.xx/08.30.20.xx or greater for all supported platforms.

This API will either retrieve a cached, previously collected statistics snapshot (default), or it will attempt to retrieve the statistics from the storage-system directly. If no previous statistics collections have been successful or have occurred, the statistics will be retrieved directly from the storage-system.

parameters.description: When true, the statistics data will be returned from the cache. If there is no data in the cache then the storage system will be queried directly for the statistics data.

get.summary: Retrieve one or more elements from the ObjectGraph using an XPath expression.
get.description:
This method is used to query the ObjectGraph for one or more elements.
Examples:
  • Retrieve the list of drives: /drive
  • Locate all instances of an attribute called "id": //id
  • Find a thinVolume with an id of "1": /highLevelVolBundle/thinVolume[id="1"]
  • Find all thin volumes and volumes inefficiently: //volume | //thinVolume
  • Get the NSVRAM version from saData: /sa/saData/nvsramVersion
References: http://www.w3schools.com/xml/xpath_intro.asp

get.summary: Retrieve multiple time periods of storage-system statistics from newest to oldest
get.description:
The number of items in the statistics list are not guaranteed to be the same from different API revisions and not all items from the same time-period may be listed in the same request. This API can support simultaneous active queries by using a null or empty tokenId.

This API is available on SANtricity OS version 11.30.20.xx/08.30.20.xx or greater for all supported platforms.

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

parameters.name: token-id
parameters.description: The token used to retrieve the next page of statistics. If this value is null or empty, a new query will be started.Once a token has been successfully used, it may not be used again. These tokens will expire after 1 minute and that expiration time may vary from different API revisions.

parameters.name: statisticsFetchTime
parameters.description: The number of seconds of historical statistics data to retrieve. After the initial query has started (a token has been provided), this value is ignored.

422.description: Failure retrieving the requested statistics

get.summary: Get a list of audit log messages.
get.description:
The audit log uses zero-based indexing.

beginTime and endTime can be the following formats(UTC):
'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ',
'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ',
'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss+|-hh:mm

EXAMPLES:
'2018-01-15T05:06:08Z',
'2018-07-12T17:57:14.922Z',
'2018-07-13T14:59:52+00:00'

parameters.name: startRecordOrdinal
parameters.description: Starting record ordinal inclusive.

parameters.name: endingRecordOrdinal
parameters.description: Ending record ordinal inclusive.

parameters.name: beginTime
parameters.description: Beginning time.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Ending time.

404.description: An error occurred when attempting to retrieve audit log messages

422.description: Invalid Parameter

post.summary: Retrieves the requested list of audit log messages as a private file.
post.description: This API will return a URL path to the file to be retrieved in the response. This API will also returna fileID to be used with URI files/private/{id}.

404.description: An error occurred when attempting to retrieve audit log messages

422.description: Invalid Parameter

get.summary: Get the current audit log configuration.

post.summary: Updates the audit long configuration.

get.summary: Get audit log metadata.

delete.summary: Delete specified subset or all proxy audit log messages.
delete.description: This will not delete entries from the audit log on a system with embedded webservices. One of The following values must be selected and are mutually exclusive: retentionCount, endDate, or clearAll

parameters.name: retentionCount
parameters.description: Number of records to preserve within the log after deleting the audit logs from oldest to newest.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Delete all audit log records older than the specified time as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: clearAll
parameters.description: Clear all records

get.summary: Gets the storage array's system configuration data
get.description: Allows the user to export the defined system configuration so that it can be applied to other storage-systems in full or in part.

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

post.summary: Initiates an array configuration operation
post.description: Allows the user to configure the array based on the exported system configuration data of another array. The configuration may be applied in full or in part. After a configuration operation is launched, a Job ID is returned which should be used as input to the GET /system-config/job/{jobid} call.The GET /system-config/status call is used to get status on an in progress job.

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

parameters.name: applyElements
parameters.description:
List of configuration elements that should be applied during the operation.  If missing, all  elements are applied.
  all - all array configuration elements are applied
  pools - volume disk pool configuration is applied
  volumeGroups - volume group configuration is applied
  hotSpares - hot spare drive configuration is applied
  arraySettings - various items like cache configuration are applied

202.description: array configuration operation initiated

409.description: an array configuration operation is currently in progress

422.description: invalid configuration requested

delete.summary: Stops an in progress array configuration operation
delete.description: Allows the user to cancel an in progress array configuration operation.

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

204.description: in progress operation cancelled or no operations in progress

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

get.summary: Retrieves the details of an in progress or completed array configuration operation

parameters.name: system-id

parameters.name: job-id
parameters.description: Job ID value to retrieve data for. If two or more jobs share the same ID, the most recent job's data is returned.

post.summary: Starts a full provisioning format asynchronous operation.
post.description:
The full provisioning format ensures all blocks needed by the volumes in the storage pool are fully mapped on the drives. This command is only applicable to resource provisioned storage pools. If the option to disable resource provisioning is not specified, then the volumes will still be resource provisioned and new volumes created on the storage pool will be resource provisioned. If the option to disable resource provisioning is set, then the volumes will no longer be resource provisioned and new volumes created on the storage pool will not be resource provisioned.

Note: To re-enable resource provisioning on a storage pool and all associated volumes, use the resource provisioning enablement command. A storage pool will be resource provisioned when created if all the drives are DULBE capable and the storage system's resource-provisioned-volumes setting is true.

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

parameters.name: storage-pool-id
parameters.description: The storage pool's unique identifier.

404.description: The storage system or storage pool not found

post.summary: Starts a resource provisioning enablement asynchronous operation on a given volume group or storage pool.
post.description:
Enables resource provisioning on a given storage pool and starts a resource provisioning enablement asynchronous operation on each volume in the storage pool. Resource provisioning requires that all the drives in the storage pool support NVMe's DULBE feature.

Note: To disable resource provisioning on a storage pool, use the full provisioning format command with the option to disable resource provisioning. A storage pool will be resource provisioned when created if all the drives are DULBE capable and the storage system's resource-provisioned-volumes setting is true.

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

parameters.name: storage-pool-id
parameters.description: The storage pool's unique identifier.

post.description: For disk pools, the standard RAID level may be RAID 1 or RAID 6 depending on the number of drives in the  disk pool. If the number of drives is at or above the minimum drive count provided in the disk pool default  attributes, then the standard RAID level is RAID 6. If the number of drives is at the minimum SSD drive  count but below the minimum drive count provided in the disk pool default attributes, then the standard RAID  level is RAID 1. Disk pool default attributes can be retrieved from the getSystemAttributeDefaults SYMbol  procedure.

post.summary: Uploads a certificate for this server

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description: The alias to associate with this certificate file. If the alias already exists on the system, the existing certificate will be overwritten. If no alias is provided a random one will be assigned. This parameter is mutually exclusive with the replaceMainServerCertificate parameter.

parameters.name: replaceMainServerCertificate
parameters.description: Indicates if the certificate being uploaded is meant to replace the main server certificate. Make sure to upload all root and intermediate certificates before using this option

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The certificate file to upload. This file consists of either a CA signed certificate, or a set of trusted certificates that backs the server's signed certificate. Specify true for the replaceMainServerCertificate to upload a CA signed certificate.

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: An optional public, private key pair to upload. If this parameter is supplied, then the private key used for the server will be replaced. This parameter MUST be accompanied by a file containing the CA signed certificate plus trusted certificate chain in the same API call or the operation will fail. No alias need be supplied for the private key.

get.summary: Forwards a REST GET call to a storage system
get.description:
Provides a reverse proxy mechanism by which clients can send REST API GET calls to storage systems which support an embedded webserver. This allows access to embedded functionality not currently support by the proxy.
Mode: Proxy only.

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: path to be used in forwarded request. This path is treated as an absolute path on the embedded webserver. For example, to access `/devmgr/utils/about` on a storage system with an ID of 10, the path parameter should be `devmgr/utils/about`. The full URL for the request would be `/devmgr/v2/storage-systems/10/forward/devmgr/utils/about`. For another example, to access `/devmgr/v2/storage-systems/1/volumes` on a storage array with an ID of 10 the full path would be `/devmgr/v2/storage-systems/10/forward/devmgr/v2/storage-systems/1/volumes` ***Note***: Accessing paths on the embedded webserver under storage-systems requires using an ID of 1 for storage arrays running 8.41 or earlier software. For storage arrays running 8.42 or later, any non-empty ID may be used that is less than 64 characters long.

parameters.name: controller
parameters.description: identifier of controller

499.description: Storage system does not support embedded webserver

post.summary: Forwards a REST POST call to a storage system

post.summary: Initializes a volume
post.description: Mode: Both proxy and embedded. This procedure causes the specified volume to be re-initialized. All data that is currently present on the volume will be irretrievably lost as a result of this operation. Once a format operation starts, the volume's action field will be changed to 'initializing'; the getVolumeActionProgress procedure can then be used to monitor the progress of the operation. Volume format operations are typically required only when reviving a volume that has been marked failed for some reason. Newly-created volumes need not be explicitly formatted using this procedure.

parameters.name: system-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage-system. This may be the id or the WWN.

AlertSyslogConfiguration.description: API object that includes data related to syslog configuration.

serverName.description: Fully qualified name or IP address

observedTime.description: A timestamp representing when the data was collected

observedTimeInMS.description: The time in which this data was polled and generated in milliseconds

otherIOps.description: SCSI Operations to the disk that are not read/write operations. Example: Test Unit Ready.

readResponseTime.description: Read response time average in milliseconds.

readResponseTimeStdDev.description: The standard deviation of read response times.

writeResponseTime.description: Write response time average in milliseconds.

writeResponseTimeStdDev.description: The standard deviation of write response times.

combinedResponseTime.description: Combined average response time in milliseconds.

combinedResponseTimeStdDev.description: The standard deviation of combined response times.

averageReadOpSize.description: Average read operation size in bytes.

averageWriteOpSize.description: Average write operation size in bytes.

readOps.description: The amount of read operations in this analysed interval.

writeOps.description: The amount of write operations in this analysed interval.

driveSlot.description: Slot the drive is currently located in.

trayRef.description: Tray reference that the drive is located in

trayId.description: Tray that the drive is located in

volGroupId.description: The volume group ID that the drive belong and/or belonged to. This will be set to null if the record does not have a historically recorded volume group or the drive is not in a volume.

volGroupName.description: The volume group name that the drive belong and/or belonged to. This will be set to null if the record does not have a historically recorded volume group or the drive is not in a volume.

readPhysicalIOps.description: Physical read operations per second. For disk drives, the physical IOps will beequal to the total IOps.

writePhysicalIOps.description: Physical write operations per second. For disk drives, the physical IOps will beequal to the total IOps.

readTimeMax.description: The max time servicing read operations.

writeTimeMax.description: The max time servicing write operations.

averageQueueDepth.description: Average queue depth over the observation time.

randomIosPercent.description: The percentage of IOs that are classified as random.

randomBytesPercent.description: The percentage of bytes that are classified as random.

observedTimeInMS.description: The time in which this data was polled and generated in milliseconds

averageWriteOpSize.description: Average write operation size in bytes.

writeOps.description: The amount of write operations in this analysed interval.

mapped.description: True if the volume was mapped to a host at the point of data collection

readHitOps.description: Number of read operations that hit cache

writeHitBytes.description: Number of bytes written to cache

writeCacheUtilization.description: Percentage of bytes written to cache

flashCacheReadHitBytes.description: Number of bytes read from flash(SSD) cache

writeTimeMax.description: The max time servicing write operations.

randomIosPercent.description: The percentage of IOs that are classified as random.

cacheWriteWaitOpsPercent.description: The percentage of write operations that are delayed, waiting for cache flush.

cacheWriteWaitBytesPercent.description: The percentage of write bytes that are delayed, waiting for cache flush.

prefetchHitPercent.description: The percentage of pre-fetched hits that are ultimately read by the host.

fullStripeWritesBytesPercent.description: This value will always report -1 and will be removed in a future release.

otherIOps.description: SCSI Operations to the disk that are not read/write operations. Example: Test Unit Ready.

averageWriteOpSize.description: Average write operation size in bytes.

readOps.description: The amount of read operations in this analysed interval.

writeOps.description: The amount of write operations in this analysed interval.

cacheHitBytesPercent.description: The percentage of bytes that hit cache.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

randomIosPercent.description: The percentage of IOs that are classified as random.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

mirrorBytesPercent.description: The percentage of bytes serviced by the controller that are characterized as cache mirroring related.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

fullStripeWritesBytesPercent.description: The percentage of bytes serviced by the controller that are characterized as full stripe writes.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

maxCpuUtilization.description: The max cpu utilization over the observation period.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

cpuAvgUtilization.description: The average CPU utilization.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

raid0BytesPercent.description: The percentage of operations serviced to a RAID 0 volume.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

raid1BytesPercent.description: The percentage of operations serviced to a RAID 1 volume.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

raid5BytesPercent.description: The percentage of operations serviced to a RAID 5 volume.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

raid6BytesPercent.description: The percentage of operations serviced to a RAID 6 volume.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

ddpBytesPercent.description: The percentage of operations serviced to a dynamic disk pool(DDP) volume.This field will not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

readHitResponseTime.description: Read cache hit response time average in milliseconds.

readHitResponseTimeStdDev.description: The standard deviation of read cache hit response times

writeHitResponseTime.description: Write cache hit response time average in milliseconds.

writeHitResponseTimeStdDev.description: The standard deviation of write cache hit response times

combinedHitResponseTime.description: Combined average cache hit response time in milliseconds.

combinedHitResponseTimeStdDev.description: The standard deviation of combined cache hit response times.

maxPossibleBpsUnderCurrentLoad.description: Theoretical maximum possible Bytes per second under current load.

maxPossibleIopsUnderCurrentLoad.description: Theoretical maximum possible IO per second under current load.

AnalysedStorageSystemStatistics.description: Statistics for storage system. some fields may not populate for systems running code versions older than 08.30.20.xx/11.30.20.xx.

RemoteCandidate.description: A storage-device candidate for use with ARVM.

memberRef.description: The reference (key) for the group member.

primaryVolWWN.description: The WWN of the primary volume on the remote array.

primaryVolCapacity.description: Capacity of the primary (used to aid in selection of mirror secondary volume).

primaryVolRAIDLevel.description: RAID level of the primary volume.

primaryVolProtectionType.description: The protection type of the primary volume.

primaryVolSecurityType.description: Security type of the primary volume.

primaryVolUserLabel.description: User label of the primary volume.

orphanIncompleteMember.description: If true, the incomplete member is an orphan.

primaryVolumeParameters.description: The capacity provisioning parameters for the primary volume.

primaryVolSecurityLevel.description: Refines the information in the securityType field to describe the set of drives.

blkSize.description: The block size (in bytes) of the volume.

blkSizePhysical.description: This reports the physical block size (in bytes) used when sending I/O to the underlying drives.

remoteTargetWwn.description: The WWN of the target array in the mirroring relationship. This field may not be immediately available after an AMG is created.

remoteTargetName.description: The user label of the target array in the mirroring relationship. This field may not be immediately available after an AMG is created, and will not be available in embedded mode.

remoteTargetId.description: The id of the target array in the mirroring relationship. This field may not be immediately available after an AMG is created, and will not be available in embedded mode.

capacityQuota.description: The maximum capacity to which the Expandable Repository Volume can grow (in bytes).

growthAlertThreshold.description: The alert threshold percent value for the Expandable Repository Volume.

repositoryExpansionPolicy.description: The expansion policy for the Expandable Repository Volume.

volumeType.description: This enumeration is used to identify the capacity provisioning of a volume.

capacityProvisioningDetails.description: This field is returned if the value of returnCode is equal to RETCODE_OK.

memberRef.description: The reference (key) for the group member.

mirrorGroup.description: The AMG with which this member is associated.

localVolume.description: The local volume for this mirror. This is the volume being mirrored if the AMG role is primary, otherwise this is the target of mirror synchronization.

remoteVolume.description: The remote volume. This is the target of mirror synchronization on the remote array if the AMG role is primary, otherwise this is the volume on the remote array that is being mirrored.

memberState.description: The state of this mirror relationship (as known by this array).

lastRecoveryPointTime.description: The timestamp, represented in seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970, of the last recovery point PiT on secondary. If no recovery point image exists, the value of this field will be ARVM_NO_RECOVERY_POINT_TIMESTAMP.

overUtilizationWarnThreshold.description: If true, the repository capacity utilized is over the warning threshold.

mirroredLocalCapacity.description: The current local volume capacity that is being mirrored. This will be less than the actual local volume capacity if we have not yet reached a point where the next PiT can be taken and delta-logs resized (and until that point the expanded local capacity will not be opened up to host writes).

repositoryVolume.description: The metadata volume (Copy-on-Write / DeltaLog Repository) for this mirror.

worldWideName.description: The WWN of the async mirror proxy.

volumeHandle.description: The SSID of the async mirror proxy.

repositoryFull.description: If true, the repository is full (100% of available capacity utilized).

localVolumeName.description: The label of the source volume on the local StorageSystem.

remoteVolumeName.description: The label of the remote target volume.

remoteVolumeInfo.description: Detailed information on the remote volume.

remoteTargetWwn.description: The WWN of the target array in the mirroring relationship. This field may not be immediately available after an AMG is created.

remoteTargetName.description: The user label of the target array in the mirroring relationship. This field may not be immediately available after an AMG is created, and will not be available in embedded mode.

remoteTargetId.description: The id of the target array in the mirroring relationship. This field may not be immediately available after an AMG is created, and will not be available in embedded mode.

totalSizeInBytes.description: The capacity of the underlying repository volume in bytes.

mediaScan.description: The volume-specific media scan settings currently in effect for the repository volume.

AsyncMirrorGroupMemberEx.description: A representation of an asynchronous mirroring relationship between a local and remote volume.

worldWideName.description: The WWN of the remote volume.

remoteVolRef.description: The identifier of the remote volume.

manager.description: The controller that owns the remote volume.

remoteArrayId.description: The identifier of the remote array.

remoteNodeWWN.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

remoteVolWWN.description: The WWN of the volume on the remote array.

remoteVolUserLabel.description: The user assigned label of the remote volume.

remoteVolState.description: The state of the current remote volume.

remoteVolCapacity.description: The actual capacity of the volume on the remote array.

volumeHandle.description: The SSID of the remote volume.

remoteVolSecurityType.description: The security type of the volume on the remote array. Note this may be SECURITY_TYPE_UNKNOWN if connection to remote array is down.

worldWideName.description: A variable-length, opaque byte array whose value is guaranteed to be globally unique, and thus serves as the unique identifier for the storage array. No assumptions may be made outside the controller firmware environment about the meaning of the various bytes within this array. The only operation that a SYMbol client is allowed to perform on this field is a comparison for equality with the same field of a different storage array object.

ioInterfaceType.description: This enumeration defines the different I/O interface types that may be reported as part of the configuration information associated with a controller.

iscsiNodeName.description: The SCSI node name as defined under iSCSI. This field is only valid if the I/O interface type is equal to IO_IF_ISCSI.

remoteNodeWWN.description: The FC WWN for the remote node. This field is only valid if the I/O interface type is equal to IO_IF_FC.

enable.description: A true value means that the controller should perform a media scan for this volume as part of its background processing. A false value means that the volume should not participate in media scans.

parityValidationEnable.description: A true value means that, in addition to ensuring that the volume's media blocks are fully accessible, the controller should also compute and validate all parity blocks for the volume during the media scan. A false value means that parity validation should not occur in conjunction with media checking. Note that this field has no significance unless the enable field is set to true.

mapToLUN.description: Can this volume be mapped to a LUN

snapShot.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

format.description: This is true if the volume can be formatted.

reconfigure.description: This is true if the volume can be reconfigured (DVE, DCE, DRM, etc.).

mirrorPrimary.description: This is true if the volume can be a primary mirror.

mirrorSecondary.description: This is true if the volume can be a secondary mirror.

copySource.description: This is true if the volume can be the source for a copy.

copyTarget.description: This is true if the volume can be the target for a copy.

readable.description: This is true if the volume can be read by a host.

writable.description: Can this volume be written by a host

rollback.description: Set to true if a snapshot rollback can be applied to this volume.

mirrorSync.description: Set to true if a remote volume mirror can actively synchronize this volume's data

newImage.description: Set to true when a new point-in-time image can be taken of this volume, either by creating a new snapshot or re-creating an existing snapshot.

allowDVE.description: If true, this volume can be expanded via DVE. If false, this will still allow general reconfigures (providing the 'reconfigure' field is true), but disallow DVE specifically.

allowDSS.description: If true, this volume can undergo a segment size change (DSS). If false, this will still allow general reconfigures (providing the 'reconfigure' field is true), but disallow DSS specifically.

concatVolumeMember.description: If true, this volume can be a member of a ConcatVolume.

flashReadCache.description: If true, this volume can have flash read cache enabled.

asyncMirrorPrimary.description: If true, this volume can be an Async RVM primary.

asyncMirrorSecondary.description: If true, this volume can be an Async RVM primary.

pitGroup.description: If true, a PiT group can be created on this volume.

cacheParametersChangeable.description: If true, cache parameters may be changed on this volume.

allowThinManualExpansion.description: If true, changes to manual mode while the thin volume is in an Asynchronous Mirror Group (AMG) are allowed.

allowThinGrowthParametersChange.description: If true, changes to the growth parameters (quota or warning threshold values) while the thin volume is in an Asynchronous Mirror Group (AMG) are allowed.

allowImportTarget.description: This is true if the volume can be an import target

secondaryPoolId.description: Storage pool on the target StorageSystem to create the mirrored pair repository volume on. This defaults to the pool that the secondaryVolume belongs to.

secondaryPercentCapacity.description: Percentage of the capacity of the secondary volume to use for the repository capacity.

secondaryRepositoryCandidate.description: Allows a repository candidate to be manually specified for use in the creation. By default, the best candidate will be selected.

candType.description: This enumeration is used to specify the Concatenated Volume candidate type.

newVolCandidate.description: This field is present only if the ConcatVolumeCandidateType value is equal to CONCAT_VOL_CANDIDATE_TYPE_NEW_VOL.

existVolCandidate.description: This field is present only if the ConcatVolumeCandidateType value is equal to CONCAT_VOL_CANDIDATE_TYPE_EXISTING_VOLS.

expansionDescriptor.description: This field is present only if the ConcatVolumeCandidateType value is equal to CONCAT_VOL_CANDIDATE_TYPE_EXPANSION.

additionalCapacity.description: Additional capacity to add to the last member of the ConcatVolume.

refType.description: This enumeration is used to specify the Concatenated Volume Member reference type.

memberVolumeRef.description: A list of member volumes specified using volume references. This field is present only if the value of refType is equal to CONCAT_VOL_MEMBER_REF_TYPE_VOLREF.

memberLabel.description: A list of member volumes specified using volume labels. This field is present only if the value of refType is equal to CONCAT_VOL_MEMBER_REF_TYPE_LABEL.

memberVolumeLabel.description: The label for the new member volume.

memberVolumeGroupLabel.description: An optional volume group label if creating a new volume group.

memberCandidate.description: The candidate to be used to create the member volume.

memberCapacity.description: The capacity of the new volume to create, in bytes.

reconstructionReservedDriveCount.description: The number of drives reserved for reconstruction of failed drives.

reconstructionReservedAmt.description: The pool capacity reserved to hold rebuild data (in bytes). This value is calculated from the reconstructionReservedDriveCount.

unusableCapacity.description: This value identifies how much capacity (in bytes) is being wasted due to a mix of drive sizes. This value will be zero as long as the pool consists of like drive sizes.

driveRef.description: A variable-length array of DriveRef objects.

protectionInformationCapable.description: True when all drive(s) are PI capable.

protectionType.description: This field is set to the protection type provided for the drive(s).

raidLevel.description: The RAID level of the potential volume.

trayLossProtection.description: This field is set to true if the candidate has tray loss protection.

rawSize.description: This value is the maximum allowed user data storage capacity for the volume if the smallest possible segment is used in creating the volume.

usableSize.description: This value is the maximum allowed user data storage capacity for the volume if the largest possible segment is used in creating the volume.

driveCount.description: The number of drives in the potential volume's volume group.

freeExtentRef.description: The reference value of the free extent on which the potential volume would be created. This field will be valid only if the volume candidate was obtained using a candidate selection type of CANDIDATE_SEL_FREE_EXTENT.

driveRefList.description: A list of the reference values of the drives on which the volume group for the potential volume would be created. This field will be valid only if the volume candidate was obtained using a candidate selection type of CANDIDATE_SEL_MANUAL.

candidateSelectionType.description: The type of candidate selection that was used to obtain this volume candidate.

spindleSpeedMatch.description: True, if all drives have matching spindle speed.

spindleSpeed.description: True, if all drives have matching spindle speed.

dssPreallocEnabled.description: True if dynamic segment sizing pre-allocation will be enabled for the volume created from this candidate, otherwise false.

securityType.description: The desired security level of the drive group.

drawerLossProtection.description: This field is set to true when the volume group has drawer loss protection; otherwise it is set to false

driveMediaType.description: Drive media type (HDD or SSD) of the volume candidate.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

protectionInformationCapabilities.description: This structure contains a protectionInformationCapable field which is set to true if all drives in the volume group where the volume candidate resides are Protection Information (PI) capable. It also contains the protection type for the volume group.

driveBlockFormat.description: Identifies the drive block format of the volume candidate.

allocateReservedSpace.description: Determines whether or not reserved space is allocated on the drives in the volume group.

securityLevel.description: Describes the overall security level of the drive set. Values can include: FDE only, FIPS only, mixed, or no security. Used along with the SecurityType field.

dulbeCapable.description: If true the VolumeCandidate represents drives that are all DULBE capable.

blkSizeRecommended.description: The recommended block size (in bytes) for this candidate. This is based on both the specific drives involved and global conditions (NVSRAM, HW limitations, etc).

blkSizeSupported.description: Lists the supported block sizes (in bytes) for this candidate.

volumeGroupRef.description: The volume group reference value of the volume group or disk pool on which the volume will be created.

drivePathImbalance.description: This field is set to true if the paths to the drives used in this candidate are imbalanced.

type.description: This enumeration is used to indicate the type of the volume group.

diskPoolVolumeCandidateData.description: This field is present only if the value of type is equal to VG_TYPE_DISK_POOL.

primaryPoolId.description: Storage pool on the source StorageSystem to create the mirrored pair repository volume on. This defaults to the pool that the primaryVolume belongs to.

secondaryPoolId.description: Storage pool on the target StorageSystem to create the mirrored pair repository volume on. This defaults to the pool that the secondaryVolume belongs to.

primaryRepositoryCandidate.description: Allows a repository candidate to be manually specified for use in the creation. By default, the best candidate will be selected.

secondaryRepositoryCandidate.description: Allows a repository candidate to be manually specified for use in the creation. By default, the best candidate will be selected.

percentCapacity.description: Percentage of the capacity of the primary volume to use for the repository capacity.

secondaryPercentCapacity.description: Percentage of the capacity of the secondary volume to use for the repository capacity. Defaults to percentCapacity.

dispatchType.description: The dispatch type determines the level of content that will be included in the AutoSupport bundle. For daily, weekly, and monthly dispatch types the appropriate logs (covering that specific amount of time) will be collected and included in the bundle. A dispatch type of manual will include all logs available. Finally, a dispatch type of test will collect a minimal set of logs sufficient to test communication with the AutoSupport backend server.

status.description: The current status of the AutoSupport bundle job.

dispatchStatus.description: The current dispatch status of the AutoSupport bundle job.

bundleFile.description: Provides information to retrieve the bundle file from the private files endpoint.

errorMessage.description: Provides an error message if an error occurs while a given request is in progress.

autoSupportEnabled.description: Determines whether AutoSupport is currently enabled.

scheduledDays.description: The current AutoSupport scheduled weekdays on which AutoSupport collections will occur.

mailServer.description: The smtp mail server for smtp-based configurations.

mailSenderAddress.description: The mail sender address for smtp-based configurations.

mailReplyAddress.description: The mail reply address for smtp-based configurations.

emailServerEncryption.description: The encryption to be used to communicate with the server. May be "none" (unencrypted),  "smtps" (SSL/TLS encrypted connection),  or "starttls" (connection upgraded to SSL/TLS encryption). Defaults to "none" if no encryption type has been set previously.

emailServerPort.description: The port to be used to connect to the server. A value of 0 may be specified to use the default port based on the encryption type set. Default is encryption dependent: "none" defaults to 25, "smtps" defaults to 465, and "starttls" defaults to 587

emailServerUsername.description: The user name to authenticate a user that is authorized to send + e-mails through the e-mail server.

emailServerPassword.description: The password to authenticate a user that is authorized to send e-mails through the e-mail server.

autoSupportEnabled.description: Determines whether to enable or disable the AutoSupport feature.

label.description: The name of the Consistency Group.

repFullPolicy.description: The behavior on repository full condition.

fullWarnThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold percentage.

autoDeleteLimit.description: The auto-delete indicator. If non-zero, the oldest PiT will be automatically deleted when creating a new one to keep the total number of PiTs limited to the number specified.

rollbackPriority.description: The importance of the rollback operation.

uniqueSequenceNumber.description: A list of all unique sequence numbers for all existing PiTs of members in this consistency group.

creationPendingStatus.description: The status of Pending PiT Creation.

name.description: The user-label to assign to the new consistency group

autoDeleteThreshold.description: The auto-delete threshold. Automatically delete snapshots after this many.

name.description: The user-label to assign to the new consistency group

autoDeleteThreshold.description: The auto-delete threshold. Automatically delete snapshots after this many.

ConsistencyGroupCreateRequest.description: Used to create a consistency group

totalRepositoryVolumes.description: Total number of repository volumes in use by the underlying snapshotGroup

usedRepositoryCapacity.description: The amount of repository capacity that is being utilized

fullWarnThreshold.description: The capacity threshold at which the user will be warned about running out of capacity for the repository

totalSnapshotImages.description: The total number of snapshot images defined for this member

totalSnapshotVolumes.description: The total number of snapshot volumes defined for this member

autoDeleteSnapshots.description: Automatically purge all snapshots over this value

autoDeleteLimit.description: If autoDeleteSnapshots is enabled, the maximum number allowed before autoDeletion occurs

repositoryVolume.description: Reference to the repository volume of the pitGroup/snapshotGroup

groupRef.description: The PiT Consistency Group to which the Consistency Group View belongs.

label.description: The name of the Consistency Group View.

viewTime.description: The controller-time (measured in seconds since January 1, 1970) when the Consistency Group View was created or re-attached to another PiT. All member Views that are part of this Consistency Group View have this value in their corresponding fields.

viewSequenceNumber.description: The view sequence number. This is a monotonically increasing sequence value that is common across all member Views that are part of this Consistency Group View.

developerMessage.description: An optional developer message providing further error details.

retcode.description: The value of retcode can vary by the code type.  To be unique, it must be combined with code type. It is a string. Even if the returned value looks like a number, don't assume its a number. It is a short label that will not change based on Internationalization.

invalidFieldsIfKnown.description: The list of invalid fields. The list will be populated with known invalid fields. In the case no invalid fields are known, the list will be empty.

CallResponse.description: API response to report errors back to the user.

volumeToCandidates.description: A map of volume refs to ConcatVolumeCandidates that will be used for creating the repository volumes.

pitGroupRef.description: A reference to the associated PiT Group.

pitTimestamp.description: The controller-time (measured in seconds since January 1, 1970) when the PiT was created.

pitSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number within PITGroup. This is a monotonically increasing sequence value that can be used to determine the absolute order of the PiTs within a PiT group. Using this sequence number avoids issues with timestamps when real-time clocks are changed. Note that this sequence number will be the same on all PiTs taken in multiple PITGroups at the same time under a single IO suspension, either as part of a consistency group operation (createCGPIT) or when a list of PITGroups is passed to createPIT.

status.description: The state of this PiT.

activeCOW.description: If true, the PiT is actively recording copy-on-write data.

isRollbackSource.description: If true, the PiT is a rollback source.

pitCapacity.description: The capacity in bytes of this PiT (capacity of the base at the time the PiT was created).

repositoryCapacityUtilization.description: Repository utilization in bytes (only reported if activeCOW = false).

repositoryPoolId.description: The reference to the pool that will be used for the repository creation.

pitId.description: The id of the PIT to create a View for. Either the pitSequenceNumber or a pitId is required.

pitSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of the PITs to create Views for. Either the pitSequenceNumber or a pitId is required.

accessMode.description: The access mode determines whether or not a repository volume should be created.

lunMappingRef.description: The unique identification value for this object. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the mapping definition.

lun.description: The unique identification value for this object. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the mapping definition.

ssid.description: An internal volume identifier value that is not meaningful outside the firmware environment.

perms.description: The permission values associated with this mapping definition. This field is not currently used, but is provided for future extensions.

volumeRef.description: The unique identification value of the volume that is accessed via the LUN value associated with this mapping definition.

type.description: The type of the LUN mapping.

mapRef.description: The unique identifier of the entity for which the mapping applies. The type of the entity, and thus of the SYMbol reference, depends on the mapping type. For example, if the LUNMapping object represents a cluster-wide mapping, this field will contain the ClusterRef of the cluster for which the mapping applies. Similarly, if the object represents a host-specific mapping, this field will contain the HostRef of the host for which the mapping applies. Note that if the object represents a default mapping, this field will contain a NULL SYMbolRef.

viewType.description: This enumeration identifies the possible types for a PITView.

cgViewRef.description: A reference to the PITConsistencyGroupView is returned if the value of viewType is equal to PIT_VIEW_TYPE_MEMBER.

worldWideName.description: The WWN of the view.

baseVol.description: A reference to the base volume with which this view is associated.

basePIT.description: A reference to the particular PiT of the base for which this view applies. This field is only valid if the boundToPIT field is true.

boundToPIT.description: If true, this flag indicates that the basePIT field is a valid reference to an associated PIT. If false, the view is disassociated from the PiT so the basePIT reference is invalid.

label.description: The name of the view.

status.description: The view status.

currentManager.description: The current owner of the view.

preferredManager.description: The preferred owner of the view.

repositoryVolume.description: The copy-on-write repository for this view.

fullWarnThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold percentage.

viewTime.description: The controller-time (measured in seconds since January 1, 1970) when view was created or re-attached to another PiT.

viewSequenceNumber.description: Sequence number. This is a monotonically increasing sequence value that can be used to determine related views when the view was created as part of a consistency group operation.

volumeHandle.description: The volume ssid. This is provided primarily for debug purposes.

maxRepositoryCapacity.description: The maximum allowable repository size in bytes based on current cluster size.

unusableRepositoryCapacity.description: The amount of repository capacity in bytes that is unusable due to limited addressability of the current cluster size.

membership.description: This view's relationship (if any) to a Consistency Group View.

offline.description: The view is offline due to the associated repository volume state.

extendedUniqueIdentifier.description: A variable-length opaque field that provides the volume's extended unique identification value.

asyncMirrorTarget.description: True if the volume is a target in an Asynchronous Mirror relationship.

asyncMirrorSource.description: True if the volume is a source in an Asynchronous Mirror relationship.

remoteMirrorSource.description: True if the volume is a source (primary), in an Remote Volume Mirror relationship.

remoteMirrorTarget.description: True if the volume is a target (secondary), in an Remote Volume Mirror relationship.

pitId.description: The id of the PIT to create a View for.

candidate.description: A manually specified ConcatVolumeCandidate of type newVol or existingVols. Required if accessMode == readWrite.

accessMode.description: The access mode determines whether or not a repository volume should be created.

pitSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of the PITs to create Views for. All provided PITs/Snapshots must have a matching sequenceNumber

requests.description: A list of Snapshots to include in the view.

requestId.description: A unique value that identifies the request for later retrieval.

status.description: Status of the database validation check

rerun.description: Info about test run for internal use

spmDatabaseVerification.description: Validate a database internal to the controller.

configurationDatabaseCheck.description: Validate a database internal to the controller.

objectGraphSyncCheck.description: Verify that ObjectGraph data is synchronized between the two controllers.

volumeGroupsComplete.description: Verify there are no volume groups that are not in a full state of redundancy.

controllerStatusOptimal.description: Verify the state of both controllers is optimal.

hotSparesInUse.description: Verify that hot spares are not in use (due to drives in a non-optimal state).

missingVolumes.description: Verify that there are no missing drives/volume-groups.

driveCheck.description: Verify that at least one optimal drive is present

exclusiveOperations.description: An upgrade operation cannot proceed if an exclusive operation is in progress on a volume. Examples: volume expansion, RAID type migration.

nvsramDisableCfwDownloads.description: Determines whether CFW downloads are allowed while IO is active

needsAttentionCheck.description: Determines whether CFW downloads are allowed with critical recovery failures

integratedHealthCheck.description: Integrated tests not included in other health checks

altCommLinkFailure.description: Verify whether any inter-controller interfaces have link down condition

ptlDisallowDownloads.description: Verify whether downloads are allowed when the array is in PTL switch-over mode

healthCheckTests.description: List of tests from the integrated health check.

testName.description: Health check test name that was executed.

NeedsAttentionCheck.description: Needs attention health check test results

developerMessage.description: An optional developer message providing further error details.

retcode.description: The value of retcode can vary by the code type.  To be unique, it must be combined with code type. It is a string. Even if the returned value looks like a number, don't assume its a number. It is a short label that will not change based on Internationalization.

invalidFieldsIfKnown.description: The list of invalid fields. The list will be populated with known invalid fields. In the case no invalid fields are known, the list will be empty.

HealthCheckFailureResponse.description: Provided as a response when the operation failed because of a failure in the health check.

requestId.description: A unique value that identifies the request for later retrieval.

InitialAsyncResponse.description: Provides a unique identifier for requesting status of an asynchronous call.

skipMelCheck.description: Skip check of the MEL events for issues with the storage-system.

CfwUpgradeRequest.description: Run a controller firmware upgrade operation

timeStamp.description: Timestamp when the staged FW was downloaded

codeVersions.description: Version descriptors for staged code modules

StagedFirmwareResponse.description: Class that holds details on the Firmware staged on the array.

observedTime.description: End time for this collection as measured by the number of seconds since baseTime.

totalIopsServiced.description: Total number of IO operations serviced by the controller.

totalBytesServiced.description: Total number of Bytes serviced by the controller.

cacheHitsIopsTotal.description: Total number of IO operations that hit cache.

cacheHitsBytesTotal.description: Total number of bytes that hit cache.

randomIosTotal.description: Total number of IOs that are categorized as random.

randomBytesTotal.description: Total number of Bytes that are categorized as random.

readIopsTotal.description: Total number of Read IO operations.

writeIopsTotal.description: Total number of Write IO operations.

mirrorIopsTotal.description: Total number of IO operations serviced by the controller that are characterized as cache mirroring related. If cache mirroring is disabled, this counter will not have any value.

mirrorBytesTotal.description: Total number of Bytes serviced by the controller that are characterized as cache mirroring related. If cache mirroring is disabled, this counter will not have any value.

fullStripeWritesBytes.description: Bytes written that are categorized as Full stripe writes.

raid0BytesTransferred.description: Bytes transferred that are categorized as RAID 0 transfers.

raid1BytesTransferred.description: Bytes transferred that are categorized as RAID 1 transfers.

raid5BytesTransferred.description: Bytes transferred that are categorized as RAID 5 transfers.

raid6BytesTransferred.description: Bytes transferred that are categorized as RAID 6 transfers.

ddpBytesTransferred.description: Bytes transferred that are categorized as DDP transfers.

maxPossibleBpsUnderCurrentLoad.description: Theoretical maximum possible Bytes per second under current load.

maxPossibleIopsUnderCurrentLoad.description: Theoretical maximum possible IO per second under current load.

maxCpuUtilization.description: Max utilization stats value from CPU.

sumCpuUtilization.description: Sum of utilization stats values from CPU.

ssqCpuUtilization.description: Sum of squares of utilization stats values from CPU.

dplCoreDumpTag.description: The tag value of the DPL core dump currently in controller memory. Each core dump has a unique tag value. A value of DPL_CORE_DUMP_NULL_TAG indicates there is no DPL core dump to retrieve.

dplCoreDumpNeedsRetrieved.description: If true, a DPL core dump currently exists in controller memory and has not been retrieved.

dplCoreDumpEnabled.description: If true, DPL Core Dump is enabled in the controller.

timeStamp.description: The time that the core dump was collected measured in seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970.

KeyValuePair.description: Simple structure to hold key value pairs

alertingEnabled.description: If set to true and a recipient e-mail address has been specified, then e-mails will be sent to the recipient any time an 'alertable' event occurs on the storage system.

emailServerAddress.description: The address for the server that will send the alert e-mails.  The address can be specified as a DNS name, an IPv4 address or an IPv6 address.  If a DNS name is provided, then the DNS confirmation must be properly configured on both controllers in the storage system.

emailServerEncryption.description: The encryption to be used to communicate with the server. May be "none" (unencrypted), "smtps" (SSL/TLS encrypted connection),  or "starttls" (connection upgraded to SSL/TLS encryption). Defaults to "none".

emailServerPort.description: The port to be used to connect to the server. Default is encryption dependent: "none" defaults to 25, "smtps" defaults to 465, and "starttls" defaults to 587

emailServerUsername.description: The user name to authenticate a user that is authorized to send e-mails through the e-mail server.

emailServerPassword.description: The password to authenticate a user that is authorized to send e-mails through the e-mail server.

emailSenderAddress.description: The e-mail address that the alert e-mails will come from.  This doesn't need to be a real e-mail address but it does have to be formatted as a valid e-mail address.

sendAdditionalContactInformation.description: If set to true, the additional contact information provided will be included in all alert e-mails that get sent out.

additionalContactInformation.description: Any additional contact information that should be included in all alert e-mails that get sent out. If sendAdditionalContactInformation is set to false, this value is ignored.

recipientEmailAddresses.description: An array of e-mail addresses that the alert e-mails should be sent to.

DeviceAlertConfiguration.description: API object that shows the e-mail alert configuration for the storage system.

responseData.description: The string representation of the data requested.

requestId.description: A unique value that identifies the request ID for later retrieval.

AsyncStringResponse.description: Provides a unique string identifier for requesting status of an asynchronous call.

rawDataTypes.description: Raw data types to be retrieved
Indicates the raw data types being retrieved.

percentComplete.description: Indicates the percentage of the data collected.

complete.description: Indicates if the diagnostic raw data retrieval is complete.

cancelled.description: Indicates if the diagnostic raw data retrieval was cancelled.

total.description: total number of addresses to check

lastStart.description: Time when the last discovery was started null if a process has never been started

discoverProcessRunning.description: Indicates if a discovery process is running

storageSystems.description: List of storage systems discovered so far

DiscoverResponse.description: API response object that includes data for the current discover process

controllerId.description: A unique identifier for this controller

ipAddresses.description: The IP addresses that can be used to access this controller

certificateStatus.description: SSL certificate status (applicable if this controller supports management via HTTP

DiscoveredController.description: Information discovered for a storage system controller during a discover process

serialNumber.description: Serial number for the chassis

label.description: Label for the storage system

firmware.description: Firmware version for the storage system

nvsram.description: NVSRAM version for the storage system

ipAddresses.description: Discovered controller IP addresses for the storage system

needsAttention.description: Needs attention alert for the storage system

controllers.description: Discovered controllers for the storage system

supportedManagementPorts.description: Management port types that are supported on this storage system

DiscoveredStorageSystem.description: Information discovered for a storage system during a discover process

useAgents.description: In-band management agents will be queried if this value is true.      If you are not sure, its best to leave this as default

connectionTimeout.description: Optional parameter. This defaults to 30 seconds. Longer times may be needed for WAN discoveries, but will slow down the whole process. Shorter times speed up the process. This is only the timeout value for the initial TCP connection

maxPortsToUse.description: Set an explicit limit on the number of ports to use for discovery. A port is a file handle in most operating systems. It may be necessary to increase your ulimit values for open file handles. More ports available will significantly speed up the process, however, if available file handles are exceeded, then this operation will handle it gracefully, but other processes on the server may be affected as well as client connections.

DiscoveryStartRequest.description: Used to to start a storage system discover cycle

removalMethod.description: This enumeration defines the removal methods that apply to any component.

rtrAttributes.description: This field holds the component's ready-to-remove attributes. It is only present when the removalMethod is equal to COMP_RMV_METHOD_REMOVE_SELF.

offline.description: True if the drive is in the offline state, false otherwise. This field is valid for missing drives.

hotSpare.description: True if the drive has been designated as a hot spare; false otherwise. This field is valid for missing drives.

invalidDriveData.description: True if no drive information (serial #, capacity, etc.) can be obtained. This field is always true for missing drives.

available.description: True if the drive is available for use in creating a new volume group; false otherwise. This field is valid for missing drives.

pfa.description: True if the drive is drive Predicted Failure analysis predicts a drive failure. This field is valid for missing drives.

driveRef.description: The identifier value for this drive. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the drive. This field is valid for missing drives.

status.description: An indication of the current status of the drive. This field is valid for missing drives.

cause.description: An indication of the reason for the current status of the drive. This field is most useful when the current status is something other than optimal; it identifies the event that caused the status to change to its current value. This field is valid for missing drives.

interfaceType.description: Information about the I/O interface between the controller and the drive. For example, for a SCSI-attached drive, this field will contain information about the drive's channel and SCSI ID values. For other interface types, different data will be available in this field.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the drive. Beginning with the Allegheny release, the parent reference in Location identifies the tray or drawer containing the drive, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component relative slot number of the drive, starting at 1. For missing drives this field contains the last known location.

manufacturer.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the drive manufacturer. Note that this information is not returned for most Serial ATA (SATA) drives.

manufacturerDate.description: The date of manufacture of the drive, represented in seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970. Note that this information is not returned for most Serial ATA (SATA) drives.

productID.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the product by name, as assigned by the manufacturer.

serialNumber.description: The variable-length ASCII text string for the serial number of the drive.

softwareVersion.description: This data is a variable-length ASCII text string. If an interposer is present in front of SATA drives, the string identifies the version of the interposer package. In this case, the SATA drive firmware version can be found in the physicalDriveTypeData field. If an interposer is not present (always the case for Fibre Channel drives) this field describes the drive firmware version.

blkSize.description: The block (i.e. sector) size used by the drive, represented in bytes. This field is valid for missing drives.

usableCapacity.description: The usable capacity of the drive, in bytes, after accounting for any space that is reserved for use by the array controller for overhead information. This field is valid for missing drives.

rawCapacity.description: The raw capacity of the drive, in bytes. This field is valid for missing drives.

worldWideName.description: A variable-length, opaque field that contains the drive's world-wide name, or globally unique identifier value. This field is valid for missing drives.

currentVolumeGroupRef.description: The reference value of the volume group, disk pool, or flash cache to which this drive is currently assigned. If a hot spare drive is actively sparing for a failed drive, this field will identify the volume group, disk pool, or flash cache that is using the hot spare drive. If the drive is not currently assigned, or is an idle hot spare, the reference value will be null. This field is valid for missing drives.

sparedForDriveRef.description: The reference value of the drive for which this drive is acting as a hot spare. This field is only used if the Drive object represents a global hot spare that is actively sparing for a failed drive. This field is valid for missing drives.

mirrorDrive.description: This field is only used if the Drive object represents a drive that is part of a RAID-1 volume group. It identifies the drive that is tied to this one for RAID-1 mirroring operations. This field is valid for missing drives.

nonRedundantAccess.description: True if the drive does not have redundant access.

workingChannel.description: The channel to the tray that is still operational (if nonRedundantAccess is True).

volumeGroupIndex.description: The volume group index. This is the zero-relative position of the drive with respect to the stripe-ordering for the volume group. A value of -1 indicates that the drive does not belong to any group. This field is valid for missing drives.

currentSpeed.description: The speed of the drive. Will be unknown for a SCSI drive.

maxSpeed.description: The maximum speed of the drive. Currently not used.

uncertified.description: True, if the drive has the DR_UNCERTIFIED flag set. This field is valid for missing drives.

hasDegradedChannel.description: True, if a path to this drive is degraded.

spindleSpeed.description: The drive reported spindle speed. Solid State Disk (SSD) drives report zero.

rtrAttributes.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

phyDriveTypeData.description: Information specific to a physical drive type.

pfaReason.description: The reason a PFA condition has been raised for this drive.

bypassSource.description: A list of object references where each reference identifies the source of a drive bypass condition. Possible referenced objects include the drive itself, a controller, or the ESM(s). When the bypass source is a controller or the drive, the list will typically hold just one reference; when the bypass source is the ESM(s), the list can hold up to two references, indicating either one or both ESMs. The list normally holds valid data whenever the drive is in the bypassed state (DRIVE_STAT_BYPASSED) , however it may be empty if the source of the bypass is unknown. It is also possible for the list to hold valid data when the drive is optimal, if only one ESM has bypassed the drive.

repairPolicy.description: This field contains the repair policy for the Drive.

fdeCapable.description: True if the drive supports FDE, false otherwise

fdeEnabled.description: true if drive security is enabled; false if disabled

fdeLocked.description: True if the drive is locked, false if the drive is unlocked

lockKeyID.description: The lock key ID as read from the drive.

ssdWearLife.description: Contains wear life data for the SSD drive.

driveMediaType.description: This field is set to the drive media type of the drive.

fpgaVersion.description: This data is a variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the version of the FPGA package.

protectionInformationCapabilities.description: This structure contains a protectionInformationCapable field which is set to true when the drive is formatted to support type 2 protection with a 512-byte logical block size, or if the drive is a type 0 drive formatted with a 520-byte logical block size. It also contains a field that is set to the protection type provided for the drive.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

protectionType.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

interposerPresent.description: A value of true for this property means the drive is behind an interposer.

interposerRef.description: The drive interposer identifier. This field is valid only if the interposerPresent field is set to True.

currentCommandAgingTimeout.description: The current command aging timeout value in hundreds of milliseconds. If this value is 0 the default command aging timeout value will be used, otherwise this value overrides the default value.

defaultCommandAgingTimeout.description: The default command aging timeout value in hundreds of milliseconds as specified by the drive. If this value is 0, the drive command aging timeout cannot be changed.

driveTemperature.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

blkSizePhysical.description: The physical block (i.e., sector) size for the drive, represented in bytes. This field is valid for missing drives.

lowestAlignedLBA.description: The lowest aligned LBA for the physical sector. Typically this will be 0, but could be non-zero for emulation drives where LBA 0 starts at some logical sector offset within the physical sector.

removed.description: True if the drive is in the process of being removed from the volume group. Only applies to Disk Pools

locateInProgress.description: Indicates that a locate operation for the device is currently active. The device will show a visual indication to aid an operator in locating the drive.

fipsCapable.description: This flag is true if the drive supports FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standard). FIPS 140-2 specification.

dulbeCapable.description: An indication as to whether the drive supports DULBE

sanitizeCapable.description: An indication as to whether the drive supports Sanitize operations.

driveSecurityType.description: This enumeration distinguishes between different security capabilities of a drive.

currentTemp.description: The current drive temperature (in degrees Celsius).

refTemp.description: Reference temperature (maximum safe operating temperature in degrees Celsius).

driveType.description: This enumeration type is used to distinguish between the different I/O protocols used by the controller to communicate with drives. This is not necessarily the same as the physical drive interface type (PhysicalDriveType).

fibre.description: This field is present only if the driveType value is DRIVE_TYPE_FIBRE. It contains the address information for a Fibre Channel drive. Such drives are typically multi-ported, so there will be one element in this variable-length array for each I/O port on the drive. The first element in the array is the drive address on the preferred channel, and the second element is the drive address on the redundant channel.

sas.description: This field is present only if the driveType value is DRIVE_TYPE_SAS. It contains the address information for a serial-attached SCSI drive.

scsi.description: This field is present only if the driveType value is DRIVE_TYPE_SCSI. It contains the address information for a SCSI drive.

nvme.description: This field is present only if the driveType value is DRIVE_TYPE_NVME_DIRECT_PCIE. It contains the address information for NVMe drives connected to a PCIe interface.

channel.description: The controller drive-side channel number used to access the drive via this interface.

loopID.description: The drive's Fibre Channel loop ID value on the given channel.

trayRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

slot.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

locationParent.description: An object reference that identifies the parent physical component (e.g., Tray, CRU, etc.) of the object containing the Location attribute.

locationPosition.description: The parent-relative/like-component relative position of the object containing the Location attribute.

label.description: Label associated with the location (i.e., label printed on the canister or the enclosure).

deviceName.description: The NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) representing the drive itself.

drivePortAddresses.description: A list of the NVMe drive port addresses associated with the drive.

channel.description: The number of the NVMe interface channel that the drive port is connected to.

nvmeControllerIdentifier.description: Contains the NVMe subsystem unique controller identifier associated with this NVMe drive port.

refType.description: This enumeration identifies the different types of object references.

controllerRef.description: A ControllerRef that refers to the object. Controllers are identified separately from other SYMbol objects because their refs require special handling by the firmware. This field is only valid if refType is equal to OBJ_REF_CONTROLLER.
