symbolRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

typedReference.description: A reference to a SYMbol object that includes object type information. This value is only present if the discriminator refType is set to OBJ_REF_GENERIC_TYPED.

type.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

parentController.description: This field contains a reference to the parent controller. It is only valid if the type field is equal to PARENT_CRU_TYPE_CONTROLLER.

parentEsm.description: This field contains a reference to the parent ESM. It is only valid if the type field is equal to PARENT_CRU_TYPE_ESM.

parentFan.description: This field contains a reference to the parent Fan. It is only valid if the type field is equal to PARENT_CRU_TYPE_FAN.

parentInterconnectCru.description: This field contains a reference to the parent interconnect CRU. It is only valid if the type field is equal to PARENT_CRU_TYPE_ICC_CRU.

parentSupportCru.description: This field contains a reference to the parent support CRU. It is only valid if the type field is equal to PARENT_CRU_TYPE_SUPPORT_CRU.

parentDrawer.description: This field contains a reference to the parent drawer. It is only valid if the type field is equal to PARENT_CRU_TYPE_DRAWER.

phyDriveType.description: This enumeration object is used to describe the physical interface of the drive. This is not necessarily the same as the I/O protocol interface used by the controller to communicate with the drive (DriveType). In addition, the supportedDriveTypes array in the FeatureParams structure will contain values from this enumeration identifying which drive types are supported on the storage array.

sataDriveAttributes.description: This field identifies the attributes of SATA drives It is only present if the phyDriveType field is equal to PHY_DRIVE_TYPE_SATA.

hasReadyToRemoveIndicator.description: True if the component has a ready-to-remove LED.

readyToRemove.description: True if the component is ready to remove.

cruType.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

parentCru.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

rtrAttributeData.description: This field contains the actual settings for the ready-to-remove data. It is only present when the cruType field is set to CRU_TYPE_DEDICATED.

removalData.description: This field contains the removal data for the component. This primary piece of data is a removal method. Additional "ready-to-remove" attributes may be defined, depending on the removal method.

replacementMethod.description: This field defines the "replacement method" for the component.

channel.description: The controller drive-side SCSI channel on which the drive resides.

averageEraseCountPercent.description: The percentage of average erase count.

spareBlocksRemainingPercent.description: The percentage of spare blocks remaining in the solid state drive. Controller firmware checks and updates this percentage approximately once per hour.

isWearLifeMonitoringSupported.description: This field is set to true if wear life monitoring is supported on the drive. If true then the values in the other fields in this structure are valid, otherwise they are not valid.

percentEnduranceUsed.description: The percentage of endurance used for this drive. The value is obtained from the Solid State Media log page. A value of PERCENTAGE_ENDURANCE_USED_UNKNOWN indicates that the information is inaccessible or not populated in this release.

deviceName.description: The SAS address representing the device itself.

drivePortAddresses.description: The SAS addresses of drive ports 0 and 1. The first element in the array is the drive address on the preferred channel, and the second element is the drive address on the redundant channel.

channel.description: The number of the channel where the drive port is located.

portIdentifier.description: The SAS address of the drive port.

translatorData.description: This field provides information about the SCSI-to-ATA translator hardware.

ataDiskModelNumber.description: This field is the disk model number as reported in the ATA protocol.

ataDiskFwRevision.description: This field is the disk firmware revision number as reported in the ATA protocol.

productRevLevel.description: The product revision level string. When no interposer card is available, this string is set to "----" (four dashes).

satType.description: This field identifies the type of the SCSI-to-ATA translation hardware. Note that if this field is set to SAT_TYPE_UNKNOWN, the string in the productId field will have zero length, and the string in the productRevLevel field will be set to "----" (four dashes).

componentType.description: An enumeration value indicating the type of component that the reference refers to.

symbolRef.description: A SYMbol reference that refers to an instance of an object of the type identified by componentType. If the component type is "storage array," this field is a null reference. This is because an object graph describes a single instance of a storage array, so there is no need to uniquely identify instances.

UnreadableSectorEntryResult.description: Identifies the location of an unreable sector.

UnreadableSectorResponse.description: The list of unreadable drive sectors

DriveSecuritySettingsResponse.description: Reports security settings for a given drive.

selectedSpindleSpeeds.description: Only select drives with these spindle speeds

fdeDisabledOnly.description: True to filter out FDE enabled drives, otherwise false.

driveCapacityMin.description: Only consider drives with at least this minimum raw capacity in SizeUnits

driveType.description: Only consider drives of this media type

interfaceType.description: Only consider drives of this interface type

protectionInformationCapable.description: Only consider drives that have Data Assurance capability.

sizeUnit.description: Use this unit for any capacity based parameters

raidLevel.description: The intended RAID level for the storage-pool.

targetUsableCapacity.description: The aggregate capacity of the selected drives must be at least this many SizeUnits

driveOperations.description: A list of drives undergoing erase operation

timeToCompletion.description: Estimated time to completion in minutes
Estimated time to completion in minutes

observedTime.description: End time for this collection as measured by the number of seconds since baseTime.

DiskIOStats.description: Drive I/O performance statistics. Note: the DELETE method clears all statistics  for all drives.

auditLogMaxRecords.description: The maximum number of audit log records to be retained.

auditLogLevel.description: If set to 'all', records for all GET, POST, DELETE and PUT executed endpoints will be logged.  If set to 'writeOnly', only records for PUT, DELETE and POST executed endpoints will be logged.

auditLogFullPolicy.description: If set to 'overWrite' and the maximum number of log records has been reached, older records will be automatically deleted so that new log records can be added.  If set to 'preventSystemAccess' and the maximum number of audit log records has been reached, log records will have to be deleted manually before new log records can be added.

auditLogWarningThresholdPct.description: Indicates how full the audit log can get before a MEL event is generated.  This value must be between 60 and 90.

firstRecordDate.description: First record date in the form of 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ'

lastRecordDate.description: Last record date in the form of 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ'

totalDeletedRecords.description: Total number of audit log records deleted

totalLogRecords.description: Total audit log records available in the database

firstRecordOrdinal.description: First record ordinalDeprecated: This field isn't overly useful since the ordinal values are currently unstable and are relative based on the records returned.

lastRecordOrdinal.description: Last record ordinal. Deprecated: This field isn't overly useful since the ordinal values are currently unstable and are relative based on the records returned.

method.description: HTTP method, for example GET and POST.

userId.description: Username of the user accessing the URL.

httpStatus.description: HTTP status code of the operation.

isFederated.description: Indicates if the user was authenticated by WSP in a federated security environment.

cliReturnStatus.description: CLI status code or request for input files.

timestamp.description: Date and time of accessed URL in seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970.

dateTime.description: Date and time of accessed URL in the form of 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ'

AuditLogMessagesRequest.description: Object used when requesting messages from the Audit Log

iomServiceEnabled.description: Reports whether the IOM service is enabled.

disruptiveIomFirmwareUpdate.description: Reports whether there are any trays for which an IOM firmware update would be disruptive.

IomServiceInfoResponse.description: API object that includes information about the IOM service.

enabled.description: true to enable the service, false to disable.

IomServiceUpdateRequest.description: API object for an IOM service change request.

signatureTestingPassed.description: Indicates if the initial signature validation test passed or not.  Full validation will still be performed by the controller before the download can complete.

downgrade.description: Indicates whether the download is a downgrade

advancedDowngrade.description: Indicates whether the download is an advanced downgrade. The CLI or Rest API must be used to perform an advanced downgrade. It is recommended to contact your Technical Support Engineer  before attempting an advanced downgrade

versionContents.description: Enumerates all the versions on the bundle/nvsram file and what is on the controller

EmbeddedCompatibilityCheckResponse.description: Reports the compatibility of the firmware/nvsram file and whether a signature is present on the file

VersionContent.description: Object that contains definitions for on board and bundled code module versions

CurrentFirmwareResponse.description: Class that holds details on the Firmware on the array.

UpgradeLogRecord.description: Class that holds details on the upgrade log messages

cfwUpgradeTS.description: Timestamp of the last successful controller firmware upgrade

iomUpgradeTS.description: Timestamp of the last successful iom firmware upgrade

driveUpgradeTS.description: Timestamp of the last successful drive firmware upgrade

nvsramUpgradeTS.description: Timestamp of the last successful NVSRAM upgrade

cfwLog.description: Array of log records for controller firmware upgrades

iomLog.description: Array of log records for iom firmware upgrades

driveLog.description: Array of log records for drive firmware upgrades

nvsramLog.description: Array of log records for NVSRAM upgrades

UpgradeLogsResponse.description: Class that holds details on the firmware upgrade timestamps and log messages.

adminPasswordSet.description: True if the admin password is set

userName.description: The username for this local account

roles.description: The list of roles assigned to this user

passwordSet.description: True if the password is not the default

LocalUserResponse.description: Information about a local user account

userName.description: The local account user to update

newPassword.description: The new password to use for local account.

LocalUserPasswordRequest.description: Request to change the local user account password

updates.description: List of updates to perform to local users

LocalUserRequest.description: Request to change one or more local user account password

minimumSessionInactivePeriod.description: Minimum session inactivity period, in seconds.

sessionInactivePeriod.description: Session inactivity period, in seconds, before the session times out. A value of zero indicates the session should never timeout.
Session inactivity period, in seconds, before the session times out. A value of zero indicates the session should never timeout.

disableBasicAuthentication.description: Disable Basic Authentication, a value of false will allow Basic Authentication, a value of true will prevent Basic Authentication.

EventObjectIdentifier.description: This class identifies an object in the system.  It is an Object Type and an Object Key.  The get is usually the fields named "id" or xxxRef in the object.  The type field indicates the type of object

status.description: Status of the firmware operation

addedObjects.description: List of objects added.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

modifiedObjects.description: List of objects updated.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

deletedObjects.description: List of objects deleted.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

addedObjects.description: List of objects added.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

modifiedObjects.description: List of objects updated.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

deletedObjects.description: List of objects deleted.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

addedObjects.description: List of objects added.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

modifiedObjects.description: List of objects updated.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

deletedObjects.description: List of objects deleted.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

addedObjects.description: List of objects added.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

modifiedObjects.description: List of objects updated.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

deletedObjects.description: List of objects deleted.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

currentConfigGen.description: The config gen number associated to the with these events.

previousConfigGen.description: The config gen number that was currently known.  It is possible for there to be a gap between currentConfig and previous      Don't expect them to be sequential

systemWWN.description: The storage systems World Wide Name

allOf.description: Indicates the an Object Graph update occurred.  An Object Graph Update corresponds to a change in the Config Gen Number in the object graph

stagedFwValid.description: False, staged FW areas on the controllers are not valid and cannot be activated. True, the staged FW areas on the controllers are valid and can be activated.

fwVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

appVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

bootVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

nvsramVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

timeStamp.description: Timestamp when the staged FW was downloaded

nvsramVersionString.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

codeVersions.description: Version descriptors for staged code modules

addedObjects.description: List of objects added.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

modifiedObjects.description: List of objects updated.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

deletedObjects.description: List of objects deleted.  Only certain objects that have rest endpoints will be represented in this list.      See Event ObjectTypes for types of objects that have events

successful.description: Indicates if the symbol command executed successfully.

returnCode.description: The return code returned by the symbol command.

EKMSCommunicationResponse.description: Indicates whether the symbol command executed successfully along with the return code from the symbol command.

commonName.description: Typically pre-populated with the storage array name

organizationName.description: The full legal name of the organization

organizationalUnitName.description: The division of the organization handling the certificate

localityName.description: City or Locality for the organization

stateProvinceName.description: The full name of the state or province for the organization

countryName.description: The two letter country ISO code for the organization

ExternalKeyManagerCSR.description: This class describes the input for a Certificate Signing Request needed to create a client side certificate for External Key Manager integration

keyServerAddress.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

port.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

keyServers.description: Array of KeyServers to send requests

EnableExternalKeyServerRequest.description: Used to set the parameters necessary to communicate with an external key management server.

addressType.description: This enumeration defines the different types of IP addresses, corresponding to different versions of the Internet protocol.

ipv4Address.description: An IP address formatted according to version 4 of the Internet protocol. This field is only present if addressType is equal to IPV4.

ipv6Address.description: An IP address formatted according to version 6 of the Internet protocol. This field is only present if addressType is equal to IPV6.

kmsAddress.description: The address of the key server.

kmsPort.description: The port number of the key server.

addrType.description: This enum defines the possible network address types.

domainName.description: Fully qualified domain name. This should be considered an IDN-unaware domain name slot as per RFC3490.

X509ExternalCertInfo.description: Basic information for X509 External certificates stored in the system.

lockKeyId.description: The id of the lock key.

oldLockKeyId.description: The id of the old lock key if a delete operation on the KMS server was attempted but failed.

passPhrase.description: The passPhrase for the security key that will be created

ekmsOption.description: Indicates if EKMS should be enabled, disabled or the key should be changed

skipBackup.description: If true, will skip creating a backup of the security key. This step can only be skipped for external key management.

EnableDisableEkmsRequest.description: Used to enable/disable EKMS and generate new security keys

objectRef.description: The object that has the failure

objectType.description: The type of object described in objectData

objectData.description: The data for the object, equivalent to fetching the object via its URL

extraData.description: Supporting data used to debug the failure.  This will vary by failureType

FailureData.description: A failure currently active on the storage system

checkRunning.description: True if the compatibility check is currently running

cancelled.description: True if the check was cancelled by a user

lastStart.description: The last time that a compatibility check was started, null if it has not been initiated yet

inaccessibleStorageDevices.description: The list of devices that could not be contacted

requestId.description: The unique identifier for this request

failedStorageDevices.description: The list of devices that the call failed on

cfwFiles.description: The list of compatible controller firmware files

nvsramFiles.description: The list of compatible nvsram files

storageDeviceIds.description: List of storage devices to find compatible firmware for.

releasedBuildsOnly.description: Only consider released firmware builds as valid firmware files

label.description: The user-assigned label of the flash cache.

status.description: The status of the flash cache.

analyticsCause.description: The flash cache analytics status cause.

flashCacheType.description: This enumeration identifies the type of flash cache.

fcWithDrives.description: Test results are returned if the flashCacheType does not equal FC_TYPE_VIRTUAL.

wwn.description: The WWN of the high level flash cache volume.

flashCacheRef.description: A reference to the high level flash cache volume.

flashCacheBase.description: Contains the base-level Flash Cache attributes pertaining to all types of Flash Caches.

fcDriveInfo.description: Drive information for the flash cache.

cachedVolumes.description: A list of references of volumes and thin volumes that are associated with this FlashCache

driveRefs.description: The list of drives associated with this FlashCache

securityType.description: The security type of the drives.

protectionInformationCapabilities.description: The protection information capabilities of the drives.

usedCapacity.description: The used capacity of the drives (in bytes).

securityLevel.description: Refines the information in the securityType field to describe the set of drives.

driveRefs.description: A list of one or more drive refs belonging to SSD drives that will be utilized in the FlashCache

name.description: The user label for the FlashCache

enableExistingVolumes.description: If true, all existing volumes that are mapped will have flash cache enabled

name.description: The new name for the FlashCache

configType.description: The usage configuration for the flashCache

portRef.description: A reference to this channel port.

portParent.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

portNumber.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

channel.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

channelType.description: The type of the associated channel - either host-side or drive-side.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the channel port. The parent reference in Location identifies the physical CRU where the port is located, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-port relative number of the port, starting at 1.

isTrunkActive.description: This field is true if a trunk connection has been established and is being maintained on this controller or ESM channel port. This field is always false if the channel port is on a controller or ESM that does not have a Fibre Channel I/O interface type, or if the channel port is associated with a host-side channel.

channelList.description: The list of channels associated with this ChannelPort

type.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

controllerRef.description: This field is present only if the type field is equal to CHANNEL_PORT_PARENT_CONTROLLER.

esmRef.description: This field is present only if the type field is equal to CHANNEL_PORT_PARENT_ESM.

minihubRef.description: This field is present only if the type field is equal to CHANNEL_PORT_PARENT_MINIHUB.

hicRef.description: This field is present only if the type field is equal to CHANNEL_PORT_PARENT_HIC.

speedDetError.description: This is set to true only if speed detection has failed.

manuallyBypassed.description: This is set to true if the port is bypassed.

portNumber.description: This is the ChannelPort port number, 1 based.

containerServicesCapable.description: True is this controller is capable of running container based applications.

containerServicesEnabled.description: True if this controller is configured to run container based applications.

active.description: True if the controller is in active mode; false otherwise.

quiesced.description: True if the controller is quiesced.

status.description: An indication of the current status of the controller.

controllerRef.description: The identifier value for this controller. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the controller.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the controller. The parent reference in Location identifies the tray that physically houses the controller, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component relative slot number of the controller, starting at one.

manufacturer.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the controller manufacturer.

manufacturerDate.description: The date of manufacture of the controller, represented in seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970.

appVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

bootVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

productID.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the product by name, as assigned by the manufacturer.

serialNumber.description: The variable-length ASCII text string for the serial number of the controller.

boardID.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that represents the board identifier (i.e. board type) of the controller.

cacheMemorySize.description: The memory size, in MB, that will be used by the controller as cache memory.

processorMemorySize.description: The size of the controller's CPU memory, in MB.

hostInterfaces.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

driveInterfaces.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

netInterfaces.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

inventory.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

hostBoardID.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

physicalCacheMemorySize.description: The physical cache memory size in MB

readyToRemove.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

boardSubmodelID.description: The board sub-model ID of the controller card

submodelSupported.description: Set to true if the sub-model feature is supported

oemPartNumber.description: The OEM-specified part number of the controller canister

partNumber.description: The part number of the controller board itself.

rtrAttributes.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

bootTime.description: The timestamp value for the time at which the controller last booted. Note that this value may be different for the other controller in the storage array. This value is defined as the number of seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970.

modelName.description: The model name associated with the controller. A model name is an identifier that is associated with each unique combination of base controller board and host interface card(s).

networkSettings.description: A collection of network-related settings that apply to this controller.

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the controller.

flashCacheMemorySize.description: The total flash cache memory size (in GB) currently in use on the controller.

ctrlIocDumpData.description: This structure contains information regarding the state of an IOC data dump -- if it needs to be retrieved, and the tag and timestamp of the dump.

locateInProgress.description: Indicates that a locate operation for the device is currently active. The device will show a visual indication to aid an operator in locating the tray.

hasTrayIdentityIndicator.description: The device contains 7-segment indicators used to display the Tray Identity.

controllerErrorMode.description: Indicates the error mode in which the controller is operating. A value of 0 indicates the controller is not operating in an error mode.

codeVersions.description: Version descriptors for loaded code modules

containerServicesConfiguration.description: Container services configuration information for this controller.

dhcpAcquiredDnsServers.description: DNS servers provided by the DHCP responses. Will be non-empty only if at least one of the Controller's network ports is set to acquire its address via DHCP and the DHCP response included one or more DNS servers to use. The presence of these servers does not imply their use. These DNS servers will only be used if the acquisition type is set to DHCP.

dhcpAcquiredNtpServers.description: NTP servers provided by the DHCP responses. Will be non-empty only if at least one of the Controller's network ports is set to acquire its address via DHCP and the DHCP response included one or more NTP servers. The presence of these servers does not imply their use. These NTP servers will only be used if the NTP acquisition type is set to DHCP.

ipv4DefaultRouterAddress.description: The IPV4 static default router address for the controller (sometimes referred to as the "gateway address").

ipv6DefaultRouterAddress.description: The IPV6 static default router address and associated data for the controller.

ipv6CandidateDefaultRouterAddresses.description: The set of IPV6 candidate default router addresses for the controller.

remoteAccessEnabled.description: True if enabled for remote access

sshKeyAndPasswordRequired.description: If true, both an SSH key and a password are required for remote access. If false, remote login via password will be permitted, as well as remote login via any authorized keys. If 'remoteAccessEnabled' is false, this setting has no effect.

interfaceRef.description: Interface ref

channel.description: Interface channel

physicalLocation.description: Physical location, in this case internal.

protectionInformationCapable.description: Is PI capable.

iocDumpNeedsRetrieved.description: If true, an IOC Dump currently exists in controller memory and has not been retrieved.

iocDumpTag.description: The tag value of the IOC Dump currently in controller memory. Each dump has a unique tag value. A value of IOC_DUMP_NULL_TAG indicates there is no IOC Dump to retrieve.

timeStamp.description: The time that the dump was collected measured in seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970.

dnsAcquisitionType.description: How the DNS addresses were acquired.

dnsServers.description: This field is used if the method is set to DNS_ACQUISITION_METHOD_STATIC. If more than one address is specified, the first (lowest index) item is given highest precedence and the last item (highest index) is given the lowest precedence.

driveOrientation.description: The drive orientation in the drawer or tray.

numRows.description: The number of rows in the drive layout. If driveOrientation field is set to "None", the value of this field should be zero.

numColumns.description: The number of columns in the drive layout. If driveOrientation field is set to "None", the value of this field should be zero.

primaryTraversal.description: The primary traversal method for the drawer or tray. If driveOrientation field is set to "None", the value of this field should be TRAVERSAL_NONE

secondaryTraversal.description: The secondary traversal method for the drawer or tray. If driveOrientation field is set to "None", the value of this field should be TRAVERSAL_NONE

ioInterfaceType.description: This enumeration defines the different I/O interface types that may be reported as part of the configuration information associated with a controller.

portList.description: A list of detailed information for each port.

esmRef.description: The reference for this physical ESM.

status.description: The operational status for this ESM.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the ESM. The parent reference in Location identifies the tray containing the ESM, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component relative slot number of the ESM, starting at 1.

nonRedundantAccess.description: True if the ESM does not have redundant access.

partNumber.description: The part number of the ESM.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the ESM.

manufacturerDate.description: The date the ESM was manufactured.

manufacturer.description: The date the ESM was manufactured.

fruType.description: The field replaceable unit type of the ESM.

softwareVersion.description: The firmware version of the ESM.

esmInterfaceData.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

productID.description: The product identifier of the ESM.

workingChannel.description: The channel to the tray that is still operational (if nonRedundantAccess is True).

currentSpeed.description: The current speed of the ESM.

maxSpeed.description: The maximum speed of the ESM.

fibreEsm.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

rtrAttributes.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

isSupported.description: This field is set to true if the ESM supports version reporting and downloading of factory default settings, and false otherwise. A setting of false in this field can mean either (1) the ESM is a legacy ESM for which the version-reporting feature is unavailable or (2) the ESM is capable of supporting version-reporting, but is not running the correct firmware version to do so.

ipv6AddressConfigMethod.description: The method by which the IPV6 address information is configured for the interface.

fullDuplex.description: If set to true, the interface is operating in full duplex mode; otherwise, it is operating in half-duplex mode.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the Ethernet interface. The parent reference in Location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st ethernet interface relative to the parent," "2nd ethernet interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

isNetworkTraceCapable.description: Can capture network traces if true.

macAddress.description: The Ethernet MAC address associated with the interface.

fullDuplex.description: If set to true, the interface is operating in full duplex mode; otherwise, it is operating in half-duplex mode.

maximumFramePayloadSize.description: The currently configured MTU for this interface

currentInterfaceSpeed.description: The speed of the interface, as currently configured by the user. This differs from the operational speed only when the speed is set to SPEED_AUTO

maximumInterfaceSpeed.description: The maximum speed supported by the interface.

linkStatus.description: The status of the network link for this interface.

supportedInterfaceSpeeds.description: A list of speeds supported by the Ethernet interface.

autoconfigSupport.description: If set to true, autoconfiguration is supported.

copperCableDiagnosticsSupport.description: If true, support is provided for copper cable diagnostics.

operationalInterfaceSpeed.description: Indicates the speed that the interface is currently operating

supportedFECModes.description: Supported FEC Modes for the interface

configuredFECMode.description: Configured FEC Mode for the interface

currentFECMode.description: Current FEC Mode for the interface

interfaceRef.description: The opaque data by which an instance of EthernetIoInterface is uniquely identified.

channel.description: The number of the channel controlled by this interface.

loopID.description: The loop ID of the ESM.

topology.description: The Fibre Channel topology type being used.

revision.description: The revision level of the Fibre Channel controller chip.

chanMiswire.description: True, if this channel is joined with another one.

esmMiswire.description: True, if an ESM miswire condition exists somewhere on this channel.

linkStatus.description: The status of the fibre channel link for this interface.

isDegraded.description: True if the channel associated with this interface is degraded.

speedControl.description: The speed of the interface in MB per sec. This field is deprecated. The fieldcurrentInterfaceSpeed should be used instead.

maxSpeed.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

speedNegError.description: True if speed negotiation could not complete.

ddsChannelState.description: The DDS state of this drive side channel: optimal, degraded, or failed.

isLocal.description: Set to True if there are channel ports physically attached to this controller.

The parent reference in location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st Fibre Channel interface relative to the parent," "2nd Fibre Channel interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

isTrunkCapable.description: This field is true if the Fibre interface on the controller board is trunk capable. This field is always false for host-side interfaces.

fc4Types.description: A list containing the currently supported FC-4 types for its associated channel port.

interfaceType.description: This enumeration defines the different I/O interface types that may be reported as part of the configuration information associated with a controller.

fibre.description: This field is present only if the interfaceType value is equal to IO_IF_FC. It contains the detailed interface information for a Fibre Channel I/O interface.

ib.description: This field is present only if the interfaceType value is equal to IO_IF_IB. It contains the detailed interface information for an Infiniband interface.

iscsi.description: This field is present only if the interface type value is equal to IO_IF_ISCSI. It contains the detailed interface information for an iSCSI I/O interface.

sas.description: This field is present only if the interfaceType value is equal to IO_IF_SAS. It contains the detailed interface information for a serial-attached SCSI I/O interface.

sata.description: This field is present only if the interfaceType value is equal to IO_IF_SATA. It contains the detailed interface information for a SATA I/O interface.

scsi.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

couplingDriverNvme.description: InterfaceTypeData for the NVMe based coupling driver used for our containerized product.

ethernet.description: This field is present only if the interfaceType value is equal to IO_IF_ETHERNET. It contains the detailed interface information for an Ethernet I/O interface.

pcie.description: This field is present only if the interfaceType value is equal to IO_IF_PCIE. It contains the detailed interface information for a PCIe IO interface.

interfaceRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

channel.description: The number of the host channel associated with this interface.

channelPortRef.description: A reference to the channel port for the channel associated with this interface.

localIdentifier.description: The InfiniBand local identifier associated with this interface.

globalIdentifier.description: The InfiniBand global identifier associated with this interface.

linkState.description: The state of the InfiniBand link.

portState.description: The state of the InfiniBand port.

maximumTransmissionUnit.description: The size in bytes of the largest packet that the interface can transmit.

currentSpeed.description: The speed at which the interface is currently operating.

supportedSpeed.description: An array containing the different speeds at which the interface is capable of operating.

currentLinkWidth.description: The width at which the link is currently operating, e.g., 1 means "1X," 4 means "4X,".etc.

supportedLinkWidth.description: An array containing the different link widths at which the link is capable of operating.

currentDataVirtualLanes.description: The number of data virtual lanes that are currently active for this interface.

maximumDataVirtualLanes.description: The maximum number of data virtual lanes supported by the interface.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the Infiniband interface. The parent reference in Location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st Infiniband interface relative to the parent," "2nd Infiniband interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field indicates whether or not the I/O interface is PI capable.

isSRPSupported.description: This flag is true if SRP (SCSI RDMA Protocol) is currently supported.

isISERSupported.description: This flag is true if iSER (iSCSI Extensions for RDMA) is currently supported.

physPortState.description: This element contains the current state of the physical Infiniband port.

bidirectionalMaxRate.description: Maximum bi-directional data rate in B/s

isIser.description: If true, iSER (iSCSI Extensions for RDMA) is active and a corresponding IBInterface object exists

ipv4Address.description: The various IPV4 address-related elements (IP address, gateway IP address, and subnet mask), along with the state of their configuration.

ipv4AddressConfigMethod.description: IPV4 configuration method for the endpoint; always STATIC for iSER interfaces.

ipv4OutboundPacketPriority.description: Priority associate with outbound IPV4 packets; always disabled for iSER interfaces.

ipv4VlanId.description: Value of IPV4 VLAN id for the interface; always disabled for iSER interfaces.

ipv4AddressData.description: The various IPV4 address-related elements (IP address, gateway IP address, and subnet mask), along with the state of their configuration.

ipv6LocalAddresses.description: The set of IPV6 local addresses that have been assigned to the iSCSI Ethernet port.

ipv6RoutableAddresses.description: The set of IPV6 routable addresses that have been assigned to the iSCSI Ethernet port

ipv6PortRouterAddress.description: The IPV6 address of the port router.

ipv6AddressConfigMethod.description: The method by which the IPV6 address information is configured for the endpoint.

ipv6OutboundPacketPriority.description: Settings that govern the priority to associate with outbound IPV6 packets sent over the interface

ipv6VlanId.description: Settings that govern the value of the IPV6 VLAN identifier for the interface. VLAN identifiers are in the range 1 through 4094.

ipv6HopLimit.description: The hop limit to use in IPV6 packets sent over the interface.

ipv6NdReachableTime.description: A "neighbor discovery" parameter - the amount of time in milliseconds, within which a neighbor is assumed to be reachable.

ipv6NdRetransmitTime.description: A "neighbor discovery" parameter - the number of milliseconds between neighbor solicitation probes.

ipv6NdStaleTimeout.description: A "neighbor discovery" parameter - the time in milliseconds after which information for a neighbor that cannot be verified as reachable will be considered "stale."

ipv6DuplicateAddressDetectionAttempts.description: The number of neighbor-solicitation messages to send in trying to determine IP address uniqueness.

itemName.description: An ASCII string that provides the symbolic name of the item.

itemVersion.description: An ASCII string that represents the current version, or revision level, of the item.

configState.description: Configuration state for the various address elements; always IP_CONFIG_STATE_CONFIGURED for iSER interfaces.

ipv4Address.description: The IPV4 address associated with the endpoint.

ipv4SubnetMask.description: IPV4 subnet mask associated w/ the endpoint; used for iSER interfaces.

ipv4GatewayAddress.description: IPV4 gateway address associated w/ the endpoint; used for iSER interfaces.

addressState.description: The state of the IPV6 address.

addressType.description: This enumeration defines the two different types of IPV6 addresses - interface or router.

interfaceAddressState.description: The interface address state. This field is only valid if addressType is equal to IPV6_ADDR_TYPE_INTERFACE.

routerAddressState.description: The router address state. This field is only valid if addressType is equal to IPV6_ADDR_TYPE_ROUTER.

channel.description: The number of the channel controlled by this interface.

channelPortRef.description: A reference to the channel port object associated with the channel controlled by this interface.

tcpListenPort.description: The number of the TCP port on which the target listens for incoming connections.

ipv4Enabled.description: True if IPV4 is enabled for this interface; always true for iSER interface.

interfaceType.description: This enumeration defines the different network interface types that may be reported as part of the interface information associated with a controller.

ethernet.description: This field is present only if the interfaceType value is equal to NET_IF_ETHERNET. It contains the detailed interface information for an Ethernet network interface.

ntpAcquisitionType.description: How the NTP server addresses are acquired.

ntpServers.description: This field is used if the method is set to NTP_ACQUISITION_METHOD_STATIC. If more than one address is specified, the first (lowest index) item is given highest precedence and the last item (highest index) is given the lowest precedence.

channel.description: The number of the channel corresponding to this interface.

interfaceRef.description: The unique identifier for a given instance of this structure.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the PCIe interface. The parent reference in Location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st PCIe interface relative to the parent," "2nd PCIe interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

bidirectionalMaxRate.description: Maximum bi-directional data rate in Bytes/second

maximumInterfaceSpeed.description: The maximum interface speed of the PCIe interface.

ethernetData.description: This field contains information about an Ethernet physical interface It is only present if the type field is equal to PHYSICAL_INTERFACE_ETHERNET.

portStatus.description: An indication of the status of the fibre channel port.

portType.description: An indication of the type of fibre channel port.

ports.description: A variable-length array of Port objects.

channel.description: The channel number of this channel

currentInterfaceSpeed.description: The current interface speed of the SATA interface.

maximumInterfaceSpeed.description: The maximum interface speed of the SATA interface.

speedControl.description: An indicator of how the device speed is controlled.

part.description: A string indicating the chip type.

revision.description: The revision level of the SATA part.

The parent reference in Location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st SATA interface relative to the parent," "2nd SATA interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field indicates whether or not the I/O interface is PI capable.

channel.description: The channel number of this interface.

scsiID.description: The SCSI ID value used by the controller on this interface.

speed.description: The speed of the interface in MB/sec.

scsiType.description: The type of SCSI line driver (e.g. SE, LVD, etc.) being used.

width.description: The transfer width of the SCSI bus, in bits.

part.description: An ASCII text string that describes the SCSI controller chip type.

revision.description: The revision level of the SCSI controller chip.

channel.description: The number of the channel where the SAS-attached device is located.

channelType.description: An indication of which "side" the channel is on - host or drive.

sasAttachedDeviceData.description: This field contains information that explicitly identifies the SAS-attached device.

type.description: This enumeration specifies the different kinds of devices that may be attached to a SAS port.

alternateController.description: A reference to the alternate controller that is the attached device. This field is only present if type equals SAS_ATTACHED_DEV_ALTERNATE_CONTROLLER.

drive.description: A reference to a drive that is the attached device. This field is only present if type equals SAS_ATTACHED_DEV_DRIVE.

expander.description: A reference to the SAS expander that is the attached device. This field is only present if type equals SAS_ATTACHED_DEV_EXPANDER.

remoteHostPortAddress.description: The SAS address of the port in the host computer that is the attached device. This field is only present if type equals SAS_ATTACHED_DEV_HOST.

localController.description: A reference to the local controller that is the attached device. This field is only present if type equals SAS_ATTACHED_DEV_LOCAL_CONTROLLER.

physicalLocation.description: The tray-slot location of a device of unknown type. This field is only present if type equals SAS_ATTACHED_DEV_UNKNOWN.

sasExpander.description: This field is a collection of references to objects representing the SAS expanders that physically reside on the ESM.

expanderRef.description: The reference value that uniquely identifies the SAS expander.

parent.description: The reference value that uniquely identifies the parent (controller or ESM) of the SAS expander.

channel.description: The drive channel location of the expander

deviceName.description: The SAS address that is the expander device name

vendorId.description: The Inquiry vendor identification string for the SAS expander.

productId.description: The Inquiry product identification string for the SAS expander.

fwVersion.description: The version of the firmware on the SAS expander.

expanderPorts.description: List of ports that are part of this expander.

domainNumber.description: The domain number identifies which SAS domain this element is a part of. Domain numbers are arbitrarily assigned by the firmware and are consistent on a per controller basis -- but not across controllers. So, the contents of domains will be consistent across controllers but the number identifying a particular domain may not be.

expanderParentType.description: This enumeration specifies the different types of parent elements a SAS expander may have.

parentController.description: A reference to the parent controller of the SAS expander. This field is present only if the expanderParentType value is SAS_EXPANDER_PARENT_CONTROLLER.

parentEsm.description: A reference to the parent ESM of the SAS expander. This field is present only if the expanderParentType value is SAS_EXPANDER_PARENT_ESM.

parentDrawer.description: A reference to the parent drawer of the SAS expander. This field is present only if the expanderParentType value is SAS_EXPANDER_PARENT_DRAWER.

channel.description: The number of the channel corresponding to this interface.

currentInterfaceSpeed.description: The current interface speed of the SAS interface.

maximumInterfaceSpeed.description: The maximum interface speed of the SAS interface.

part.description: A string indicating the chip type.

revision.description: The revision level of the firmware on the SAS I/O controller.

isDegraded.description: True if the channel corresponding to this interface is degraded.

iocPort.description: Information about the SAS I/O controller port corresponding to this interface.

interfaceRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the SAS interface. The parent reference in Location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st SAS interface relative to the parent," "2nd SAS interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field indicates whether or not the I/O interface is PI capable.

oneWayMaxRate.description: Maximum one way data rate in B/s

bidirectionalMaxRate.description: Maximum bi-directional data rate in B/s

phyIdentifier.description: A number in the range 0-127 that is the PHY identifier.

isOperational.description: True if the PHY is capable of normal operation.

parent.description: The device on which the port resides.

attachedDevice.description: An indication of what device is attached to this port.

state.description: The state of the SAS port.

miswireType.description: The type of miswire involving this port (or "none").

channelPortRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

sasPhys.description: A list of PHYs associated with this port.

portTypeData.description: Information about a SAS port that is type-dependent.

domainNumber.description: The domain number identifies which SAS domain this element is a part of. Domain numbers are arbitrarily assigned by the firmware and are consistent on a per controller basis -- but not across controllers. So, the contents of domains will be consistent across controllers but the number identifying a particular domain may not be.

attachedChannelPortRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

discoveryStatus.description: This element contains the status of the SAS discovery - the status is a bit field and could indicate a successful discovery or could indicate one or more failure conditions (indicated by one or more error flags being set).

nonOptimalCablingType.description: This value indicates the non optimal cabling type associated with this port object.

channelPortRefs.description: A list of channel port refs for external connections associated with this SasPort Object.

attachedChannelPortRefs.description: A list of attached channel port refs associated with this SasPort object where index <x> is associated with index <x> of channelPortRefs in this same SasPort object.

type.description: This enumeration object is used to identify the specific type of "port provider" device.

controller.description: A reference to a controller that is the port provider. This field is present only if the type field is equal to SAS_PORT_PROVIDER_CONTROLLER.

drive.description: A reference to a drive that is the port provider. This field is present only if the type field is equal to SAS_PORT_PROVIDER_DRIVE.

expander.description: A reference to a SAS expander that is the port provider. This field is present only if the type field is equal to SAS_PORT_PROVIDER_EXPANDER.

hostBoardRef.description: A reference to a SAS host board that is the port provider. This field is present only if the type field is equal to SAS_PORT_PROVIDER_HOSTBOARD.

portType.description: This enumeration specifies the different types of SAS ports.

portIdentifier.description: This field is the SAS address that is the port identifier. It is present only if the portType value is equal to SAS_PORT_TYPE_END_DEVICE.

routingType.description: This field indicates the routing method used on this port. It is present only if the portType value is equal to SAS_PORT_TYPE_EXPANDER.

isEnabled.description: True when the property is enabled.

type.description: An indication of the type of the tray.

orientation.description: An indication of the physical orientation (horizontal or vertical) of the tray.

numControllerSlots.description: The number of slots available for holding RAID controller boards (i.e., set to zero for a drive-only tray).

numDriveSlots.description: The total number of slots available for holding disk drives.

trayId.description: The tray identifier value, which is typically set using physical switches on the tray itself.

trayRef.description: The identifier value for this tray. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the tray.

nonRedundantAccess.description: True, if the tray does not have redundant access.

partNumber.description: The part number of the tray from VPD data.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the tray.

vendorName.description: The name of the manufacturer of the tray.

manufacturerDate.description: The date the tray was manufactured.

fruType.description: The field replaceable unit type of the tray.

trayIDMismatch.description: True if the IDs on the ESMs do not match.

trayIDConflict.description: True if this tray ID conflicts with that of another tray.

esmVersionMismatch.description: True if the ESM firmware versions do not match.

esmMiswire.description: True if this tray has an ESM join miswire.

drvMHSpeedMismatch.description: True if this tray has a drive-side minihub speed mismatch.

unsupportedTray.description: True if this tray is an unrecognized/unsupported hardware type.

workingChannel.description: The channel to the tray that is still operational (if nonRedundantAccess is True).

maxSpeed.description: The maximum speed of the drive channels,

trayTechnologyType.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

esmGroupError.description: True if SBOD ESM trays are not properly clustered.

uncertifiedTray.description: True if this tray is an uncertified hardware type.

locateTray.description: True if this tray supports a locate operation.

esmHardwareMismatch.description: True if the ESM hardware components in the tray are mismatched.

hasConfigurableTrayId.description: True if the tray ID can be set using the updateTray procedure.

frontEndInterfaceTechnology.description: The front-end I/O interface technology of the tray.

driveTechnologies.description: A list of drive technologies that are present in the tray.

numDriveCompartments.description: The number of drive compartments in the tray. Some drive trays are subdivided into "compartments," each having the same number of drive slots. Looking at the front of such an enclosure, multiple compartments are arranged side by side along one dimension, while drives within a compartment are arranged side by side along the other dimension, allowing for greater overall drive density within the constraints of a given enclosure form factor. (Even when arranged as a series of compartments, drive slot numbering is still relative to the entire tray.)

numDriveSlotsPerCompartment.description: The number of drive slots within an individual drive compartment.

trayAttributes.description: The tray attribute data (see setTrayAttributes procedure).

isMisconfigured.description: True, if the tray has invalid configuration settings.

esmFactoryDefaultsMismatch.description: True, if the two ESMs in the tray are reporting different version information for their factory default settings.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the tray. The parent reference in Location identifies the storage array itself, and the position field is the tray position number as identified in setSATrayPositions procedure call, or the constant TRAY_POSITION_UNKNOWN.

numDrawers.description: The total number of drawers available in the tray.

driveLayout.description: If the tray contains drawers, this field specifies the layout within the drawer. Otherwise, this field specifies the layout for the tray.

factoryDefaultsData.description: This field contains information about the version of the tray's factory default settings.

locateInProgress.description: Indicates that a locate operation for the device is currently active. The device will show a visual indication to aid an operator in locating the tray.

hasTrayIdentityIndicator.description: The device contains 7-segment indicators used to display the Tray Identity.

oemPartNumber.description: The OEM part number of the tray or chassis.

attributeId.description: An indication of which attribute this is.

attributeValue.description: The value of the tray attribute.

serialNumber.description: The part serial number.

status.description: The operational status of the battery.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the battery. The parent reference in Location identifies the CRU that physically houses the battery, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component relative slot number of the battery, starting at one.

batteryLifeRemaining.description: Days of battery life remaining. A value of -1 indicates that the battery life expiration age has been set to 0xFF in NVSRAM, disabling cache battery expiration event notification.

batteryTypeData.description: Used to determine the scope of the battery.

rtrAttributes.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the battery component.

batteryCanExpire.description: This boolean field is set to true when cache battery expired event notification is enabled.

automaticAgeReset.description: This boolean field is set to true when the batteryCanExpire field in this structure is set to false and when the controller tracks the battery serial number.

learnCycleData.description: Contains details about the learn cycle for this battery

batteryType.description: This enumeration object is used to specify the battery configurations present on a controller.

cruParentController.description: This field is present only if the batteryType value is equal to BATTERY_TYPE_DUAL_INDIVIDUAL_CRUS. It is a reference to the controller that the battery CRU is associated with.

parentController.description: This field is present only if the batteryType value is equal to BATTERY_TYPE_DUAL_INDIVIDUAL_FRUS. It is a reference to the the controller that the battery FRU is associated with.

backupDeviceRef.description: The SYMbol reference that identifies the instance of the device

backupDeviceControllerSlot.description: The number of the slot on the controller where the backup device resides. Cache backup device slots are numbered starting at one, independent of other types of slots (e.g., host board slots) on the controller. Note that this field is targeted for deletion in SYMbol rev. 85b.

parentController.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

backupDeviceType.description: The type of the backup device ( e.g., USB flash drive).

backupDeviceStatus.description: The status of the backup device

backupDeviceVpd.description: Vital product data for the backup device.

backupDeviceCapacity.description: The capacity of backup device, expressed in megabytes.

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the cache backup device component.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the cache backup device. The parent field of Location is set to the controller where the device physically resides, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component-relative slot number of the device, starting at one.

cacheBackupDeviceWearLife.description: Wear life data for this cache backup device.

manufacturer.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the device manufacturer..

manufactureDate.description: The date of manufacture of the device, represented in seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970.

productId.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the device by name.

productRevLevel.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the device revision level.

partNumber.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the device part number.

serialNumber.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the device serial number.

cacheBackupDeviceWearLifeReportingLevel.description: This enumeration defines the different levels of wear life information that can be reported for the cache backup device.

percentEnduranceUsed.description: Only percent life used is reported for this device.

cacheBackupDeviceWearLifeStats.description: Percent life used, percent life remaining and average erase count are reported for this cache backup device.

cacheMemoryDimmRef.description: The SYMbol reference value that uniquely identifies an instance of a cache memory DIMM object.

status.description: The operational status of the DIMM.

capacityInMegabytes.description: The capacity of the DIMM expressed in megabytes.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the DIMM.

partNumber.description: The LSI Logic part number of the DIMM.

oemPartNumber.description: The OEM part number of the DIMM.

manufacturerPartNumber.description: The manufacturer part number of the DIMM.

manufacturer.description: The manufacturer part number of the DIMM.

manufactureDate.description: The manufacture date of the DIMM

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the cache memory DIMM component.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the cache memory DIMM. The parent reference in Location identifies the controller where the DIMM physically resides, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component relative slot number of the DIMM, starting at 1.

shared.description: This field is set to true if the DIMM is shared between processor and cache. It is set to false if the DIMM is dedicated to the cache.

revisionCode.description: The module revision code of the DIMM.

commandProtocol.description: This enumeration describes the command protocol (e.g. SCSI vs. NVMe).

nvmeProperties.description: This field describes the NVMe command protocol properties.

scsiProperties.description: This field describes the SCSI command protocol properties.

controllerSFPType.description: The interface (host/drive) to which the SFP belongs.

parentController.description: The controller to which the SFP belongs.

channel.description: The channel the SFP is associated with.

drawerRef.description: The component reference associated with the drawer.

isOpen.description: This value is set to true when the drawer is open; otherwise it is set to false.

status.description: This field contains the drawer status.

physicalLocation.description: This field contains the drawer location. This will be a tray reference to the tray containing the drawer.

repairPolicy.description: This field contains the repair policy for the drawer component.

softwareVersion.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string. It contains the firmware version for the DCM (Drawer Control and Monitor) chip on the drawer component.

partNumber.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string. It contains the DCM (Drawer Control and Monitor) chip part number on the drawer component. This part number is from VPD data.

serialNumber.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string. It contains the DCM (Drawer Control and Monitor) chip serial number on the drawer component. This serial number is from VPD data.

vendorName.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string. It contains the DCM (Drawer Control and Monitor) chip manufacturer name, obtained from VPD data.

manufactureDate.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string. It contains the DCM (Drawer Control and Monitor) manufacture date, obtained from VPD data.

fruType.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string. It contains the Field Replaceable Unit (FRU) type, obtained from VPD data.

drawerType.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string describing the type of drawer.

interfaceRef.description: The opaque data by which an instance of EthernetIoInterface is uniquely identified.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the Ethernet interface. The parent reference in Location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st Ethernet interface relative to the parent," "2nd Ethernet interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

channel.description: The number of the channel controlled by this interface.

channelPortRef.description: A reference to the channel port object associated with the channel controlled by this interface.

interfaceData.description: Information about the physical interface (e.g., Ethernet).

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field indicates whether or not the I/O interface is PI capable.

oneWayMaxRate.description: Maximum one way data rate in B/s

bidirectionalMaxRate.description: Maximum bi-directional data rate in B/s

isNetworkTraceCapable.description: Can capture network traces if true.

commandProtocolProperties.description: List of properties that describe the command protocol.

fanRef.description: The reference for this physical fan.

status.description: The operational status of the fan

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the fan. The parent reference in Location identifies the CRU that houses the fan, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st fan relative to parent CRU," 2nd fan relative to parent CRU." etc.

rtrAttributes.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the fan component.

channel.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

loopID.description: The FC loop ID value used by the controller on this channel.

speed.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

hardAddress.description: The hard (preferred) address of the interface, in loop ID format.

nodeName.description: The unique identifier of the storage array node associated with this interface.

portName.description: The unique identifier of the Fibre Channel port associated with this interface.

portId.description: The NL_Port identifier assigned to this interface.

topology.description: The Fibre Channel topology type being used.

part.description: An ASCII text string that describes the Fibre Channel controller chip type.

revision.description: The revision level of the Fibre Channel controller chip.

chanMiswire.description: True, if this channel is joined with another one.

esmMiswire.description: True, if an ESM miswire condition exists somewhere on this channel.

linkStatus.description: The status of the fibre channel link for this interface.

isDegraded.description: True if the channel associated with this interface is degraded.

speedControl.description: The speed of the interface in MB per sec. This field is deprecated. The fieldcurrentInterfaceSpeed should be used instead.

maxSpeed.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

speedNegError.description: True if speed negotiation could not complete.

ddsChannelState.description: The DDS state of this drive side channel: optimal, degraded, or failed.

ddsStateWho.description: Which controller placed the drive side channel in this DDS state.

isLocal.description: Set to True if there are channel ports physically attached to this controller.

channelPorts.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

currentInterfaceSpeed.description: The current interface speed of the Fibre Channel interface.

maximumInterfaceSpeed.description: The maximum interface speed of the Fibre Channel interface.

interfaceRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the Fibre Channel interface. The parent reference in location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st Fibre Channel interface relative to the parent," "2nd Fibre Channel interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

isTrunkCapable.description: This field is true if the Fibre interface on the controller board is trunk capable. This field is always false for host-side interfaces.

trunkMiswire.description: True only when ESM is trunk capable and cabled incorrectly, or not trunk capable but connected in trunk mode.

oneWayMaxRate.description: Maximum one way data rate in B/s

bidirectionalMaxRate.description: Maximum bi-directional data rate in B/s

fc4Types.description: A list containing the currently supported FC-4 types for its associated channel port.

drives.description: A list of the disk drives in the storage system.

trays.description: A list of the disk trays in the storage system.

drawers.description: A list of the disk drawers

controllers.description: A list of the controllers in the storage system.

batteries.description: A list of the batteries in the storage system.

fans.description: A list of the fans in the storage system.

hostBoards.description: A list of the host interface cards in the storage system.

powerSupplies.description: A list of the power supplies in the storage system.

nvsramVersion.description: The version of NVSRAM settings installed on the storage system.

cacheMemoryDimms.description: The list of processor memory DIMMs installed on the storage system.

cacheBackupDevices.description: The list of cache backup modules installed on the storage system.

supportCRUs.description: A list of the support CRUs in the storage system.

esms.description: A list of the ESMs in the storage system.

sfps.description: A list of the SFPs in the storage system.

thermalSensors.description: A list of the thermal sensors in the storage system.

HardwareInventoryResponse.description: Provides summary information for the physical components of the storage system.

parentController.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

partNumber.description: The host board's part number, from VPD.

serialNumber.description: The host board's serial number, from VPD.

vendorName.description: The host board's vendor name, from VPD.

manufacturerDate.description: The host board's date of manufacture, from VPD.

fruType.description: The field replaceable unit type string, from VPD.

hostBoardId.description: The board ID of the controller's host card.

status.description: The host board's status.
