oemPartNumber.description: The OEM part number of the host board.

hostBoardControllerSlot.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the host board component.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the host board. The parent reference in Location identifies the controller where the host board is physically located, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component relative slot number of the host card, starting at 1.

tcaGuid.description: The globally unique identifier (GUID) assigned to the host board.

queuePairsSupported.description: The number of queue pairs supported by the host board.

completionQueuesSupported.description: The number of completion queues supported by the host board.

sharedReceiveQueuesSupported.description: The number of shared receive queues supported by the host board.

type.description: This enumeration object is used to indicate the type of a controller's host board.

dualPortIbTypeData.description: Host board data for two-port InfiniBand host board. This field is only present if type is equal to HB_TYPE_2PORT_IB.

dualPortDenaliIbTypeData.description: If the host board type is denali with two port infiniband, return the two port ib type data struct.

interfaceRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

channel.description: The number of the host channel associated with this interface.

channelPortRef.description: A reference to the channel port for the channel associated with this interface.

localIdentifier.description: The InfiniBand local identifier associated with this interface.

globalIdentifier.description: The InfiniBand global identifier associated with this interface.

linkState.description: The state of the InfiniBand link.

portState.description: The state of the InfiniBand port.

maximumTransmissionUnit.description: The size in bytes of the largest packet that the interface can transmit.

currentSpeed.description: The speed at which the interface is currently operating.

supportedSpeed.description: An array containing the different speeds at which the interface is capable of operating.

currentLinkWidth.description: The width at which the link is currently operating, e.g., 1 means "1X," 4 means "4X,".etc.

supportedLinkWidth.description: An array containing the different link widths at which the link is capable of operating.

currentDataVirtualLanes.description: The number of data virtual lanes that are currently active for this interface.

maximumDataVirtualLanes.description: The maximum number of data virtual lanes supported by the interface.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the Infiniband interface. The parent reference in Location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st Infiniband interface relative to the parent," "2nd Infiniband interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field indicates whether or not the I/O interface is PI capable.

isSRPSupported.description: This flag is true if SRP (SCSI RDMA Protocol) is currently supported.

isISERSupported.description: This flag is true if iSER (iSCSI Extensions for RDMA) is currently supported.

physPortState.description: This element contains the current state of the physical Infiniband port.

oneWayMaxRate.description: Maximum one way data rate in B/s

bidirectionalMaxRate.description: Maximum bi-directional data rate in B/s

isNVMeSupported.description: Indicates if the interface is configured to support NVMe over Fabrics protocol

commandProtocolProperties.description: List of properties that describe the command protocol.

channel.description: The number of the channel controlled by this interface.

channelPortRef.description: A reference to the channel port object associated with the channel controlled by this interface.

tcpListenPort.description: The number of the TCP port on which the target listens for incoming connections.

ipv4Enabled.description: True if IPV4 is enabled for this interface; always true for iSER interface.

interfaceData.description: Information about the physical interface (e.g., Ethernet).

interfaceRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

ipv6Enabled.description: True if IPV6 is enabled for this interface; otherwise false.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the iSCSI interface. The parent reference in Location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st iSCSI interface relative to the parent," "2nd iSCSI interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field indicates whether or not the I/O interface is PI capable.

isIPv6Capable.description: This flag is true if the interface is capable of IPv6 functionality.

oneWayMaxRate.description: Maximum one way data rate in B/s

bidirectionalMaxRate.description: Maximum bi-directional data rate in B/s

isNetworkTraceCapable.description: Can capture network traces if true.

isRemoteStorageVolumeCapable.description: Indicates whether this interface supports the remote storage volume capability.

addressType.description: This enumeration defines the different types of IP addresses, corresponding to different versions of the Internet protocol.

ipv4Data.description: Contains the various IPV4 address elements.

ipv6Data.description: contains the various IPV6 address elements.

commandSet.description: This enumeration describes the command set type (e.g. to descriminate between the NVMe and NVMe over Fabrics command sets).

nvmeofProperties.description: This describes the NVMe over Fabrics protocol properties.

nvmeProperties.description: This describes the NVMe protocol properties.

revision.description: The revision of the NVMe command protocol supported by the RAID controller. This value is reported in a major/minor/tertiary format, with the 16 most significant bits representing the major version number, the next 8 bits representing the secondary version number, and the 8 least significant bits representing the tertiary version number.

firstBurstDataSupported.description: Indicates whether first burst data is supported or not.

firstBurstDataLength.description: The length of the first burst data in bytes.

ipAddressData.description: The IP address data associated with the NVMe over Fabrics over Infiniband transport.

listeningPort.description: The listening port associated with the NVMe over Fabrics over Infiniband transport.

provider.description: This enumeration is used to identify the provider (i.e. intermediate transport protocol) of the RDMA transport.

ibProperties.description: This defines the protocol properties for NVMe over IB.

roceV2Properties.description: This defines the the protocol properties for ROCEv2 NVMe-oF Interfaces

fcProperties.description: This defines the protocol properties for NVMe-oF Fibre Channel Interfaces.

ipv4Enabled.description: Indicates whether IPV4 addressing should be enabled for this interface.

ipv6Enabled.description: Indicates whether IPV6 addressing should be enabled for this interface.

listeningPort.description: The port on which the target listens for incoming connections.

powerSupplyRef.description: The physical location of the power supply. The parent reference in Location identifies the tray or CRU that physically houses the power supply, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component relative number of the power supply, starting at one.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the power supply. Note that the tray reference identifies the enclosure containing the power supply. For non-XBB controller enclosures, the slot information does not apply. For XBB controller enclosures, the slot information is an ordinal identifier (a value of 1 means the first (left) power supply and a value of 2 means the second (right) power supply).

partNumber.description: The part number of the power supply from VPD data.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the power supply.

vendorName.description: The name of the manufacturer of the power supply.

manufacturerDate.description: The date the power supply was manufactured.

manufacturingDeviceCode.description: An integer value that specifies the Manufacturing Device Code.

iserProperties.description: This defines the protocol properties for iSER.

parentMinihub.description: This field is present only if the sfpParentType is equal to SFP_PARENT_TYPE_MINIHUB. It contains the parent type of a SFP.

type.description: An indication of the type of the tray.

cancelled.description: The operation was cancelled while performing the pre-flight checks.

remaining.description: Approximate number of devices that are still processing the health checks.

start.description: The time that this operation was started.

HealthCheckResponse.description: A list of requested health check results

onlineOnly.description: Only run health checks on online storage-systems

storageDeviceIds.description: An optional list of device ids (if not provided, all available devices will be used)

clusterRef.description: The unique identification value for this object. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the cluster.

label.description: The user-assigned, descriptive label string for the cluster.

isSAControlled.description: If true, indicates that I/O accesses from this cluster are subject to the storage array's default LUN-to-volume mappings. If false, indicates that I/O accesses from the cluster are subject to cluster-specific LUN-to-volume mappings.

confirmLUNMappingCreation.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

protectionInformationCapableAccessMethod.description: This field is true if the host has a PI capable access method.

isLun0Restricted.description: Provides an indication as to whether LUN 0 is restricted (i.e., disallowed) for the associated cluster.

name.description: The user-label to assign to the new host group.

hosts.description: List of hostRefs to assign to the HostGroup

HostGroupCreateRequest.description: Creates a host group in the storage system

name.description: The user-label to assign to the new host group.

hosts.description: List of hostRefs to add to the HostGroup

HostGroupUpdateRequest.description: Creates a host group in the storage system

notReadySenseForQuiescenceInProgress.description: This value determines the response of the controller to commands received during the 'controller quiesced' state.

notReadySenseForQuiescenceInProgress2.description: This value determines the response of the controller to commands received during the 'controller quiesced' state.

checkConditionForVendorUniqueUACondition.description: This value determines if the controller will report a vendor unique Unit Attention condition as a Check Condition status.

reportDeferredErrors.description: This value is used to determine how deferred errors are reported to the host.

ignoreForceUnitAccess.description: This value determines controller treatment of the Force Unit Access Option in the SCSI Read(10) and Write(10) commands.

ignoreWriteCacheDisable.description: This value determines if the controller will allow the resetting of the WCE bit in the Mode Select Caching Page to disable write caching.

allowReservationOnUnownedLUNs.description: This value determines the controller response to Reservation/Release commands that are received for LUNs that are not owned by the controller.

worldWideNameInStandardInquiry.description: Set to true if the WWN is in the standard inquiry data.

propagateHostBusResets.description: This value determines whether the controller will propagate a Host Bus Reset/Target Reset/Logical Unit Reset to the other controller in a dual controller subsystem to support Microsoft Clustering Services.

forceSCSI2.description: Report SCSI-2 Through Fibre Channel Host Interface.

reportUnconfiguredLUNs.description: This value determines the LUN data returned by the Report LUNs command.

reportLUNPreferredPathInStandardInquiry.description: Report LUN Preferred Path in Standard Inquiry Data.

inquiryUnconfiguredDeviceType.description: The value returned in the Inquiry Device Type Field when an unconfigured LUN is accessed.

inquiryUnownedDeviceType.description: This value is used to define the device type the controller should return in the first byte of the Inquiry data, if the addressed logical unit is not owned by the addressed controller.

unownedBlock0Read.description: This value is used to define how the controller handles a read request to Block 0 of an unowned volume. When this is enabled, the non-owning controller sends a request for the block 0 data to the owning controller and the owning controller sends the requested block 0 data back to the non-owning controller. If disabled, the controller will do a volume transfer (if AVT is enabled) and then a read of the now owned volume.

retainLogins.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

hostPortType.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

maxRestrictedLUNs.description: Maximum number of LUNs allowed for host type.

avtExclusionExtentsEnabled.description: Enable the AVT exclusion extents for this heterogeneous host region.

suppressVolOffPreferredPathAlert.description: If true, then volume-off-preferred events are not considered critical.

hostType.description: The host type string. A zero-length string is allowed and indicates that the associated host-specific NVSRAM region has been cleared. This field should be used in place of the deprecated hostPortType field.

tpgsSupported.description: This field is set to true if Target Port Group Support is provided; otherwise it is false.

volumeFormatOptions.description: If true, a format unit request will interrupt any in-progress IAF and start a write-zeros initialization. If false, the format unit will be returned with no action.

restrictedLun0.description: If true, LUN 0 is restricted and volume mapping to LUN 0 will not be allowed or be reported in the REPORT LUNS data. If false, a volume-to-LUN mapping can be created to LUN 0 and will be reported in a REPORT LUNS response.

usePage2CQuiescenceTimeout.description: The quiescence timeout is the amount of time the controller should wait to achieve a "no I/Os active" state before invoking a forced transfer of LUN ownership. When this field is set to true, the timeout parameter provided by the host initiator in a mode select Page 2C will be used. When this field is set to false, the timeout value applied will be calculated by the controller.

asymmetricLUAccess.description: If true, Asymmetric Logical Unit Access is enabled.

ignoreISCSISessionIDInITN.description: If true, the array iSCSI target driver will not use the session identifier as part of its internal I_T Nexus identifiers. This reduces churn in I_T Nexus identifiers if the initiator does not re-use iSCSI session identifiers when re-opening a session.

enableLUCheckConditionParallelResponses.description: If true, array may return multiple CHECK CONDITION responses simultaneously on a given logical unit.

disableExplicitTPGS.description: If true, the standard INQUIRY data reporting TPGS support to the initiator will only indicate support for implicit mode (providing TPGS support is enabled, see tpgsSupported field).

unownedCheckConditionDuringFWActivation.description: If true, controller will return a LUN NOT OWNED (05h/94h/01h) CHECK CONDITION when unable to handle I/O during firmware activation.

allowPreferredOwnerReportingSuppression.description: If true, the controller will suppress reporting the preferred owner in REPORT TARGET PORT GROUPS or INQUIRY VPD data in conditions when the preferred controller cannot process I/O.

enableTargetFailback.description: If true, controller initiates fail-back of volumes to the preferred owner .

enableAutoLoadBalance.description: If true, the controller may issue volume ownership changes to balance IO load between controllers.

quiescenceInProgressSenseKey.description: Sense Key returned to host for Quiescence In Progress Check Conditions.

quiescenceInProgressASC.description: Additional Sense Code returned to host for Quiescence In Progress Check Conditions.

quiescenceInProgressASCQ.description: Additional Sense Code Qualifier returned to host for Quiscence In Progress Check Conditions.

persistentID.description: Unique identifier for this specific host type. This value is stored in the controller configuration database when persisting Host objects in order to uniquely identify this specific host type across all NVSRAM builds.

nvmeVUFailoverSupported.description: If true, a vendor unique (VU) NVMe failover solution is supported on the host.

nvmeStandardFailoverSupported.description: If true, the NVMe Asymmetric Namespace Access (ANA) failover solution is supported on the host.

hostUnmapEnabled.description: Whether the host type supports issuing unmap commands to a volume

hostTypeCategory.description: The host type category is used along with the host type priority to order the different host types available for selection when creating hosts.

hostTypePriority.description: The host type priority is used along with the host type category to order the different host types available for selection when creating hosts.

hostConnectivityReportingSupported.description: If true, this host type supports the host connectivity reporting feature within the array.

driveRef.description: The drive ref of the drive that was assigned as a hot spare.

AssignHotSpareResponse.description: A global hot spare is a drive dedicated to a RAID volume group which serves as a temporary replacement drive in the event that a drive in the RAID group fails or becomes out of service.

driveRef.description: A drive ref to the drive to assign as a hot spare.

AssignHotSpareRequest.description: Used to assign a drive as a hot spare.

driveRef.description: The drive reference used to identify the drive.

driveRefs.description: The list of drive refs currently assigned as hot spares.

hotSpareDriveCoverage.description: The hot spare coverage for the storage pools in the storage system.

volumeGroups.description: The list of available volume groups.

coverage.description: List of stand by hot spares that can cover this volume group.

candidates.description: List of drives that can cover this volume group if converted to a hot spare.

channels.description: A list of channel ids. There must be an expansion drive tray attached to identify a channel.

pools.description: A list of storage pool ids. Associated, optimal drives will be identified.

volumes.description: A list of volume ids. Associated, optimal drives will be identified.

storageSystem.description: Set to "true" to identify the StorageSystem.

commandProtocolProperties.description: This describes a list of command protocol properties.

interfaceRef.description: The SYMbol array-wide unique name for the interface object.

channelType.description: The type of channel (e.g., host-side, drive-side) that the interface is associated with.

ioInterfaceTypeData.description: A field whose contents vary depending on the I/O protocol type of the interface.

controllerRef.description: Uniquely identifies a particular physical RAID controller within the storage array.

commandProtocolPropertiesList.description: The list of properties that describe the command protocol.

channelPortRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

channelPortRefs.description: List of channel port refs associated with IoInterface object.

IscsiTargetResponse.description: Provides information for the iSCSI target.

enableChapAuthentication.description: Enable Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP), defaults to false.

chapSecret.description: Enable Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) using the provided password. A      secure password will be generated and returned if CHAP is enabled and this field is not provided.

authMethod.description: This enumeration type identifies the available iSCSIauthentication methods. The supportedAuthMethods array in the FeatureParams structure will contain values from this enumeration identifying which iSCSI authentication methods are supported on the storage array.

chapSecret.description: This field is present only if the authentication method is AUTH_METHOD_CHAP. If the field length indicator is zero, there is no associated secret; otherwise there is a secret and it may or may not be specified, depending on the usage context for this data type. If the client is using this structure to set a secret, the length indicator should be one and the secret should be filled in; if the client is using this structure to set an authentication method with no secret, the length indicator should be zero. If the array is reporting this data, it sets the length indicator according to whether or not there is a secret. (The actual secret is never reported by the array; instead it uses the ENCRYPT_UNSPECIFIED case of EncryptedPassword.) Finally, because CHAP secrets are, by definition, limited to the ASCII character set, the clear text submitted for encryption must be ASCII, not Unicode.

authMethodData.description: A variable-length array containing authentication methods and any associated data.

type.description: This enumeration object is used to identify the type of encryption used for a particular operation or object.

pkcs5Data.description: The PKCS #5 data associated with the encrypted password. This field is valid only if the encryption type is ENCRYPT_PKCS5_SHA1_DES.

pkcs5AesData.description: The PKCS#5 data associated with an AES encrypted password. This field is valid only if the encryption type is ENCRYPT_PKCS5_SHA2_AES.

iterations.description: The number of message digest iterations to be performed when generating the encryption key and initialization vector from the passphrase and salt values.

salt.description: A byte array containing the salt, or random data, selected by the encryption code for this particular encryption operation.

cipherText.description: A variable-length array containing the encrypted data, or cipher text. The length of this array must be a multiple of 8 in order to conform to the PKCS #5 standard. The standard specifies the appropriate technique for adding pad bytes to ensure that this constraint is met.

ioInterfaceType.description: This enumeration defines the different I/O interface types that may be reported as part of the configuration information associated with a controller.

iscsiAlias.description: The SCSI alias name as defined under iSCSI. This field is only valid if the I/O interface type is equal to IO_IF_ISCSI.

targetRef.description: The reference that uniquely identifies an instance of this object.

nodeName.description: The unique node name associated with the target.

alias.description: An additional name that can be assigned to a target, which is usually "friendlier" than the node name.

configuredAuthMethods.description: The authentication methods that have been configured for the target. Associated secrets are not exposed. instead the type field of the EncryptedPassword is set to ENCRYPT_UNSPECIFIED.

portals.description: The set of configured (i.e., either in-use or listening for connections) portals associated with this target.

groupTag.description: A value identifying the portal group to which this portal belongs.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the portal.

tcpListenPort.description: The number of the TCP port on which the target listens for incoming connections.

IscsiEntityResponse.description: Provides information about the storage array in its role as "iSCSI entity."

icmpPingResponseEnabled.description: The setting for enabling or disabling the ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) ping messages.

unnamedDiscoverySessionsEnabled.description: The setting for enabling or disabling unnamed discovery sessions.

isnsServerTcpListenPort.description: The number of the TCP port on which the iSNS server listens for incoming connections.

ipv4IsnsServerAddressConfigMethod.description: The IPV4 configuration method to use for determining the IP address of the iSNS server. Whenever there is a transition of the configuration method from IPV4_CONFIG_STATIC to IPV4_CONFIG_DHCP, the storage array performs the equivalent of a refreshIsnsServerLocation operation.

ipv4IsnsServerAddress.description: The IPV4 configuration method to use for determining the IP address of the iSNS server. Whenever there is a transition of the configuration method from IPV4_CONFIG_STATIC to IPV4_CONFIG_DHCP, the storage array performs the equivalent of a refreshIsnsServerLocation operation.

ipv6IsnsServerAddress.description: The IPV6 address of the iSNS server.

isnsServerRegistrationEnabled.description: The setting is for enabling or disabling storage array registration with the iSNS server.

fecMode.description: The configured Forward Error Correction mode.

IscsiInterfaceUpdateRequest.description: Used to update iSCSI interface settings.

roles.description: List of roles allowed to access this endpoint

endpoints.description: List of endpoints and their role permissions

RolesResponse.description: API response object that includes current user roles and list of role permissions.

password.description: The password for the bind user

user.description: The full DN for the bind user account

groupRegex.description: specifies the DN of the group. The wildcard .* can optionally be used to allow specifying only a partial DN.

ignorecase.description: Whether or not to ignore case for the group mappings

name.description: Specifies the role of the group

id.description: Unique ID linked to this domain

bindLookupUser.description: If needed, you can configure a specific user to use when looking up the group membership for users. Typically, you would configure this whenever regular users might lack reader permissions to view their own group membership. The bind user information must be specified as a full DN.

groupAttributes.description: A list of group attributes on the user that will be searched to for group to role mapping

ldapUrl.description: The LDAP URL entry must be specified as either ldap or ldaps protocol and contain the IP address. In addition, the port for the LDAP URL must be specified (typically 389 for ldap and 636 for ldaps).

names.description: Each domain will have one or multiple names and it is presumed the name will match the DNS domain for the LDAP server but it is not required. Domains can be named anything as long as they are valid DNS names.

roleMapCollection.description: A list of regular expression patterns to match to the user's group attributes to match to roles.

searchBase.description: The search base is used to find group memberships of the user. The search base is the DN in the directory of a container object of users. The filter base is used to find the user object within this container. After the user object is located, any associated group membership is identified.

userAttribute.description: The user attribute is used match the username supplied to an object on the server

LdapDomain.description: Structure that contains information about an LDAP Domain

LdapConfiguration.description: Structure that contains information about an LDAP Configuration

LdapRequest.description: Request to update the LDAP configuration.

LdapDomainTestResponse.description: Result of a test against an LDAP domain

LdapDomainTestResponseResults.description: Result of a test against an LDAP domain

repositoryUsage.description: This field contains the number of bytes used in the repository.

snapRef.description: The snapshot volume to which this utilization refers.

worldWideName.description: The World Wide Name of the snapshot.

label.description: Name of the snapshot.

status.description: Indicates status of the snapshot.

overWarnThreshold.description: True if the repository utilization is over the warning threshold.

repositoryFull.description: True, if the repository is full.

repFullPolicy.description: Indication of the volume behavior when the repository is full.

rollbackPriority.description: The importance of the rollback operation (0-4). Not used in this release of software.

extentStart.description: The start position of the extent in the base volume (bytes). Not used in this release of software.

extentSize.description: The size of the extent in bytes. Not used in this release of software.

snapshotTime.description: The controller time when the snapshot was created.

childrenInactive.description: True if all child volumes are offline or failed. Child volumes are the base volume and the REPOSITORY volume.

volumeHandle.description: Volume SSID.

rollbackStatus.description: Status of current action being performed on snapshot.

asyncMirrorTarget.description: True if the volume is a target in an Asynchronous Mirror relationship.

asyncMirrorSource.description: True if the volume is a source in an Asynchronous Mirror relationship.

remoteMirrorSource.description: True if the volume is a source (primary), in an Remote Volume Mirror relationship.

remoteMirrorTarget.description: True if the volume is a target (secondary), in an Remote Volume Mirror relationship.

baseVolumeId.description: The identifier of the volume or thin volume for the new snapshot group.

name.description: The name of the new snapshot.

repositoryPercentage.description: Size of the snapshot repository in relation to the base volume capacity

warningThreshold.description: Warn the user when the repository is % full.

fullPolicy.description: The behavior on when the data repository becomes full.

storagePoolId.description: The identifier of the storage pool to allocate the repository volume.

warningThreshold.description: Warn the user when the repository is % full.

fullPolicy.description: The behavior on when the data repository becomes full.

logRecords.description: A Map of log records requested

timeStamps.description: A Map of timestamps for each logger type

controllerTray.description: The tray ID of the controller that houses the cache backup device.

controllerSlot.description: The slot number of the controller that houses the cache backup device.

cacheBackupDeviceSlot.description: The number of the slot on the controller in which the cache backup device resides.

controllerTray.description: The tray ID of the controller where the DIMM is installed.

controllerSlot.description: The slot number of the controller where the DIMM is installed.

cacheMemoryDimmControllerSlot.description: The number of the slot on the controller where the cache memory DIMM is installed. Cache memory DIMM slots are numbered starting at one, independent of other types of slots (e.g., cache backup device slots) on the controller.

controllerSlot.description: Controller number 1 if in top slot. Controller number 2 if in bottom slot.

eventComponentType.description: This enumeration object is used to specify the different component types that can be associated with entries in the Major Event Log.

alarmLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_ALARM.

batteryTray.description: The tray ID of the tray containing the battery for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_BATTERY.

cacheBackupDeviceLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal toEVENT_COMP_TYPE_CACHE_BACKUP_DEVICE. It identifies the location of the cache backup device to which the event applies.

cacheMemoryDimmLocation.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_CACHE_MEM_DIMM. It identifies the location of the cache memory DIMM to which the event applies.

channelLoc.description: The location of the channel. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_CHANNEL.

channelPort.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_CHANNEL_PORT.

chipLoc.description: The physical location of the controller that owns the chip for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_CHIP.

controllerLoc.description: The physical location of the controller for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_CONTROLLER.

ctlrSfpLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_CTLR_SFP.

socLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_CTLR_SOC.

driveLoc.description: The physical location of the drive for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_DRIVE.

enclosureTray.description: The tray ID of the tray for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_ENCLOSURE.

esmTray.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

fanTray.description: The tray ID of the tray containing the fan for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_FAN.

hostIoCardLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_HOST_IO_CARD. It identifies the location of the host I/O card to which the event applies.

initiatorLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_INITIATOR. It identifies the iSCSI initiator to which the event applies.

isnsServerLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_ISNS_SERVER. It identifies the iSNS server to which the event applies.

minihubLoc.description: The location of the minihub. This filed is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_MINIHUB.

portCruTray.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

powerSupplyTray.description: The tray ID of the tray containing the power supply for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_POWER_SPLY.

sfpLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_SFP_PORT.

supportCruLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_SUPPORT_CRU.

targetLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_TARGET. It identifies the iSCSI target to which the event applies.

tempSensorTray.description: The tray ID of the tray containing the temperature sensor for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_TEMP_SENSOR.

label.description: The user-assigned label of the volume for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_VOLUME

groupNumber.description: The volume group sequence number of the volume group for which the MEL entry was generated. This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_VOLUME_GRP.

hostLocation.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_HOST. It is the user-assigned label of the host for which the MEL entry is reporting a problem.

hostPortLocation.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_HOST_PORT. It identifies the host port to which the event applies.

drawerLocation.description: The physical location of the drawer for which the MEL event was generated. This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_DRAWER.

componentRelativeLocation.description: The component type and location are described in this field. This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_RELATIVE.

schedule.description: The user-assigned label of the schedule. This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_SCHEDULE.

diskPool.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_DISK_POOL.

asyncMirrorGroup.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_ASYNC_MIRROR_GROUP.

pitLabel.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_PIT. Note that events for PITs also include extended component location information beyond just the associated PiT Group label (PITs themselves are identified by a combination of the label of the associated PiT Group plus a sequence number).

cgLabel.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_PIT_CONSISTENCY_GROUP.

cgPitLabel.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_CGPIT. Note that events for CGPITs also include extended component location information beyond just the associated CG label (CGPITs themselves are identified by a combination of the label of the associated Consistency Group plus a sequence number).

cgViewLabel.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_CGVIEW.

flashCacheLabel.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_FLASH_CACHE. It identifies the flash cache device to which this event applies.

communityNameString.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_SNMP_COMMUNITY. The community name string can contain up to 31 characters.

destinationIpAddress.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_SNMP_TRAP_DESTINATION. It contains an ASCII representation of the destination address (the maximum number of characters is 40 for IPV6, 15 characters for IPV4.

fcTargetLocation.description: This field is only valid when the eventComponentType field is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_FC_TARGET. It contains location data that is an 8-byte binary SCSI name.

nvmeInitiatorLocation.description: This field is valid only when the eventComponentType value is equal to EVENT_COMP_TYPE_NVME_INITIATOR. It identifies the NVMe initiator to which the event applies.

rtgLabel.description: The label of the affected Remote Target Group.

usmUserNameString.description: The user name of the USM user.

trayId.description: The tray ID of the tray containing the component.

relativePosition.description: The relative position within the component's parent.

parentSize.description: The size of the parent array that follows.

parent.description: This is an array containing additional parent-relative location information. The first element in the array will contain the parent's component type and its relative position within it's parent.

componentLabel.description: Contains the label of the component.

channel.description: The channel type.

sfpPort.description: The number of the SFP port on the channel, 1-based.

controllerSlot.description: The slot number of the controller, 1 or 2

oemPriority.description: If this value if equal to EVENT_DEFAULT_PRIORITY then the management client should use the priority value from the MelEntry structure when filtering events for display, otherwise this value should be used.

defaultNeedsAttention.description: This is the default value for needs attention. Its value can be overridden by oemNeedsAttention.

defaultSendAlert.description: This is the default value for sending an alert. Its value can be overridden by oemSendAlert.

defaultVisibility.description: This is the default value for visibility. Its value can be overridden by oemVisibility.

oemNeedsAttention.description: If this value is equal to EVENT_CONTROL_ACCEPT_DEFAULT then the value of defaultNeedsAttention determines whether Needs Attention is set on the array. Otherwise, this field determines whether Needs Attention is set on the array.

oemSendAlert.description: If this value is equal to EVENT_CONTROL_ACCEPT_DEFAULT then the value of defaultSendAlert determines whether an alert will be sent. Otherwise this field determines whether an alert will be sent.

oemVisibility.description: If this value is equal to EVENT_CONTROL_ACCEPT_DEFAULT then the value of defaultVisibility determines whether the event will be displayed. Otherwise, this field determines whether the event will be displayed.

collectSupportBundle.description: If this value is true, a support bundle will be collected.

priorityCaseCreationTrigger.description: This flag indicates whether or not this MEL event should be marked as the reason a customer case was automatically created. It's possible that multiple MEL events could be present in the MEL log that would trigger case creation. But the first MEL event in the log that has this flag set will be tagged as the event that caused the case to be created.

extLocType.description: This enumeration object contains a list of all possible extended component location types that can be returned in a MEL entry.

compChannelLoc.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

compMinihubLoc.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

compTray.description: This field is present only if the extLocType value is EXT_COMP_LOCTYPE_TRAY

compTraySlot.description: This field is present only if the extLocType value is EXT_COMP_LOCTYPE_TRAYSLOT

compLabel.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

pitSequence.description: This field is present only if the ExtendedComponentLocationType value is EXT_COMP_LOCTYPE_PIT.

compReference.description: SYMbolRef of the component or channelPort

locationLabel.description: Label associated with the physical location of the component or port.

volumeGroupLabel.description: This field is present only if the ExtendedComponentLocationType value is EXT_COMP_LOCTYPE_VOLUME_GRP.

diskPoolLabel.description: This field is present only if the ExtendedComponentLocationType value is EXT_COMP_LOCTYPE_DISK_POOL.

targetName.description: The Fibre Channel node name of the target,a binary 8-byte SCSI name.

controllerTray.description: The tray ID of the controller that houses the host card.

controllerSlot.description: The slot number of the controller that houses the host card.

hostIoCardControllerSlot.description: The number of the slot on the controller where the host I/O card (a.k.a., host board) resides. Host I/O card slots are numbered starting at one, independent of other types of slots (e.g., cache backup device slots) on the controller.

ioInterfaceType.description: This enumeration defines the different I/O interface types that may be reported as part of the configuration information associated with a controller.

fcPortName.description: This field is present only if the type value is equal to IO_IF_FC.

ibPortName.description: This field is present only if the type value is equal to IO_IF_IB.

sasPortName.description: This field is present only if the type value is equal to IO_IF_SAS.

initiatorName.description: The iSCSI node name of the initiator, left-truncated if necessary. (Left-truncation preserves the part of the name most likely to vary.)

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the iSNS server.

tcpListenPort.description: The number of the TCP port on which the iSNS server listens for incoming connections.

sequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of the MEL entry. The controller maintains a unique, monotonically increasing 64-bit sequence number value and stamps each MEL entry with the next value of this counter.

eventType.description: An integer value that indicates the specific type of event being reported.

timeStamp.description: The time at which the MEL entry was generated. This value is defined in terms of the number of seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970.

category.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

componentType.description: The type of component that is associated with this entry.

componentLocation.description: The location, or other identifying value, of the component associated with this entry.

locationValid.description: A true/false indication of whether the ComponentLocation field is valid for this entry.

priority.description: The priority code associated with this event.

eventSourceController.description: The controller that is the source of the event (Controller 1 or 2).

senseKey.description: The Sense Key value associated with this event, or zero if no key is applicable.

rawData.description: The raw data stored for this event. This information may be useful for debugging or troubleshooting problems with the assistance of a field support or development representative.

extComponentLocation.description: Extended component location information for this entry. This data type of this field is a union with discriminator extLocType. If the discriminator is set to something other than EXT_COMP_LOCTYPE_UNKNOWN, then the location information in this field overrides what is in the componentLocation field.

controlParams.description: This field allows customized control over the handling of MEL events.

minihubType.description: Information returned is based on the minihub type.

channel.description: The channel number that this minihub is associated with.

controllerSlot.description: Controller number 1 if in top slot. Controller number 2 if in bottom slot.

tray.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

relativePosition.description: The relative position within the component's parent.

channel.description: The channel type.

targetName.description: The iSCSI node name of the target, left-truncated if necessary. (Left-truncation preserves the part of the name most likely to vary.)

tray.description: The tray ID of the tray in which the component resides. Note that a Tray ID of -1 means "the controller tray."

slot.description: The slot number, or ordinal identifier, of the component within its tray.

startingSeqNum.description: This is the sequence number of the entry at the low end of the extent. So, when this value is returned in getMelExtents, it is the sequence number of the first MEL event that can be returned in getMelEntries. When specified as an input to getMelEntries, it is the sequence number of the first MEL event to be returned.

endingSeqNum.description: When this value is returned by getMelExtents, it is the sequence number that is one beyond the entry at the high end of the extent. For example, if the ending sequence number is 3232, then MEL entries up to sequence 3231 are retrievable. When this value is input to getMelEntries, it is the sequence number of the last MEL event to be returned.

localAddresses.description: The list of IPv6 local addresses

routableAddresses.description: The list of IPv6 routable addresses

enabled.description: True if the access volume feature (and thus the UTM command transfer capability) is enabled, or false if it is disabled.

volumeHandle.description: An identifier value for the AccessVolume object. This will generally correspond to the logical unit number (LUN) that is used to access the volume for UTM protocol command transactions.

capacity.description: The (simulated) capacity of the AccessVolume maintained by the controller. Since there is essentially no true data storage capacity present for an AccessVolume, this value is used to determine the block addressing limit of the unit, which is an important aspect of the UTM command transfer protocol.

accessVolumeRef.description: The identifier value for this AccessVolume. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the AccessVolume.

alarmRef.description: The reference for this physical alarm.

physicalLocation.description: The location of the alarm. The parent reference in Location identifies the tray containing the alarm, and the position field is set to 1.

status.description: The operational status of the alarm.

isManageable.description: True if the alarm is manageable using the setAlarm procedure.

rtrAttributes.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the alarm component.

keyValueTag.description: This is an array of elements that report the a key-value tag and its reference.

keyValueTagMapping.description: This element is an array of the mappings (using references) between a key-value tag and a volume.

workload.description: This is an array of elements that reports Workload references.

workloadVolumeMapping.description: This is an array of elements that report the mapping between workloads and volumes.

groupRef.description: The reference (key) for the mirror group.

worldWideName.description: The world wide name of the mirror group. This can be used to identify the AMG pair on both arrays. The AsyncMirrorGroupRef is not guaranteed to be unique across multiple arrays.

label.description: The user assigned name for the mirror group.

groupState.description: The Mirror Group State. This is determined primarily by the presence or lack of a recovery point.

localRole.description: The current role of this (local) array with respect to this mirror group.

remoteRole.description: The current role of the peer (remote) array with respect to this mirror group.

roleChangeProgress.description: This field indicates the current state of the role change process. This may be an extended condition due to the data sync needed for an orderly role change or the recovery point rollback needed for a no-sync or forced role change.

syncIntervalMinutes.description: The time in minutes between starting points of periodic synchronization intervals. A value of ARVM_MANUAL_SYNC_INTERVAL indicates synchronization intervals are manually started by the user.

syncCompletionTimeAlertThresholdMinutes.description: The threshold (in minutes) for notifying the user that periodic synchronization has taken too long to complete. A value of ARVM_SYNC_COMPLETION_TIME_THRESHOLD_NONE indicates no threshold is set.

recoveryPointAgeAlertThresholdMinutes.description: The recovery point age objective (in minutes). The user is notified via needs-attention when the age of the last good recovery point exceeds this value. A value of ARVM_RECOVERY_POINT_AGE_THRESHOLD_NONE indicates no threshold is set.

repositoryUtilizationWarnThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold (0-100 percent). A needs attention condition will be generated if the percent of the repository capacity currently utilized exceeds this threshold.

mirrorChannelRemoteTarget.description: The path to the remote array to be used by this AMG (a reference to the associated RemoteTarget).

orphanGroup.description: If true, the mirror group is an orphan.

memberRef.description: The reference (key) for the group member.

primaryVolWWN.description: The WWN of the primary volume on the remote array.

primaryVolCapacity.description: Capacity of the primary (used to aid in selection of mirror secondary volume).

primaryVolRAIDLevel.description: RAID level of the primary volume.

primaryVolProtectionType.description: The protection type of the primary volume.

primaryVolSecurityType.description: Security type of the primary volume.

primaryVolUserLabel.description: User label of the primary volume.

orphanIncompleteMember.description: If true, the incomplete member is an orphan.

primaryVolumeParameters.description: The capacity provisioning parameters for the primary volume.

primaryVolSecurityLevel.description: Refines the information in the securityType field to describe the set of drives.

blkSize.description: The block size (in bytes) of the volume.

blkSizePhysical.description: This reports the physical block size (in bytes) used when sending I/O to the underlying drives.

memberRef.description: The reference (key) for the group member.

mirrorGroup.description: The AMG with which this member is associated.

localVolume.description: The local volume for this mirror. This is the volume being mirrored if the AMG role is primary, otherwise this is the target of mirror synchronization.

remoteVolume.description: The remote volume. This is the target of mirror synchronization on the remote array if the AMG role is primary, otherwise this is the volume on the remote array that is being mirrored.

memberState.description: The state of this mirror relationship (as known by this array).

lastRecoveryPointTime.description: The timestamp, represented in seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970, of the last recovery point PiT on secondary. If no recovery point image exists, the value of this field will be ARVM_NO_RECOVERY_POINT_TIMESTAMP.

overUtilizationWarnThreshold.description: If true, the repository capacity utilized is over the warning threshold.

mirroredLocalCapacity.description: The current local volume capacity that is being mirrored. This will be less than the actual local volume capacity if we have not yet reached a point where the next PiT can be taken and delta-logs resized (and until that point the expanded local capacity will not be opened up to host writes).

repositoryVolume.description: The metadata volume (Copy-on-Write / DeltaLog Repository) for this mirror.

worldWideName.description: The WWN of the async mirror proxy.

volumeHandle.description: The SSID of the async mirror proxy.

repositoryFull.description: If true, the repository is full (100% of available capacity utilized).

status.description: The operational status of the battery.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the battery. The parent reference in Location identifies the CRU that physically houses the battery, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component relative slot number of the battery, starting at one.

batteryLifeRemaining.description: Days of battery life remaining. A value of -1 indicates that the battery life expiration age has been set to 0xFF in NVSRAM, disabling cache battery expiration event notification.

batteryTypeData.description: Used to determine the scope of the battery.

rtrAttributes.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the battery component.

batteryCanExpire.description: This boolean field is set to true when cache battery expired event notification is enabled.

automaticAgeReset.description: This boolean field is set to true when the batteryCanExpire field in this structure is set to false and when the controller tracks the battery serial number.

learnCycleData.description: Contains details about the learn cycle for this battery

featureId.description: This field indicate what feature this instance of BundledFeature represents.

featureAttribute.description: This field is a variable-length array of FeatureAttribute instances representing the attributes that apply for this particular feature.

certificateRevocationCheckEnabled.description: Used to determine if certificate revocation checking is enabled.

ocspResponderAddress.description: If set this will over-ride the OCSP (On-line Certificate Status Protocol) responder address found in the certificate.

isOCSPResponderAddressSet.description: True if the OCSP (On-line Certificate Status Protocol) server address is set; otherwise false.

clusterRef.description: The unique identification value for this object. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the cluster.

label.description: The user-assigned, descriptive label string for the cluster.

isSAControlled.description: If true, indicates that I/O accesses from this cluster are subject to the storage array's default LUN-to-volume mappings. If false, indicates that I/O accesses from the cluster are subject to cluster-specific LUN-to-volume mappings.

confirmLUNMappingCreation.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

protectionInformationCapableAccessMethod.description: This field is true if the host has a PI capable access method.

isLun0Restricted.description: Provides an indication as to whether LUN 0 is restricted (i.e., disallowed) for the associated cluster.

fwVersion.description: A firmware package version identifier, which may or may not contain bytes with a value of FW_VERSION_WILDCARD.

compatible.description: A true value indicates that any firmware version that matches the one specified in this structure is compatible with the currently-installed storage array firmware. A false value indicates that matching firmware versions are NOT compatible.

cacheMemoryDimm.description: List of field replaceable cache memory DIMM modules.

processorMemoryDimm.description: List of field replaceable processor memory DIMMs.

status.description: The status/state of the concatenated volume. This will be the worst status among the member volumes.

memberCount.description: The number of actual storage volumes comprising this volume. Note that this is just for convenience, this information can be derived from member objects.

aggregateCapacity.description: The aggregate capacity in bytes of all member volumes.

volumeHandle.description: The volume ssid. This is provided primarily for debug purposes.

allowedOperations.description: Operations allowed on the ConcatVolume. This can be used if ConcatVolume is ever exposed as a host-addressable volume to specify whether the volume is host-mappable or not (repository volumes would never be mappable).

concatVolRef.description: A reference to the parent ConcatVolume.

storageVolumeRef.description: A reference to the member RAID volume providing storage capacity.

parentIndex.description: The index (order) of the member in the aggregated parent volume capacity.

consistencyGroup.description: Bundle of information about the write order consistency group objects.

controllerGBICType.description: Interface (host/drive) to which the GBIC belongs.

parentController.description: Information on the controller associated with the GBIC.

channel.description: The channel number that this GBIC is associated with.

usableCapacity.description: The usable capacity of the free extent based on the current DDPVolRAIDLevel. This is also the maximum capacity that the DDP volume with the current DDPVolRAIDLevel can be created on the free extent

allocGranularity.description: The DDPVolRAIDLevel specific allocation granularity (in bytes).

amountOfIncrease.description: The amount of capacity increase for the volume.

timeOfDay.description: The number of seconds after midnight local time for the first occurrence during the day.

everyNMinutes.description: Interval between schedules if timesPerDay is greater than 1.

timesPerDay.description: The number of occurrences during the day based on everyNMinutes, including the first occurrence.

time.description: Time of day for DST change measured as seconds past midnight.

reconstructionReservedDriveCount.description: The number of drives reserved for reconstruction of failed drives.

reconstructionReservedAmt.description: The pool capacity reserved to hold rebuild data (in bytes). This value is calculated from the reconstructionReservedDriveCount.

reconstructionReservedDriveCountCurrent.description: The reserved capacity that is currently available to hold rebuilt data (dynamic). If all of the reserved capacity is available, then this value will equal the reconstructionReservedDriveCount.

poolUtilizationWarningThreshold.description: The pool utilization warning threshold as a percentage of the total user configurable capacity. A MEL event is generated when the configured capacity exceeds the specified level of the configurable capacity.

poolUtilizationCriticalThreshold.description: The pool utilization critical threshold as a percentage of the total user configurable capacity. A MEL event is generated when the configured capacity exceeds the specified level of the configurable capacity.

poolUtilizationState.description: The Disk pool state set based on state of the threshold.

unusableCapacity.description: This value identifies how much capacity (in bytes) is being wasted due to a mix of drive sizes. This value will be zero as long as the pool consists of like drive sizes.

degradedReconstructPriority.description: One failed drive degraded reconstruction priority.

criticalReconstructPriority.description: Two failed drive reconstruction critical priority.

backgroundOperationPriority.description: Priority of other background operations (DVE,DCE,DCR, and IAF).

allocGranularity.description: The allocation granularity (in bytes) for volumes with default RAIDLevel in a disk pool.

minimumDriveCount.description: Minimum number of drives required for this disk pool

poolVersion.description: Version of the disk pool. Indicates which internal pool policies and/or algorithms the pool is operating under.

offline.description: True if the drive is in the offline state, false otherwise. This field is valid for missing drives.

hotSpare.description: True if the drive has been designated as a hot spare; false otherwise. This field is valid for missing drives.

invalidDriveData.description: True if no drive information (serial #, capacity, etc.) can be obtained. This field is always true for missing drives.

available.description: True if the drive is available for use in creating a new volume group; false otherwise. This field is valid for missing drives.

pfa.description: True if the drive is drive Predicted Failure analysis predicts a drive failure. This field is valid for missing drives.

driveRef.description: The identifier value for this drive. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the drive. This field is valid for missing drives.

status.description: An indication of the current status of the drive. This field is valid for missing drives.

cause.description: An indication of the reason for the current status of the drive. This field is most useful when the current status is something other than optimal; it identifies the event that caused the status to change to its current value. This field is valid for missing drives.

interfaceType.description: Information about the I/O interface between the controller and the drive. For example, for a SCSI-attached drive, this field will contain information about the drive's channel and SCSI ID values. For other interface types, different data will be available in this field.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the drive. Beginning with the Allegheny release, the parent reference in Location identifies the tray or drawer containing the drive, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component relative slot number of the drive, starting at 1. For missing drives this field contains the last known location.

manufacturer.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the drive manufacturer. Note that this information is not returned for most Serial ATA (SATA) drives.

manufacturerDate.description: The date of manufacture of the drive, represented in seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970. Note that this information is not returned for most Serial ATA (SATA) drives.

productID.description: The variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the product by name, as assigned by the manufacturer.

serialNumber.description: The variable-length ASCII text string for the serial number of the drive.

softwareVersion.description: This data is a variable-length ASCII text string. If an interposer is present in front of SATA drives, the string identifies the version of the interposer package. In this case, the SATA drive firmware version can be found in the physicalDriveTypeData field. If an interposer is not present (always the case for Fibre Channel drives) this field describes the drive firmware version.

blkSize.description: The block (i.e. sector) size used by the drive, represented in bytes. This field is valid for missing drives.

usableCapacity.description: The usable capacity of the drive, in bytes, after accounting for any space that is reserved for use by the array controller for overhead information. This field is valid for missing drives.

rawCapacity.description: The raw capacity of the drive, in bytes. This field is valid for missing drives.

worldWideName.description: A variable-length, opaque field that contains the drive's world-wide name, or globally unique identifier value. This field is valid for missing drives.

currentVolumeGroupRef.description: The reference value of the volume group, disk pool, or flash cache to which this drive is currently assigned. If a hot spare drive is actively sparing for a failed drive, this field will identify the volume group, disk pool, or flash cache that is using the hot spare drive. If the drive is not currently assigned, or is an idle hot spare, the reference value will be null. This field is valid for missing drives.

sparedForDriveRef.description: The reference value of the drive for which this drive is acting as a hot spare. This field is only used if the Drive object represents a global hot spare that is actively sparing for a failed drive. This field is valid for missing drives.

mirrorDrive.description: This field is only used if the Drive object represents a drive that is part of a RAID-1 volume group. It identifies the drive that is tied to this one for RAID-1 mirroring operations. This field is valid for missing drives.

nonRedundantAccess.description: True if the drive does not have redundant access.

workingChannel.description: The channel to the tray that is still operational (if nonRedundantAccess is True).

volumeGroupIndex.description: The volume group index. This is the zero-relative position of the drive with respect to the stripe-ordering for the volume group. A value of -1 indicates that the drive does not belong to any group. This field is valid for missing drives.

currentSpeed.description: The speed of the drive. Will be unknown for a SCSI drive.

maxSpeed.description: The maximum speed of the drive. Currently not used.

uncertified.description: True, if the drive has the DR_UNCERTIFIED flag set. This field is valid for missing drives.

hasDegradedChannel.description: True, if a path to this drive is degraded.

spindleSpeed.description: The drive reported spindle speed. Solid State Disk (SSD) drives report zero.

rtrAttributes.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

phyDriveTypeData.description: Information specific to a physical drive type.

pfaReason.description: The reason a PFA condition has been raised for this drive.

bypassSource.description: A list of object references where each reference identifies the source of a drive bypass condition. Possible referenced objects include the drive itself, a controller, or the ESM(s). When the bypass source is a controller or the drive, the list will typically hold just one reference; when the bypass source is the ESM(s), the list can hold up to two references, indicating either one or both ESMs. The list normally holds valid data whenever the drive is in the bypassed state (DRIVE_STAT_BYPASSED) , however it may be empty if the source of the bypass is unknown. It is also possible for the list to hold valid data when the drive is optimal, if only one ESM has bypassed the drive.

repairPolicy.description: This field contains the repair policy for the Drive.

fdeCapable.description: True if the drive supports FDE, false otherwise

fdeEnabled.description: true if drive security is enabled; false if disabled

fdeLocked.description: True if the drive is locked, false if the drive is unlocked

lockKeyID.description: The lock key ID as read from the drive.

ssdWearLife.description: Contains wear life data for the SSD drive.

driveMediaType.description: This field is set to the drive media type of the drive.

fpgaVersion.description: This data is a variable-length ASCII text string that identifies the version of the FPGA package.

protectionInformationCapabilities.description: This structure contains a protectionInformationCapable field which is set to true when the drive is formatted to support type 2 protection with a 512-byte logical block size, or if the drive is a type 0 drive formatted with a 520-byte logical block size. It also contains a field that is set to the protection type provided for the drive.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

protectionType.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

interposerPresent.description: A value of true for this property means the drive is behind an interposer.

interposerRef.description: The drive interposer identifier. This field is valid only if the interposerPresent field is set to True.

currentCommandAgingTimeout.description: The current command aging timeout value in hundreds of milliseconds. If this value is 0 the default command aging timeout value will be used, otherwise this value overrides the default value.

defaultCommandAgingTimeout.description: The default command aging timeout value in hundreds of milliseconds as specified by the drive. If this value is 0, the drive command aging timeout cannot be changed.

driveTemperature.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

blkSizePhysical.description: The physical block (i.e., sector) size for the drive, represented in bytes. This field is valid for missing drives.

lowestAlignedLBA.description: The lowest aligned LBA for the physical sector. Typically this will be 0, but could be non-zero for emulation drives where LBA 0 starts at some logical sector offset within the physical sector.

removed.description: True if the drive is in the process of being removed from the volume group. Only applies to Disk Pools

locateInProgress.description: Indicates that a locate operation for the device is currently active. The device will show a visual indication to aid an operator in locating the drive.

fipsCapable.description: This flag is true if the drive supports FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standard). FIPS 140-2 specification.

dulbeCapable.description: An indication as to whether the drive supports DULBE

sanitizeCapable.description: An indication as to whether the drive supports Sanitize operations.

driveSecurityType.description: This enumeration distinguishes between different security capabilities of a drive.

channel.description: The channel number.

state.description: The operational state of the channel.

reason.description: The reason the channel was degraded.

degradingController.description: If auto degraded, the degraded controller.

nonChannelErrors.description: The number of non channel errors.

controllerDetectedErrors.description: The number of controller detected errors.

driveDetectedErrors.description: The number of drive detected errors.

linkDownErrors.description: The number of link down errors.

driveChannelParent.description: This enumeration object is used to specify the Drive Channel parent.

controllerRef.description: This field is present only if the DriveChannelParentType is CONTROLLER.

minihubRef.description: This field is present only if the DriveChanelParentType is MINIHUB.

portRef.description: A reference to the drive channel port.

channel.description: The Fibre Channel number of the port.

startTimeStamp.description: The time stamp of when the error tracking began.

endTimeStamp.description: The time stamp of when the error tracking ended.

totalIoErrorCount.description: The total number of I/O errors.

linkStatus.description: The status of the link - up, down, failed

installedKMSCertificateFile.description: The list of KMS Certificate Files currently installed on the storage array. Only one certificate of each type can ever be installed at a time although not necessarily each possible type will be installed. The specific certificates that need to be installed will depend on the KMIP server, how it is configured, and the CA used to sign certificates. The signed client certificate will always be necessary.

kmsEndpoint.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

kmsEndpointList.description: The external key management server endpoint information.

codeVersions.description: This is a list of versions for the various firmware components (RAID, NVSRAM, hypervisor, ....). The list contains an entry for every code module applicable to the current platform.

kmsAddress.description: The IP or domain address of the key management server

kmsPort.description: The port number to be used for communicating KMIP requests with the key management server.

featureAttrId.description: This enumeration identifies the defined feature attributes.

keyEnabled.description: The boolean value for a "KEY ENABLED" attribute. This field is only present if featureAttrId is equal to FEATURE_ATTR_KEY_ENABLED.

keyLimit.description: The integer value for a "KEY LIMIT" attribute. This field is only present if featureAttrId is equal to FEAUTRE_ATTR_KEY_LIMIT.

shippedEnabled.description: The boolean value for a "SHIPPED ENABLED" attribute. This field is only present if featureAttrId is equal to FEATURE_ATTR_SHIPPED_ENABLED.

shippedLimit.description: The integer value for a "SHIPPED LIMIT" attribute. This field is only present if featurAttrId is equal to FEATURE_ATTR_SHIPPED_LIMIT.

subjectToGoldKey.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

supportedValues.description: The set of string values for a "SUPPORTED VALUES" attribute. This field is only present if featureAttrId is equal to FEATURE_ATTR_SUPPORTED_VALUES.

evaluationDuration.description: An unsigned integer representing the number of days for the "EVALUATION DURATION" attribute. This field is only present if featureAttrId is equal to FEATURE_ATTR_EVAL_DURATION.

name.description: The name of the feature bundle.

bundledFeatures.description: A variable-length collection of BundledFeature instances, one for every feature comprising the bundle.

bundleSubmodelId.description: The submodel Identifier associated with the feature bundle.

maxHotSpares.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

cacheBlockSizes.description: A variable-length array in which each element specifies one of the supported cache block sizes that can be set on the controller. Cache block sizes are reported in bytes.

maxDCEDrives.description: The maximum number of drives that can be added, in a given operation, to an existing volume group to expand the capacity of the volume group.

maxReadAheadMultiplier.description: The maximum multiplier value that can be specified when configuring cache the read-ahead parameter for a volume. (Realize, however, that the volume read-ahead parameter is no longer treated as a quantify, but as a simple on (non-zero) / off (zero) indicator.

minMediaScanPeriod.description: The minimum supported period over which a complete media scan can be set to occur (measured in days).

maxMediaScanPeriod.description: The maximum supported period over which a complete media scan can be set to occur (measured in days).

supportedSegSizes.description: A variable-length array in which each element specifies one of the supported segment size values, in bytes. This array should be consulted prior to attempting to create a volume modify a volume's segment size via the startVolumeSegmentSizing procedure.

numStandardSegSizes.description: The number of standard segment size values (at beginning of list).

segTransitions.description: A variable-length array in which each element specifies one of the supported segment size transition options. The user of the SYMbol interface should consult this list to determine a valid new segment size for a volume before attempting to use the startVolumeSegmentSizing procedure.

mappableLUNCount.description: The maximum number of LUN addresses that are available for volume mapping operations. The range of supported LUN values is thus 0 through mappableLUNCoun-1.

maxPartitionCount.description: The number of partitions supported by the controller.

maxMappingsPerVolume.description: The number of mappings allowed per volume.

maxVolumes.description: The maximum number of standard volumes allowed per array.

maxSnapshots.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

maxSnapshotsPerBase.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

minRepositorySize.description: The minimum size of a repository volume in bytes.

maxMirrors.description: The maximum number of mirrored volumes allowed per array assuming full size repositories.

maxVolCopys.description: The maximum number of volume copies allowed per array.

maxConcurrentBackgroundCopys.description: The maximum number of background copies that can be active at any one time. This maximum number applies to the entire array, not just one controller.

maxUtmLunValue.description: The maximum value a UTM LUN can be set to.

battery_not_in_configuration.description: The NVSRAM setting for optional controller battery.

supportedDriveTypes.description: A list of supported drive types.

currentMaxMirrors.description: The maximum number of mirrored volumes allowed per array for existing repositories.

maxVolumesPerGroup.description: The maximum number of volumes allowed per volume group.

maxDriveDownloadFiles.description: The maximum number of drive download files permitted.

maxMgmtClientRecords.description: The maximum number of records allowed in the client data storage area.

maxMgmtClientRecordSize.description: The maximum record size of a client data record.

redundancyMode.description: Indicates whether the system is Simplex or Duplex.

maxExpansionDriveTrays.description: The maximum number of expansion drive trays allowed for this storage array.

supportedAuthMethods.description: The iSCSI authentication methods supported by the storage array.

maxIscsiIpv6LocalAddressesPerPort.description: Max number of iSCSI IPV6 local addresses

maxIscsiIpv6RoutableAddressesPerPort.description: Max number of iSCSI IPV6 routable addresses

absoluteMaxDssSegmentSize.description: The global upper bound, expressed in bytes, on the new segment size that may be requested on the startVolumeSegmentSizing procedure.

smartBatteryTechnology.description: This field is set to true if the storage array uses smart battery technology, and false otherwise.

writeCachingEnabledDuringLearnCycle.description: This field, which is only applicable if smartBatteryTechnology is true, is set to true if the charge level on a smart battery unit is expected to remain above the minimum level needed to support write caching.

maxSSDsSupported.description: The maximum number of SSDs supported on the array. If SSDs are not supported this value is 0.
