ssdInterfaceTypeMixingSupported.description: True if different SSD interface types (e.g. Fibre Channel, SAS) can be used in the same volume group.

maxDriveSlots.description: The maximum number of drive slots supported on the array.

supportedProtectionTypes.description: The protection types supported by the storage array.

supportedEventPriorities.description: An array listing the MEL event priorities that are configured for use in the current controller firmware build.

maxFlashCacheSize.description: The maximum flash cache repository size measured in bytes.

defaultMediaScanPeriod.description: The default media scan period stored in the controller's NVSRAM. Units are days.

maxNvmeofRoceV2Ipv6LocalAddressesPerPort.description: Max number of NVMe ROCEv2 IPV6 local addresses

maxNvmeofRoceV2RoutableAddressesPerPort.description: Max number of NVMe ROCE IPV6 routable addresses

maxCachePoolID.description: The maximum cache pool ID allowed to be assigned to a volume, based on the number of cache pools supported by the controller.

maxExternalKeyServers.description: The maximum number of external key servers.

maxAllowedNetworkTraceDurationSeconds.description: Maximum allowed network trace duration in seconds.

maxAllowedNetworkTraceSizeMB.description: Maximum allowed network trace size (before compression) in MB (million bytes, not MiB).

suggestedNetworkTracePacketLengthBytes.description: Network trace packet size (in bytes) suggested for truncating most customer data while retaining most (but not all) iSCSI debug information. The best value varies depending on the network, but this represents a cautious, general starting point. For IO interfaces, the customer should be advised that small slices of customer data in flight can be captured.

networkTraceAvailabilityMinutes.description: This field indicates approximately how long a trace will be available to download after the trace completes. Shortly after this duration the trace is automatically deleted.

capability.description: This field will contain the value of the premium feature being described.

isEnabled.description: A true value in this field indicates that the feature is enabled (regardless of compliance)

isCompliant.description: A true value in this field indicates that the feature has been purchased (in compliance). A false value indicates that the feature has not been purchased. The user will receive warning messages indicating that they are not in compliance. The warning message will continue until the feature is purchased or the feature is disabled.

isWithinLimits.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

featureId.description: This field contains the value of the feature ID associated with the feature.

featureRef.description: This field contains a reference to the feature.

limit.description: A numerical description associated with this FeatureState object, describing the level or tier for this feature. A zero value represents a feature that does not support tiering. Non-zero implies a tiering level.

duration.description: Describes the timeframe this feature will be available. A zero value describes an infinite duration. The unit of duration is in days.

enabledTime.description: Describes the time when this feature was enabled.

supportedFeatureBundleId.description: The supported Feature Bundle ID. When not in use this value will be zero.

permanentLicenseApplied.description: TRUE if a permanent license for this feature has been applied. FALSE if the feature is being evaluated or is not enabled at all.

wwn.description: The WWN of the high level flash cache volume.

flashCacheRef.description: A reference to the high level flash cache volume.

flashCacheBase.description: Contains the base-level Flash Cache attributes pertaining to all types of Flash Caches.

fcDriveInfo.description: Drive information for the flash cache.

flashCacheMap.description: A list of structures that map between the cached volumes and their associated flash cache.

flashCache.description: A list of flash cache objects.
A reference to the associated flash cache.

cachedVolume.description: A reference to the cached volume.

flashCacheMapRef.description: A unique identifier for the map entry.

sectorOffset.description: The sector offset of this free extent within its volume group. This value is provided only to allow the client application to determine the relative positions of free extents and volumes within a given volume group. No other assumptions or computations should be made with this value.

rawCapacity.description: The total usable capacity of this free extent, accounting for parity requirement based on the RAID level of the volume group. If the storage array supports dual-RAID disk pools, this value will represent the usable capacity of the free extent in the disk pool accounting for the "default" RAID6 parity requirements. An additional field (ddpRAIDCapacities) is introduced to the FreeExent object graph to provide an array of DDPRAIDCapacity objects showing the supported RAID levels in the disk pool and the usable capacities of the free extent based on those RAID levels.

raidLevel.description: The RAID level of this free extent, which governs the allowed configuration of volumes that can be created on it.

volumeGroupRef.description: The volume group reference value of the volume group on which this free extent resides.

freeExtentRef.description: The unique identification value for this free extent. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the free extent.

ddpRAIDCapacities.description: An array of DDPRAIDCapacity objects showing the supported DDPVolRAIDLevels and the usable capacities of the free extent based on those DDPVolRAIDLevels

gbicParentType.description: This enumeration is used to identify the parent type of a GBIC component.

controllerGBIC.description: This field is present only if the gbicParentType value is GBIC_PARENT_TYPE_CONTROLLER. It contains the detailed information about the controller channel.

parentMinihub.description: This field is present only if the gbicParentType value is GBIC_PARENT_TYPE_MINIHUB. It contains the detailed information about the minihub the GBIC belongs to.

gbicRef.description: The reference for this physical GBIC.

status.description: The operational status of the GBIC.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the GBIC. Note that the tray reference identifies the enclosure containing the GBIC, but the slot information does not apply to this component.

gbicType.description: This field is the discriminator value, which identifies the type of GBIC.

gbicPort.description: This field provides information about the port that the GBIC is associated with.

parentData.description: Information returned is based on the type of the GBIC parent. The data returned describes the component or controller that is associated with the GBIC.

worldWideName.description: The World Wide Name of the volume.

snapshotVol.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

hostRef.description: The unique identification value for this object. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the host.

clusterRef.description: The cluster reference value of the cluster in which this host resides. A NULL reference value indicates that the host has not been assigned to a cluster.

label.description: The user-assigned, descriptive label string for the host.

isSAControlled.description: If true, indicates that I/O accesses from this host are subject to the storage array's default LUN-to-volume mappings. If false, indicates that I/O accesses from the host are subject to host-specific or cluster-specific LUN-to-volume mappings.

confirmLUNMappingCreation.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

hostTypeIndex.description: An integer index indicating the type of host.

protectionInformationCapableAccessMethod.description: This field is true if the host has a PI capable access method.

isLargeBlockFormatHost.description: If true, the host is capable of supporting large block formats.

isLun0Restricted.description: Provides an indication as to whether LUN 0 is restricted (i.e., disallowed) for the associated host.

hostPortRef.description: The unique identification value for this object. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the host port.

hostPortName.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

label.description: The user-assigned, descriptive label string for the host port.

hostRef.description: The host reference value of the host in which this port resides.

hostPortTypeIndex.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

isSAControlled.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

confirmLUNMappingCreation.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

portId.description: The I/O-protocol-based unique port identifier. This field replaces the deprecated hostPortName field.

portInactive.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

notReadySenseForQuiescenceInProgress.description: This value determines the response of the controller to commands received during the 'controller quiesced' state.

notReadySenseForQuiescenceInProgress2.description: This value determines the response of the controller to commands received during the 'controller quiesced' state.

checkConditionForVendorUniqueUACondition.description: This value determines if the controller will report a vendor unique Unit Attention condition as a Check Condition status.

reportDeferredErrors.description: This value is used to determine how deferred errors are reported to the host.

ignoreForceUnitAccess.description: This value determines controller treatment of the Force Unit Access Option in the SCSI Read(10) and Write(10) commands.

ignoreWriteCacheDisable.description: This value determines if the controller will allow the resetting of the WCE bit in the Mode Select Caching Page to disable write caching.

allowReservationOnUnownedLUNs.description: This value determines the controller response to Reservation/Release commands that are received for LUNs that are not owned by the controller.

worldWideNameInStandardInquiry.description: Set to true if the WWN is in the standard inquiry data.

propagateHostBusResets.description: This value determines whether the controller will propagate a Host Bus Reset/Target Reset/Logical Unit Reset to the other controller in a dual controller subsystem to support Microsoft Clustering Services.

forceSCSI2.description: Report SCSI-2 Through Fibre Channel Host Interface.

reportUnconfiguredLUNs.description: This value determines the LUN data returned by the Report LUNs command.

reportLUNPreferredPathInStandardInquiry.description: Report LUN Preferred Path in Standard Inquiry Data.

inquiryUnconfiguredDeviceType.description: The value returned in the Inquiry Device Type Field when an unconfigured LUN is accessed.

inquiryUnownedDeviceType.description: This value is used to define the device type the controller should return in the first byte of the Inquiry data, if the addressed logical unit is not owned by the addressed controller.

unownedBlock0Read.description: This value is used to define how the controller handles a read request to Block 0 of an unowned volume. When this is enabled, the non-owning controller sends a request for the block 0 data to the owning controller and the owning controller sends the requested block 0 data back to the non-owning controller. If disabled, the controller will do a volume transfer (if AVT is enabled) and then a read of the now owned volume.

retainLogins.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

hostPortType.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

maxRestrictedLUNs.description: Maximum number of LUNs allowed for host type.

avtExclusionExtentsEnabled.description: Enable the AVT exclusion extents for this heterogeneous host region.

suppressVolOffPreferredPathAlert.description: If true, then volume-off-preferred events are not considered critical.

hostType.description: The host type string. A zero-length string is allowed and indicates that the associated host-specific NVSRAM region has been cleared. This field should be used in place of the deprecated hostPortType field.

tpgsSupported.description: This field is set to true if Target Port Group Support is provided; otherwise it is false.

volumeFormatOptions.description: If true, a format unit request will interrupt any in-progress IAF and start a write-zeros initialization. If false, the format unit will be returned with no action.

restrictedLun0.description: If true, LUN 0 is restricted and volume mapping to LUN 0 will not be allowed or be reported in the REPORT LUNS data. If false, a volume-to-LUN mapping can be created to LUN 0 and will be reported in a REPORT LUNS response.

usePage2CQuiescenceTimeout.description: The quiescence timeout is the amount of time the controller should wait to achieve a "no I/Os active" state before invoking a forced transfer of LUN ownership. When this field is set to true, the timeout parameter provided by the host initiator in a mode select Page 2C will be used. When this field is set to false, the timeout value applied will be calculated by the controller.

asymmetricLUAccess.description: If true, Asymmetric Logical Unit Access is enabled.

ignoreISCSISessionIDInITN.description: If true, the array iSCSI target driver will not use the session identifier as part of its internal I_T Nexus identifiers. This reduces churn in I_T Nexus identifiers if the initiator does not re-use iSCSI session identifiers when re-opening a session.

enableLUCheckConditionParallelResponses.description: If true, array may return multiple CHECK CONDITION responses simultaneously on a given logical unit.

disableExplicitTPGS.description: If true, the standard INQUIRY data reporting TPGS support to the initiator will only indicate support for implicit mode (providing TPGS support is enabled, see tpgsSupported field).

unownedCheckConditionDuringFWActivation.description: If true, controller will return a LUN NOT OWNED (05h/94h/01h) CHECK CONDITION when unable to handle I/O during firmware activation.

allowPreferredOwnerReportingSuppression.description: If true, the controller will suppress reporting the preferred owner in REPORT TARGET PORT GROUPS or INQUIRY VPD data in conditions when the preferred controller cannot process I/O.

enableTargetFailback.description: If true, controller initiates fail-back of volumes to the preferred owner .

enableAutoLoadBalance.description: If true, the controller may issue volume ownership changes to balance IO load between controllers.

quiescenceInProgressSenseKey.description: Sense Key returned to host for Quiescence In Progress Check Conditions.

quiescenceInProgressASC.description: Additional Sense Code returned to host for Quiescence In Progress Check Conditions.

quiescenceInProgressASCQ.description: Additional Sense Code Qualifier returned to host for Quiscence In Progress Check Conditions.

persistentID.description: Unique identifier for this specific host type. This value is stored in the controller configuration database when persisting Host objects in order to uniquely identify this specific host type across all NVSRAM builds.

nvmeVUFailoverSupported.description: If true, a vendor unique (VU) NVMe failover solution is supported on the host.

nvmeStandardFailoverSupported.description: If true, the NVMe Asymmetric Namespace Access (ANA) failover solution is supported on the host.

hostUnmapEnabled.description: Whether the host type supports issuing unmap commands to a volume

hostTypeCategory.description: The host type category is used along with the host type priority to order the different host types available for selection when creating hosts.

hostTypePriority.description: The host type priority is used along with the host type category to order the different host types available for selection when creating hosts.

hostConnectivityReportingSupported.description: If true, this host type supports the host connectivity reporting feature within the array.

iocDumpEnabled.description: If true, IOC Dump is enabled in the controller.

iocDumpNeedsRetrieved.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

iocDumpTag.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

timeStamp.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

initiatorRef.description: The reference that uniquely identifies an instance of this object.

nodeName.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

alias.description: An additional name that can be assigned to an initiator, which is usually "friendlier" than the node name.

label.description: An additional "friendly" name that can be assigned to an initiator through the Storage Manager application.

configuredAuthMethods.description: The authentication methods that have been configured for the initiator. Associated secrets are not exposed. instead the type field of the EncryptedPassword is set to ENCRYPT_UNSPECIFIED.

hostRef.description: A reference to the Host object to which the initiator belongs.

initiatorInactive.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

initiatorNodeName.description: The unique identifier for this initiator and its properties.

nodeName.description: The unique node name associated with the initiator

interfaceType.description: The Media Transport Protocol in use by the initiator.

interconnectCRURef.description: The reference for this physical interconnect CRU

status.description: The operational status of the interconnect CRU

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the interconnect CRU. The parent reference in Location identifies the tray containing the CRU, and the position field is always one.

fruType.description: The VPD field replaceable unit type

readyToRemove.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

rtrAttributes.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the interconnect CRU component.

interposerTypeData.description: The vendor product data associated with the interposer.

vendorID.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string containing the vendor identification of the interposer.

productID.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string containing the product identification of the interposer.

revision.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string that represents the current version, or revision level, of the interposer.

deviceWWN.description: This data represents the device name of the interposer.

serialNumber.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string that represents the serial number of the interposer.

partNumber.description: This data is a variable length ASCII text string that represents the part number of the interposer.

driveFwVersion.description: 4 bytes left-justified ASCII drive firmware version as retrieved from the drive's standard INQUIRY data, followed by 4 blank bytes.

interposerType.description: This enumeration defines the different interposer types.

fcSasInterposer.description: This field is available when the interfaceTypeData is equal to INTERPOSER_TYPE_FC_TO_SAS

interfaceRef.description: A reference to the I/O interface.

hostBoardRef.description: The reference to the associated HIC.

icmpPingResponseEnabled.description: True if the storage array is enabled to respond to ICMP ping messages.

unnamedDiscoverySessionsEnabled.description: True if the storage array is enabled to participate in unnamed discovery sessions.

isnsServerTcpListenPort.description: The number of the TCP port on which the iSNS server listens for incoming connections.

ipv4IsnsServerAddressConfigMethod.description: The method by which the storage array determines the IPV4 address of the iSNS server.

ipv4IsnsServerAddress.description: The method by which the storage array determines the IPV4 address of the iSNS server.

ipv6IsnsServerAddressConfigMethod.description: The method by which the storage array determines the IPV6 address of the iSNS server. This is always set to "static" and cannot be changed.

ipv6IsnsServerAddress.description: The method by which the storage array determines the IPV6 address of the iSNS server. This is always set to "static" and cannot be changed.

isnsRegistrationState.description: The state of the iSCSI entity with respect to iSNS server registration.

isnsServerRegistrationEnabled.description: True if the storage array is enabled to register with the iSNS (Internet Storage Name Service) server.

hostPortsConfiguredDHCP.description: True if all the host ports have DHCP enabled, regardless of the configuration state.

initiatorNodeName.description: The iSCSI node name of the initiator.

initiatorSessionId.description: The initiator session ID associated with the initiator port.

portals.description: The IP addresses, portal group numbers, and port number for the initiator or target.

keyValueTagRef.description: The unique handle for a key-value object contained within this structure.

key.description: The key is a fixed length, opaque byte sequence that stores user-defined data.

value.description: The value is a fixed length opaque byte sequence that stores user-defined data.

keyValueTagRef.description: This field identifies the key-value tag to be associated with the Volume or Workload.

associatedObject.description: This element identifies the object that is associated with the key-value tag.

mappingRef.description: The unique identifier for the specific mapping between the KeyValueTag and the KeyValueTagObjectReference identified in this structure.

objectType.description: Enumeration used to define the different type of object that can be associated with a key value tag.

volume.description: This field is returned for an object of type Volume.

workload.description: This field is returned for an object of type Workload.

lockKeyIDRef.description: The unique reference to a lockKeyID.

metadataVolRef.description: This object identifies the metadata volume.

metadataVolType.description: This object specifies the metadata volume type.

preferredManager.description: The controller that created the metadata volume.

offline.description: True, if the volume is offline.

minihubRef.description: The reference for this physical minihub.

status.description: The operational status of the minihub.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the minihub. Note that the tray reference identifies the enclosure containing the minihub, but the slot information does not apply to this component.

minihubData.description: Information returned is based on the minihub type.

currentSpeed.description: The current speed of the minihub.

maxSpeed.description: The maximum speed of the minihub.

channel.description: The channel number that this minihub is associated with.

portList.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

vendorName.description: The vendor name of the minihub.

partNumber.description: The part number of the minihub.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the minihub.

fruType.description: The field replaceable unit type of the minihub.

manufacturerDate.description: The date the minihub was manufactured.

rtrAttributes.description: The CRU type of the minihub plus its ready-to-remove attributes, which are based on the CRU type

minihubType.description: This enumeration is used to identify the type of a minihub.

parentController.description: This field is present only if the minihubType value is equal to MINIHUB_TYPE_HOSTSIDE. It contains the detailed information about the controller the minihub is associated with.

worldWideName.description: The WWN of the local mirror volume.

mirrorProxyRef.description: The reference to the local mirror volume.

volumeHandle.description: The ssid of the local mirror volume.

localMirrorStatus.description: The status of the local mirror volume.

remoteMirrorStatus.description: The status of the remote mirror volume.

localRole.description: The role of the local mirror volume.

remoteRole.description: The role of the remote mirror volume.

localPriority.description: The synchronization priority for the local mirror volume.

peerPriority.description: The synchronization priority for the remote mirror volume.

usableCapacity.description: The amount of capacity being used by the mirror.

currentManager.description: The controller reference that owns the local mirror volume.

baseVolume.description: The reference to the base volume of the local mirror.

remoteVolRef.description: The reference to the remote volume.

action.description: An indication of what current long-running activity, if any, is currently in progress on the volume.

localWriteMode.description: The local mirror volume's write mode.

autoResync.description: Indicates whether auto resynchronization is allowed.

name.description: NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) of the host

portIdentifier.description: The unique identifier for the host port.

interfaceRef.description: The SYMbol array-wide unique name for the interface object.

channelType.description: The type of channel that the interface is associated with.

netInterfaceTypeData.description: A field whose contents vary depending on the type of the interface.

configGeneration.description: The configuration generation number that was in effect at the time this object bundle was constructed by the controller. The client can use this value to determine if it currently holds the latest version of the object graph.

sa.description: A StorageArray object that contains base information about the storage array as a whole.

tray.description: A variable-length array of Tray structures. This array contains one element for each tray object that exists within the storage array.

componentBundle.description: A variable-length array of Component structures. This array contains one element for each physical component object that exists within the storage array.

controller.description: A variable-length array of Controller structures. This array contains one element for each RAID controller object that exists within the storage array.

drive.description: A variable-length array of Drive structures. This array contains one element for each physical disk drive object that exists within the storage array.

volumeGroup.description: A variable-length array of VolumeGroup structures. This array contains one element for each volume group object that exists within the storage array.

volume.description: A variable-length array of VolumeGroup structures. This array contains one element for each volume group object that exists within the storage array.

freeExtent.description: A variable-length array of FreeExtent structures. This array contains one element for each free extent object that exists within the storage array.

dveVol.description: A variable-length array of DVE structures. This array contains one element for each volume being expanded.

storagePoolBundle.description: An embedded object bundle that contains all configuration information relative to the "Storage Partitions" feature.

highLevelVolBundle.description: An embedded object bundle that contains all the information relative to the Higher-Level Volumes.

ghostVolBundle.description: An embedded object bundle that contains all the information relative to missing volumes.

ioInterface.description: A variable-length array of IoInterface structures. This array contains one element for each I/O interface object that exists within the storage array

networkInterface.description: A variable-length array of NetworkInterface structures. This array contains one element for each network interface object that exists within the storage array

lockKeyIDs.description: A variable length array of LockKeyID structures. Contains lock key information for the array.

interposer.description: A variable length array of drive interposer data. An entry will appear in this array only if the interposerPresent field in the corresponding Drive structure is set to True.

ioInterfaceHicMap.description: This is a list of structures that provides a mapping from I/O interfaces to their associated HICs.

remoteArray.description: This is a list of remote arrays which this array has visibility to for monitoring.

flashCacheBundle.description: An embedded object bundle that contains all of the information related to flash cache objects.

applicationAwarenessBundle.description: This reports the key-value pairs and their references, and the mappings between Volumes and these key-value pairs. The data is used by the application and is opaque to the CFW.

pitGroupRef.description: A reference to the associated PiT Group.

pitTimestamp.description: The controller-time (measured in seconds since January 1, 1970) when the PiT was created.

pitSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number within PITGroup. This is a monotonically increasing sequence value that can be used to determine the absolute order of the PiTs within a PiT group. Using this sequence number avoids issues with timestamps when real-time clocks are changed. Note that this sequence number will be the same on all PiTs taken in multiple PITGroups at the same time under a single IO suspension, either as part of a consistency group operation (createCGPIT) or when a list of PITGroups is passed to createPIT.

status.description: The state of this PiT.

activeCOW.description: If true, the PiT is actively recording copy-on-write data.

isRollbackSource.description: If true, the PiT is a rollback source.

pitCapacity.description: The capacity in bytes of this PiT (capacity of the base at the time the PiT was created).

repositoryCapacityUtilization.description: Repository utilization in bytes (only reported if activeCOW = false).

pitGroupRef.description: The reference (key) for the PiT Group.

label.description: The name of the PiT Group. If this PiT group is part of a consistency group, then this label does not have to be present or unique as the parent consistency group label will be used.

status.description: The status of the PiT Group.

baseVolume.description: The base volume for this PiT Group.

repositoryVolume.description: The copy-on-write (CoW) Repository for this PiT group.

maxRepositoryCapacity.description: The maximum allowable repository size (in bytes) based on current cluster size. Only applicable if there is at least one PiT in the PiT group.

maxBaseCapacity.description: The maximum allowable base volume size (in bytes) based on current cluster size. Only applicable if there is at least one PiT in the PiT group.

unusableRepositoryCapacity.description: The amount of repository capacity that is unusable due to limited addressability of the current cluster size.

repFullPolicy.description: The behavior on repository full condition. Overridden by consistency group setting if this PITGroup is associated with a consistency group.

fullWarnThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold percentage.

autoDeleteLimit.description: The auto-delete indicator. If non-zero, the oldest PiT will be automatically deleted when creating a new one to keep the total number of PiTs limited to the number specified. This value is overridden by the consistency group setting if this PITGroup is associated with a consistency group.

rollbackStatus.description: The status of the rollback (if rollback is indicated in VolumeAction above).

rollbackPriority.description: The importance of the rollback operation.

consistencyGroup.description: If true, this PiT group is part of a consistency group.

consistencyGroupRef.description: A reference to the parent consistency group, if applicable. This value will be NULL if this PiT group is not part of a consistency group.

creationPendingStatus.description: The status of Pending PiT Creation.

volumeHandle.description: The PiT group SSID. This is provided primarily for debug purposes.

worldWideName.description: The WWN of the view.

baseVol.description: A reference to the base volume with which this view is associated.

basePIT.description: A reference to the particular PiT of the base for which this view applies. This field is only valid if the boundToPIT field is true.

boundToPIT.description: If true, this flag indicates that the basePIT field is a valid reference to an associated PIT. If false, the view is disassociated from the PiT so the basePIT reference is invalid.

label.description: The name of the view.

status.description: The view status.

currentManager.description: The current owner of the view.

preferredManager.description: The preferred owner of the view.

repositoryVolume.description: The copy-on-write repository for this view.

fullWarnThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold percentage.

viewTime.description: The controller-time (measured in seconds since January 1, 1970) when view was created or re-attached to another PiT.

viewSequenceNumber.description: Sequence number. This is a monotonically increasing sequence value that can be used to determine related views when the view was created as part of a consistency group operation.

volumeHandle.description: The volume ssid. This is provided primarily for debug purposes.

maxRepositoryCapacity.description: The maximum allowable repository size in bytes based on current cluster size.

unusableRepositoryCapacity.description: The amount of repository capacity in bytes that is unusable due to limited addressability of the current cluster size.

membership.description: This view's relationship (if any) to a Consistency Group View.

offline.description: The view is offline due to the associated repository volume state.

extendedUniqueIdentifier.description: A variable-length opaque field that provides the volume's extended unique identification value.

enabledOnHDD.description: Indicate whether or not P and Q parity validation is performed on HDD drives during reconstruction of RAID 6 and disk pool volumes.

enabledOnSSD.description: Indicate whether or not P and Q parity validation is performed on SSD drives during reconstruction of RAID 6 and disk pool volumes.

capability.description: This field will contain the value of the premium feature being described.

isEnabled.description: A true value in this field indicates that the feature is enabled (regardless of compliance)

isCompliant.description: A true value in this field indicates that the feature has been purchased (in compliance). A false value indicates that the feature has not been purchased. The user will receive warning messages indicating that they are not in compliance. The warning message will continue until the feature is purchased or the feature is disabled.

isWithinLimits.description: A true value in this field indicates that the feature has been purchased and the subsystem configuration does not exceed the feature options specified at purchase. A false value in this field indicates that the feature has been purchased but new subsystem configuration has caused the user to exceed the feature options that were purchased. The user will receive warning messages indicating that they are no longer in compliance. The user can change the subsystem configuration so that it is in compliance with feature options or the user can purchase additional feature options so that the subsystem is again in compliance. The warning messages will continue until the feature is again in compliance or is disabled.

featureId.description: This field contains the value of the feature ID associated with the feature.

processorMemoryDimmRef.description: The SYMbol reference value that uniquely identifies an instance of a cache memory DIMM object.

parentController.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

dimmControllerSlot.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

status.description: The operational status of the DIMM.

capacityInMegabytes.description: The capacity of the DIMM expressed in megabytes.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the DIMM.

partNumber.description: The LSI Logic part number of the DIMM.

oemPartNumber.description: The OEM part number of the DIMM.

manufacturerPartNumber.description: The manufacturer part number of the DIMM.

manufacturer.description: The manufacturer part number of the DIMM.

manufactureDate.description: The manufacture date of the DIMM

repairPolicy.description: The repair policy for the processor memory DIMM component.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the processor memory DIMM. The parent field of Location is set to the controller where the DIMM physically resides, and the position field is the parent-relative/like-component-relative slot number of the DIMM, starting at one.

revisionCode.description: The module revision code of the DIMM.

recurrenceType.description: This enumeration is used to specify the type of schedule recurrence.

recurrenceCount.description: This field is present only if recurrenceType is equal to RECURRENCE_COUNT.

recurrenceEndDate.description: This field is present only if recurrenceType is equal to RECURRENCE_END_DATE.

remoteArrayRef.description: A unique identifier for this RemoteArray object.

saId.description: The storage array ID of the remote array.

remoteTargets.description: One or more paths to the remote array. Note these could be differing protocols.

remoteRef.description: Unique identifier for this initiator/target object.

nodeName.description: Node name associated with the local initiator.

label.description: The user-assigned, descriptive label string for the remote target. Note: this is auto-generated for ARVM.

configuredAuthMethods.description: The authentication methods that have been configured for the remote target. Associated secrets are not exposed. The type field of the EncryptedPassword is set to ENCRYPT_UNSPECIFIED.

groupRef.description: SYMbol ref of the remote target group

label.description: User label for the remote target group

mgmtProperties.description: Management properties for the remote target group

remoteRef.description: SYMbol ref of the remote target

remoteTargetGroupControllerData.description: The current status of the Remote Target Group for each controller.

gatewayARN.description: Amazon Resource Name of the gateway

region.description: Amazon region of the gateway (i.e. us-east-1)

secretKeyGroup.description: Used to retrieve secrets for the AWS management APIs

controllerRef.description: A reference to the controller that is reporting its status.

remoteTargetGroupStatus.description: The status for the Remote Target Group for the given controller.

secretKeyGroup.description: Used to retrieve secrets for the ESeries management APIs

type.description: This enumeration specifies the remote target group type

volumeHandle.description: The SSID of the volume

worldWidename.description: A variable-length opaque field that provides the volume's world wide unique identification value

remoteTargetVolRef.description: The unique identification value for this volume. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the volume

remoteVolumeRef.description: The remote volume object identifier this object uses
