preferredManager.description: The controller that is preferred to own the volume

capacity.description: The actual capacity of the volume in bytes

blkSize.description: The block size (in bytes) of the volume

cache.description: The volume-specific caching parameters currently in effect for the volume

properties.description: The properties of the volume, e.g. string up to 224 characters used to manage the volume remotely

protectionType.description: T10 PI protection type of the volume

expectedProtectionInformationAppTag.description: Expected Protection Information Application Tag for the volume

cacheMirroringValidateProtectionInformat.description: True if checking of protection information during cache mirroring is enabled for this volume, false otherwise

remoteTargetGroupRef.description: The remote target group the remote target volume uses to access the remote volume

remoteTargetVolStatusReason.description: The reason for the volume's status.

type.description: This enumeration specifies the remote target group type

volumeARN.description: Amazon Resource Name of the remote volume

lunNumber.description: The lun number of the remote target volume
The lun number of the remote target volume

cacheBlkSize.description: The characteristic size, in bytes, of a cache block.

demandFlushAmount.description: Specifies the amount of cache data that will be flushed to disk when a cache flush operation is initiated. This value is specified as an integer in the range 0-100 that represents the percentage of the controller's write cache data that can remain in the "dirty", or unflushed state. When demand flush operations are started, data will be flushed from cache to disk until the overall amount of dirty data drops to or below the percentage specified by this value.

demandFlushThreshold.description: Specifies the "level of fullness" of "dirty" data in the controller's write cache which, when reached, will cause the controller to begin flushing data from cache to disk. This value is specified as a percentage, in the range 0-100, of the overall write cache capacity of the controller. After flushing begins, it will continue until enough data has been flushed to drop the percentage of dirty data to or below the value specified in the demandFlushAmount parameter described above.

cacheMirroringProtectionInformation.description: True if checking of protection information during cache mirroring is enabled, false otherwise.

needsAttention.description: An indication of whether the array needs attention. A value of true is returned if there are any components that have been marked failed for any reason. Otherwise, if all components are operating properly, a value of false is returned.

fixing.description: An indication of whether the array is in the process of recovering from a Needs Attention condition. A value of true indicates that no physical components are currently marked failed, but that some residual recovery activity (such as reconstruction, copyback, etc.) is still in progress.

saId.description: The globally-unique identifier value for this storage array.

managementClassName.description: The name of the application-level entity required to manage configuration operations for the storage array.

storageArrayLabel.description: The user-assigned label for the storage array.

bootTime.description: The timestamp value for the time at which the responding controller last booted. Note that this value may differ between the individual controllers of a storage array. This value is defined in terms of the number of seconds since midnight GMT on January 1, 1970.

fwVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

appVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

bootVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

nvsramVersion.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

fwPrefix.description: An ASCII string that describes the firmware prefix.

chassisSerialNumber.description: An ASCII string that describes the chassis serial number.

eventConfigurationDataVersion.description: An ASCII string that identifies the version of the MEL event configuration data. This is used for the event logging enhancements in Chessie 2.

extendedSAData.description: This element allows additional content to be added to SAData with actually adding any new elements to the struct. The element replaces a reserved field that was of variable length.

saPortRef.description: This object uniquely identifies an SAPort.

saPortGroupRef.description: This object uniquely identifies an SAPortGroup.

controllerRef.description: The reference value of the controller.

portId.description: The host-side I/O port identifier of the port on the controller.

saPortGroupRef.description: This object uniquely identifies a specific SAPortGroup.

label.description: The user assigned label for the SAPortGroup.

ioInterfaceType.description: This enumeration defines the different I/O interface types that may be reported as part of the configuration information associated with a controller.

portName.description: This field is present only if the type value is equal to IO_IF_FC.

ibPortName.description: This field is present only if the type value is equal to IO_IF_IB.

iscsiPortName.description: This field is present only if the type value is equal to IO_IF_ISCSI.

sasPortName.description: This field is present only if the type value is equal to IO_IF_SAS.

nvmeInitiatorPortId.description: Initiator Port ID for an NVMe over Fabrics host

trapDestination.description: SNMP Trap Destinations. Traps will be delivered to these destinations when an alertable MEL event is generated.

communityRef.description: A reference to the SNMP community.

principal.description: This enumeration defines the SNMP principal security model being used.

communityRef.description: A ref to the community being used.

usmUserRef.description: A ref to the USM user being used.

sysName.description: Value to be returned for system.sysName variable

sysContact.description: Value to be returned for system.sysContact variable

sysLocation.description: Value to be returned for system.sysLocation variable

trapReceiverIpAddress.description: IPVx address of the trap receiver

communityRef.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

sendAuthenticationFailureTraps.description: Send authentication failure traps to this destination.

principal.description: Union to specify principal associated with the trap destination.

usmUserRef.description: A reference to the SNMP USM user.

engineIdType.description: The USM User's engine ID type.

engineId.description: The USM user's authoritative engine ID.

calendar.description: Daily, weekly, or monthly calendar information.

startDate.description: The schedule will not run until this date/time, measured as seconds since midnight, January 1st, 1970 local time.

recurrence.description: The number of days, weeks, or months to run.

scheduleMethod.description: This enumeration specifies the different types of scheduling methods.

daily.description: This field is present only if scheduleMethod is equal to SCHEDULE_METHOD_DAILY.

weekly.description: This field is present only if scheduleMethod is equal to SCHEDULE_METHOD_WEEKLY.

monthlyByDate.description: This field is present only if scheduleMethod is equal to SCHEDULE_METHOD_MONTHLY_DATE.

monthlyByDay.description: This field is present only if scheduleMethod is equal to SCHEDULE_METHOD_MONTHLY_DAY.

dailySchedule.description: Conveys time information, including time of day, recurrence and occurrence frequency.

schedRef.description: A reference to the schedule object.

scheduleStatus.description: The current status of the schedule.

action.description: The type of action to be taken.

creationTime.description: The schedule creation time (local time) measured as seconds since January 1, 1970.

lastRunTime.description: The last run time (local time) measured as seconds since January 1, 1970.

nextRunTime.description: The next run time (local time) measured as seconds since January 1, 1970.

stopTime.description: The local time after which schedule is no longer active, measured as seconds since January 1, 1970.

daysOfMonth.description: This is a bit mask. Values from the DayOfMonth enumeration should be added (or OR'ed) together to set this value.

monthsOfYear.description: This is a bit mask. Values from the MonthOfYear enumeration should be added (or OR'ed) together to set this value.

dailySchedule.description: Conveys time information, including time of day, recurrence and occurrence frequency.

dayOfWeek.description: The day of the week. This is NOT a bit mask.

dailySchedule.description: Conveys time information, including time of day, recurrence and occurrence frequency.

weekNumber.description: The week number during the month. For example, 1 = first, 2 = second, etc., and 5 = last.

monthsOfYear.description: This is a bit mask. Values from the MonthOfYear enumeration should be added (or OR'ed) together to set this value.

daysOfWeek.description: This is a bit mask. Values from the DayOfWeek enumeration should be added (or OR'ed) together to set this value.

dailySchedule.description: Conveys time information, including time of day, recurrence and occurrence frequency.

ioInterfaceType.description: This enumeration defines the different I/O interface types that may be reported as part of the configuration information associated with a controller.

worldWideName.description: The World Wide Name of the snapshot.

label.description: Name of the snapshot.

status.description: Indicates status of the snapshot.

overWarnThreshold.description: True if the repository utilization is over the warning threshold.

repositoryFull.description: True, if the repository is full.

repFullPolicy.description: Indication of the volume behavior when the repository is full.

rollbackPriority.description: The importance of the rollback operation (0-4). Not used in this release of software.

extentStart.description: The start position of the extent in the base volume (bytes). Not used in this release of software.

extentSize.description: The size of the extent in bytes. Not used in this release of software.

snapshotTime.description: The controller time when the snapshot was created.

childrenInactive.description: True if all child volumes are offline or failed. Child volumes are the base volume and the REPOSITORY volume.

volumeHandle.description: Volume SSID.

rollbackStatus.description: Status of current action being performed on snapshot.

saData.description: General information and characteristics of the storage array.

safeId.description: This field contains a unique identifier maintained by SAFE for use by storage management software. Storage management software uses this data to enable SAFE features and perform Feature Bundle migration.

cache.description: Information about cache settings that apply to the storage array as a whole.

accessVolume.description: Information about the access volume that is used to convey configuration commands (via the UTM protocol) to the controllers within the storage array.

featureParameters.description: An object that provides information about the parameters and limits of certain functions that are supported by the controllers that reside within the storage array.

mediaScanPeriod.description: The current value of the media scan period parameter for the storage array. This value indicates the number of days over which a complete scan of the media will occur. The array controller(s) will attempt to achieve this configured period on a best-effort basis, but certain operational factors may cause slight deviations from the configured value.

capabilities.description: A variable-length array that provides an enumeration of the high-level capabilities that are supported by the controllers that reside within the storage array.

premiumFeatures.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

trayPositionList.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

hostPortType.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

hostSpecificVals.description: The values from the heterogeneous host regions. Each element in this array corresponds to a type in the hostPortType array, and the ordering of the types in this array matches that of the hostPortType array, i.e., hostPortType[i] is equal to hostSpecificVals[i].hostPortType.

compatibility.description: A variable-length array of firmware compatibility specifiers. These values generally identify certain levels of firmware that are allowed for downgrading the current storage array firmware.

definedPartitionCount.description: The number of partitions calculated from the user's current mappings.

defaultHostPortTypeIndex.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

remoteAccessID.description: Array-specific ID used for remote device discovery.

stagedFirmware.description: Information on possible staged controller firmware.

unreadableSectors.description: Storage array unreadable sector count and max limit.

driveChannels.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

portLocations.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

ddcTag.description: The tag value to be used in retrieving DDC log data. A value of DDC_NULL_TAG indicates there is no DDC log data to retrieve.

featureBundle.description: A structure describing the features and feature limits that are associated with this storage array product.

featureState.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

channelPortLocations.description: A list of all channel ports in the storage array, including host channel ports, drive channel ports, and ESM channel ports.

iscsiEntityData.description: Information about the storage array pertaining to its role as an iSCSI entity.

hostType.description: This variable-length array has label values that provide descriptive strings for each supported index value that can appear in the Host object. Zero-length strings are allowed and indicate that the associated host-specific NVSRAM regions have been cleared. This field should be used in place of the deprecated hostPortType field.

defaultHostTypeIndex.description: The Host Type Index to use for undefined and newly created host ports.

rvmControllerHostChannel.description: The number (in the range 1 through n, where n is the number of host ports on an individual controller) of the controller host channel that the firmware uses for remote volume mirroring. This field is set to zero when the data is unavailable or not applicable, including when the RVM feature is disabled,

smartBatteryData.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

invalidSystemConfig.description: True if the storage array has an invalid system configuration; otherwise false.

securityLockKey.description: A boolean which describes the current state of the lock key. True if the array lock key has been set, otherwise false.

lockKeyIDRef.description: The lock key ID for the storage array.

syslogConfiguration.description: This field contains the configuration information used by the storage array for writing MEL events to a syslog server.

securityExternalKmsEnable.description: True if external key management is in effect and false if controller is using local key management.

newKeySequence.description: Sequence number used to serialize installNewKey requests from multiple proxy key management SYMbol servers.

securityExternalKmsKeyStatus.description: The controller's current key status. If external key management not enabled, set to EXTERNAL_KMS_KEY_STATUS_OK.

lockKeyNeededList.description: Contains the lock key IDs of keys needed by the array controller.

dplCoreDumpData.description: Information about a core dump in controller memory, if one exists.

fcRVMState.description: Indicator of whether fibre channel remote mirroring has been enabled, and if so, whether it is enabled for use by legacy (synchronous) mirroring or ARVM. If this is set to something other than FC_MIRROR_STATE_DISABLED or FC_MIRROR_STATE_UNKNOWN, then the rvmControllerHostChannel field can be used to determine the particular host channel reserved for remote mirroring.

asupOnDemandEnabled.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

asupRemoteDiagsEnabled.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

iocDumpData.description: Information about an IOC Dump in controller memory, if one exists.

driveChannelPortDisabled.description: True if one or more drive channel ports have been disabled by the controllers to protect against faulty expansion cabling. This could have been necessitated by a miswire condition or by a bad expansion cable. Check the Recovery Events for an indication of which connection(s) have been disabled and correct the cabling as required.

directExpansionPortInUse.description: This boolean is true if direct expansion ports are in use by the controllers.

highResolutionStatisticsEnabled.description: Cumulative Performance stats high resolution indicator

autoLoadBalancingEnabled.description: Auto Load Balancing is user-enabled on this array

reserved3.description: This reserved field is needed to maintain compatibility with host applications.

embeddedExternalKMSInformation.description: This structure contains the external key management information. See the structure definition for details.

isLun0RestrictedForDefaultPartition.description: Provides an indication of whether LUN 0 is restricted (disallowed) for the default storage partition.

parityCheckOnMediaType.description: Indicate whether or not P and Q parity validation is performed on certain drive media types during reconstruction of RAID 6 and disk pool volumes on the Storage Array.

hostConnectivityReportingEnabled.description: If host connectivity reporting is enabled/disabled for the the array.

resourceProvisionedVolumesEnabled.description: True if resource provisioning is enabled by default when a volume group or pool that supports this capability is created, false otherwise.

sanitizeAsupSetting.description: Determines the AutoSupport sanitize setting and whether content included in the AutoSupport bundle will be sanitized.

saPortGroup.description: A variable-length array containing all SAPortGroup objects that are currently configured and available.

saPort.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

cluster.description: A variable-length array containing all defined Cluster objects for the storage array configuration.

host.description: A variable-length array containing all defined Host objects for the storage array configuration.

hostPort.description: A variable-length array containing all defined HostPort objects for the storage array configuration.

lunMapping.description: A variable-length array containing all defined LUNMapping objects for the storage array configuration.

initiator.description: A variable-length array containing all Initiator objects defined in the storage array configuration.

target.description: A variable-length array containing all Target objects defined in the storage array configuration.

remoteTarget.description: A variable-length array containing all Remote Target objects defined in the storage array configuration. Remote Target objects define the initiator/target on a remote array.

syslogEnabled.description: This field is set to true if the writing of MEL events to a syslog server is enabled; otherwise it is false.

syslogServerPortNumber.description: This field holds the UDP port number of the syslog server. The default value of this field is SYSLOG_DEFAULT_UDP_PORT.

syslogServerIpAddress.description: This field holds the IPVx address of the syslog server. The default value of this field is zero (0.0.0.0).

volumeHandle.description: The volumeHandle (SSID) for this volume.

worldWideName.description: The World wide name of the volume.

label.description: The name of the volume.

allocationGranularity.description: The allocation cluster size for the Expandable Repository Volume.

capacity.description: The virtual capacity of the volume in bytes.

reconPriority.description: Importance of fixing the volume if failed (0-4).

status.description: The operational status of the volume.

repositoryRef.description: The Expandable Repository Volume underlying this Thin Volume.

currentManager.description: The controller that currently manages the volume.

preferredManager.description: The controller that should manage the volume.

preReadRedundancyCheckEnabled.description: If true, verify RAID redundancy on read operations.

protectionType.description: The protection type of the volume.

applicationTagOwned.description: True if application tag is owned by the storage array.

maxVirtualCapacity.description: The maximum virtual capacity to which this thin volume can grow (in bytes).

initialProvisionedCapacity.description: The initial provisioned capacity for the Expandable Repository Volume for this thin volume (in bytes).

currentProvisionedCapacity.description: The current provisioned capacity of the Expandable Repository Volume (in bytes).

provisionedCapacityQuota.description: The maximum capacity of the Expandable Repository Volume (in bytes).

growthAlertThreshold.description: The percent value at which an alert is generated.

expansionPolicy.description: The automatic Expandable Repository Volume expansion policy.

volumeCache.description: The cache parameters of the underlying repository.

offline.description: The thin volume is offline due to the associated repository volume state.

reportingPolicy.description: Indicates how the thin volume is reported on the SCSI interface.

extendedUniqueIdentifier.description: A variable-length opaque field that provides the volume's extended unique identification value.

tzOffset.description: The time zone offset measured in seconds +/- from GMT.

dstStart.description: The DST start date and time.

dstEnd.description: The DST end date and time.

dstAdjust.description: The number of seconds to adjust the clock during DST

trayId.description: The tray ID of the tray.

rackId.description: An identifier of the enclosure (i.e. rack) in which the tray resides. This is not supported in the current release of the firmware.

trayPosition.description: A variable-length array of TrayPosition objects.

count.description: The current number of unreadable sectors persisted.

maxLimit.description: The maximum number of unreadable sectors allowed.

upsRef.description: The reference for this physical UPS.

status.description: The operational status of the UPS.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the UPS. Note that the tray reference identifies the enclosure containing the UPS, but the slot information does not apply to this component.

offline.description: An indication of whether the volume is currently offline.

extremeProtection.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

volumeHandle.description: The internal identifier value associated with this volume. When the Storage Partitions feature is NOT present, this value represents the logical unit number (LUN) that is used to access the volume via the host I/O path. If the Storage Partitions feature IS enabled, this field has no external meaning.

raidLevel.description: The RAID level for which this volume is configured.

sectorOffset.description: The sector offset of this volume within its volume group. This value is provided only to allow the client application to determine the relative positions of multiple volumes within a given volume group. No other assumptions or computations should be made with this value.

worldWideName.description: A variable-length opaque field that provides the volume's worldwide unique identification value.

label.description: The user-assigned symbol label associated with the volume.

blkSize.description: The block size (in bytes) of the volume.

capacity.description: The capacity (in bytes) of the volume.

reconPriority.description: The reconstruction priority value for the volume. This value is in the range 0-4, with 0 indicating that reconstruction is favored over any I/O, and 4 indicating that reconstruction should be performed with minimal impact to I/O. Intermediate values indicate various levels of compromise between these two extremes.

segmentSize.description: The segment size (in bytes) of the volume. The segment size is, for the most part, an indication of the stripe depth used to lay out the volume's block addresses.

action.description: An indication of what current long-running activity, if any, is currently in progress on the volume.

cache.description: The volume-specific caching parameters currently in effect for the volume.

mediaScan.description: The volume-specific media scan settings currently in effect for the volume.

volumeRef.description: The unique identification value for this volume. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the volume.

status.description: The current operational state of the volume.

volumeGroupRef.description: The volume group reference value of the volume group on which this volume resides.

currentManager.description: The reference value of the controller that currently owns (i.e. manages) this volume. In non-AVT (Auto Volume Transfer) mode, host I/O access to the blocks in this volume is permitted only through the controller that is the current manager. In AVT mode, an I/O access to the controller that is not the current manager causes it to automatically become the current manager.

preferredManager.description: The reference value of the controller that is the preferred manager of the volume. The preferred manager is tracked independent of the current manager, since the current manager may be switched dynamically as a result of host-base multi-path transitions. Later, when the error conditions that cause a multi-path transition have been corrected it is still possible to determine the preferred manager and switch ownership back to it.

dssPreallocEnabled.description: True if dynamic segment sizing pre-allocation is enabled for the volume.

dssMaxSegmentSize.description: The maximum segment size (in bytes) that this volume could assume with the dynamic segment sizing feature. This field is only meaningful if dssPreallocEnabled is true.

preReadRedundancyCheckEnabled.description: If set to true, then the storage controller will, on READ operations, verify the consistency of RAID redundancy data for the stripe(s) containing the READ data.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

protectionType.description: The protection type of the volume.

applicationTagOwned.description: True if application tag is owned by the storage array.

repairedBlockCount.description: This element contains a count of the number of blocks in the volume that have had data assurance errors repaired.

extendedUniqueIdentifier.description: A variable-length opaque field that provides the volume's extended unique identification value.

cacheMirroringValidateProtectionInformat.description: True if checking of protection information during cache mirroring is enabled for this volume, false otherwise

expectedProtectionInformationAppTag.description: Expected Protection Information Application Tag for the volume

hostUnmapEnabled.description: An indication as to whether a host is allowed to issue unmap commands to the volume

cachePoolID.description: The cache pool ID this volume is assigned to. If no specific cache pool ID is assigned to the volume, this field is set to 0. The range for cache pool ID is from 1 to maxCachePoolID, which can be obtained from the maxCachePoolID field in the FeatureParams struct based on the number of cache pools supported by the controller.

blkSizePhysical.description: This reports the physical block size (in bytes) used when sending I/O to the underlying drives.

dataDriveCount.description: Number of data drives in a RAID stripe.

parityDriveCount.description: Number of parity drives in a RAID stripe.

allocGranularity.description: Allocation granularity size (in bytes) of the volume. Use to determine how much physical capacity will be consumed during a volume expansion. Note that in a disk pool, different volumes may have different values (i.e. because of different RAID levels and/or different stripe widths).

cwob.description: A true value means that the controller is allowed to use write-back caching of dirty data even when the cache memory's battery-backup protection is not available or not operational. A false value means that any problems with the battery-backup protection of the write cache will cause the controller to suspend all write-back caching operations for the volume.

enterpriseCacheDump.description: A true value means that all dirty data in the write cache will be flushed immediately and further write-back caching will be disabled if the controller detects that a UPS unit has switched from standard power to battery backup. A false value means that write-back caching is not impacted by the state of the UPS.

mirrorActive.description: An indication of whether the cache mirroring option is active for the volume's data.

mirrorEnable.description: An indication of whether the cache mirroring feature is currently enabled for this volume. It is possible that the mirrorEnable and mirrorActive values differ; this may occur, for example, if the alternate controller is removed or failed.

readCacheActive.description: An indication of whether read caching is active for the volume.

readCacheEnable.description: An indication of whether read caching is enabled for the volume. Note that this value may not match the readCacheActive setting in cases where problems with the controller cache or its battery back-up have been detected.

writeCacheActive.description: An indication of whether write-back caching is active for the volume.

writeCacheEnable.description: An indication of whether write-back caching is enabled for the volume. Note that this value may not match the writeCacheActive setting in cases where problems with the controller cache or its battery back-up have been detected.

cacheFlushModifier.description: The cache flush modifier value, which is used to specify the maximum amount of time that dirty data for this volume may be retained in the controller's write cache prior to being flushed to disk.

readAheadMultiplier.description: A true (non-zero) / false (zero) indicator of whether or not automatic cache read-ahead is enabled.

worldWideName.description: The World Wide Name of the volume copy.

volcopyHandle.description: The Volume Copy ID(ssid of proxy).

status.description: Indicates status of copy.

idleTargetWriteProt.description: Apply write protection to target volume when copy is idle (true/false).

cloneCopy.description: The volume copy is a clone.

pgRef.description: For clones based on PiT Groups, this will identify the PiT Group.

type.description: Volume copy type

autoClearOnCompletion.description: Indicates if the relationship between the source and target volumes should automatically be cleared on completion of the volume copy operation.

sequenceNum.description: A sequence number that uniquely identifies this volume group within the array in which it resides. Sequence numbers are assigned to volume groups when they are created or imported into a storage array. The controller assigns the lowest unused sequence number during a creation or import operation.

offline.description: An indication of whether the volume group is currently offline. A volume group can be taken offline by the operator in preparation for removing its drives and transporting them to another storage array.

raidLevel.description: The RAID level associated with this volume group. If the storage array supports multiple RAID levels per volume group, this value will be set to RAID_ALL. Otherwise, it will indicate the precise RAID level defined for the volume group.

worldWideName.description: A variable-length opaque field that provides the volume group's worldwide unique identification value.

volumeGroupRef.description: The unique identification value for this volume group. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the volume group.

trayLossProtection.description: An indication as to whether the volume group has tray loss protection.

label.description: The volume group label, which can be set by the user.

state.description: The state of the volume group.

spindleSpeedMatch.description: Set to true if all of the drives in the group have matching normalized spindle speeds. (Normalized spindle speeds are standardized norms (e.g., 5400, 7200, etc.) that are used for spindle speed matching, even though actual spindle speeds may be within a designated delta of the normalized speed.)

spindleSpeed.description: Set to true if all of the drives in the group have matching normalized spindle speeds. (Normalized spindle speeds are standardized norms (e.g., 5400, 7200, etc.) that are used for spindle speed matching, even though actual spindle speeds may be within a designated delta of the normalized speed.)

isInaccessible.description: True if the volume group contains incompatible drives that have been locked out.

securityType.description: security status of the drive group

drawerLossProtection.description: This field is set to true when the volume group has drawer loss protection; otherwise it is set to false

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

protectionInformationCapabilities.description: This structure contains a protectionInformationCapable field which is set to true if all drives in the volume group are Protection Information (PI) capable. It also contains a field that is set to the protection type for the volume group.

driveBlockFormat.description: Identifies the drive block format of the volume candidate.

reservedSpaceAllocated.description: This field will be used to report whether or not reserved space has been claimed on all drives in the volume group. The recovery-volume script will include this field for each volume group record it creates, so that during volume recovery the volume group is recreated correctly.

securityLevel.description: Refines the information in the securityType field to describe the set of drives.

dulbeEnabled.description: An indication as to whether DULBE is enabled on the drives in the volume group.

blkSizeSupported.description: Lists the block size(s) supported for volumes created in this volume group.

blkSizeRecommended.description: The recommended block size for volumes created within this volume group.

type.description: This enumeration is used to indicate the type of the volume group.

diskPoolData.description: This field is present only if the value of type is equal to VG_TYPE_DISK_POOL.

usageHint.description: How the volume will be used (e.g. multimedia, transactional, file system).

readAhead.description: A true (non-zero) / false (zero) indicator of whether or not automatic cache read-ahead is enabled.

workloadRef.description: The unique handle for the object contained within this structure (a 1st class object).

description.description: The workload description describes the workload (not the workload type).

mappingRef.description: This field is the unique identifier for the mapping between the workload and the volume.

workloadRef.description: This field is the unique identifier for the Workload.

volumeRef.description: This field is the unique identifier for the volume.

tokenId.description: The token to retrieve the next page of statistics. If this value is null, the original request has been completed.

statistics.description: List of storage-system statistics. The size of this list is not guaranteed to be backwards compatible. This list will currently contain a max of 30 time periods worth of statistics.

PagedAnalyzedSystemStats.description: the latest storage-system statistics organized from latest to oldest. There is no guarantee that the all items from the same time period will be on the same page

tokenId.description: The token to retrieve the next page of statistics. If this value is null, the original request has been completed.

statistics.description: List of controller statistics. The size of this list is not guaranteed to be backwards compatible. This list will currently contain a max of 15 time periods worth of statistics.

PagedAnalyzedControllerStats.description: the latest controller statistics organized from latest to oldest. There is no guarantee that the all items from the same time period will be on the same page

tokenId.description: The token to retrieve the next page of statistics. If this value is null, the original request has been completed.

statistics.description: List of interface statistics. The size of this list is not guaranteed to be backwards compatible. This list will currently contain a max of 5 time periods worth of statistics.

PagedAnalyzedInterfaceStats.description: the latest interface statistics organized from latest to oldest. There is no guarantee that the all items from the same time period will be on the same page

tokenId.description: The token to retrieve the next page of statistics. If this value is null, the original request has been completed.

statistics.description: List of interface statistics. The size of this list is not guaranteed to be backwards compatible. This list will currently contain a max of 3 time periods worth of statistics.

PagedAnalyzedVolumeStats.description: the latest volume statistics organized from latest to oldest. There is no guarantee that the all items from the same time period will be on the same page

tokenId.description: The token to retrieve the next page of statistics. If this value is null, the original request has been completed.

statistics.description: List of interface statistics. The size of this list is not guaranteed to be backwards compatible. This list will currently contain a max of 50 items in the list.

PagedAnalyzedDriveStats.description: the latest drive statistics organized from latest to oldest. There is no guarantee that the all items from the same time period will be on the same page

PasswordStatusResponse.description: Indicate if the passwords are set on the storage array

currentAdminPassword.description: The current admin password of the storage system

adminPassword.description: If this is true, this call will set the admin password, if false, it sets the RO password

newPassword.description: The new password for the storage system

PasswordSetRequest.description: Passed in to set the passwords. The security on this call is a little different. If the admin password is not set and adminPassword is true, than this call is allowed. If the admin password is set, then the user must have a valid login session as admin

offline.description: An indication of whether the volume is currently offline.

extremeProtection.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

volumeHandle.description: The internal identifier value associated with this volume. When the Storage Partitions feature is NOT present, this value represents the logical unit number (LUN) that is used to access the volume via the host I/O path. If the Storage Partitions feature IS enabled, this field has no external meaning.

raidLevel.description: The RAID level for which this volume is configured.

sectorOffset.description: The sector offset of this volume within its volume group. This value is provided only to allow the client application to determine the relative positions of multiple volumes within a given volume group. No other assumptions or computations should be made with this value.

worldWideName.description: A variable-length opaque field that provides the volume's worldwide unique identification value.

label.description: The user-assigned symbol label associated with the volume.

blkSize.description: The block size (in bytes) of the volume.

capacity.description: The capacity (in bytes) of the volume.

reconPriority.description: The reconstruction priority value for the volume. This value is in the range 0-4, with 0 indicating that reconstruction is favored over any I/O, and 4 indicating that reconstruction should be performed with minimal impact to I/O. Intermediate values indicate various levels of compromise between these two extremes.

segmentSize.description: The segment size (in bytes) of the volume. The segment size is, for the most part, an indication of the stripe depth used to lay out the volume's block addresses.

action.description: An indication of what current long-running activity, if any, is currently in progress on the volume.

cache.description: The volume-specific caching parameters currently in effect for the volume.

mediaScan.description: The volume-specific media scan settings currently in effect for the volume.

volumeRef.description: The unique identification value for this volume. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the volume.

status.description: The current operational state of the volume.

volumeGroupRef.description: The volume group reference value of the volume group on which this volume resides.

currentManager.description: The reference value of the controller that currently owns (i.e. manages) this volume. In non-AVT (Auto Volume Transfer) mode, host I/O access to the blocks in this volume is permitted only through the controller that is the current manager. In AVT mode, an I/O access to the controller that is not the current manager causes it to automatically become the current manager.

preferredManager.description: The reference value of the controller that is the preferred manager of the volume. The preferred manager is tracked independent of the current manager, since the current manager may be switched dynamically as a result of host-base multi-path transitions. Later, when the error conditions that cause a multi-path transition have been corrected it is still possible to determine the preferred manager and switch ownership back to it.

dssPreallocEnabled.description: True if dynamic segment sizing pre-allocation is enabled for the volume.

dssMaxSegmentSize.description: The maximum segment size (in bytes) that this volume could assume with the dynamic segment sizing feature. This field is only meaningful if dssPreallocEnabled is true.

preReadRedundancyCheckEnabled.description: If set to true, then the storage controller will, on READ operations, verify the consistency of RAID redundancy data for the stripe(s) containing the READ data.

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

protectionType.description: The protection type of the volume.

applicationTagOwned.description: True if application tag is owned by the storage array.

repairedBlockCount.description: This element contains a count of the number of blocks in the volume that have had data assurance errors repaired.

extendedUniqueIdentifier.description: A variable-length opaque field that provides the volume's extended unique identification value.

cacheMirroringValidateProtectionInformat.description: True if checking of protection information during cache mirroring is enabled for this volume, false otherwise

expectedProtectionInformationAppTag.description: Expected Protection Information Application Tag for the volume

hostUnmapEnabled.description: An indication as to whether a host is allowed to issue unmap commands to the volume

cachePoolID.description: The cache pool ID this volume is assigned to. If no specific cache pool ID is assigned to the volume, this field is set to 0. The range for cache pool ID is from 1 to maxCachePoolID, which can be obtained from the maxCachePoolID field in the FeatureParams struct based on the number of cache pools supported by the controller.

blkSizePhysical.description: This reports the physical block size (in bytes) used when sending I/O to the underlying drives.

dataDriveCount.description: Number of data drives in a RAID stripe.

parityDriveCount.description: Number of parity drives in a RAID stripe.

allocGranularity.description: Allocation granularity size (in bytes) of the volume. Use to determine how much physical capacity will be consumed during a volume expansion. Note that in a disk pool, different volumes may have different values (i.e. because of different RAID levels and/or different stripe widths).

volumeCopyTarget.description: This value is true if the volume is currently the target of a volume copy pair.

volumeCopySource.description: This value is true if the volume is currently the source in a volume copy pair.

asyncMirrorTarget.description: This value is true if the volume is currently the target in an Asynchronous Mirror relationship.

asyncMirrorSource.description: This value is true if the volume is currently the source in an Asynchronous Mirror relationship.

remoteMirrorSource.description: True if the volume is a source (primary), in an Remote Volume Mirror relationship.

remoteMirrorTarget.description: True if the volume is a target (secondary), in an Remote Volume Mirror relationship.

diskPool.description: True if the volume was defined on a DiskPool.

flashCached.description: True if this volume is added to a flashCache.

increasingBy.description: If a Dynamic Volume Expansion (DVE) is in progress, the total capacity the volume is being increased by, otherwise zero.

cacheSettings.description: The volume-specific caching parameters currently in effect for the volume.

key.description: They key for the property.  Some keys are reserved include:workload

value.description: The value associated with the key

VolumeMetadataItem.description: Key/Value pair for volume meta data

srcVolID.description: Remote Volume Mirror source volume ID.

role.description: Remote Volume Mirror role. 0, set role to primary.  1, set role to secondary

updateType.description: Remote Volume Mirror update type request.

JobProgress.description:
A Volume Copy Job Control provides the start-stop operation for a Volume Copy Job and reports the copy progress of the volume copy job.

The valid values for the PUT control attribute are "start" and "stop"

securityMatch.description: True if the drive security settings for the base pool and the candidate's pool match.

daMatch.description: True if the DataAssurance settings for the base and the candidate match.

driveTypeMatch.description: True if the drives for the base pool and the candidate's pool match.

existingCandidate.description: True if the repository candidate is based on an existing volume and does not require a volume creation to occur.

percentCapacity.description: Percent capacity of the baseVolume to use for the repository.

concatVolumeType.description: Define the type of object the repository will be utilized for. This will allow the capacity to be adjusted to meet required minimums.

status.description: The status/state of the concatenated volume. This will be the worst status among the member volumes.

memberCount.description: The number of actual storage volumes comprising this volume. Note that this is just for convenience, this information can be derived from member objects.

aggregateCapacity.description: The aggregate capacity in bytes of all member volumes.

volumeHandle.description: The volume ssid. This is provided primarily for debug purposes.

allowedOperations.description: Operations allowed on the ConcatVolume. This can be used if ConcatVolume is ever exposed as a host-addressable volume to specify whether the volume is host-mappable or not (repository volumes would never be mappable).

repositoryRef.description: Identifier of the concatVolume to expand.

expansionCandidate.description: An expansion candidate to use for expanding the capacity of the repository.

ConcatVolumeExpansionRequest.description: Expand the repository of a Snapshot Group, Snapshot Volume, AsyncMirror Member, or ThinVolume.

entityId.description: Globally unique name for SAML entity

singleSignOnEndpoint.description: Single sign-on endpoint users will be redirected to for authentication

singleLogoutEndpoint.description: Single sign-on endpoint users will be redirected to for logout

roles.description: List of role mappings for this identity provider

signingCertificates.description: List of X.509 certificates used by the identity provider to sign messages

attribute.description: Group attributes from the Identity Provider

samlEnabled.description: True if SAML enabled, false otherwise

status.description: The status of the test

redirectUrl.description: The URL with encoded SAML authentication request

SamlAuthenticationRedirectResponse.description: Response that contains the redirect URL for authentication

redirectUrl.description: The URL to return to after successful authentication

SamlLoginRequest.description: Payload for a SAML authentication request

SamlRolesRequest.description: Payload to map roles to an identity provider

fileName.description: The name that the exported file should be given

passPhrase.description: The passphrase for the security key

SecurityKeyFileRequest.description: This class describes the input for a obtaining a security key file

lockKeyId.description: The id of the lock key.
An id used to identify the generated lock key.

pitGroupRef.description: The reference (key) for the PiT Group.

label.description: The name of the PiT Group. If this PiT group is part of a consistency group, then this label does not have to be present or unique as the parent consistency group label will be used.

status.description: The status of the PiT Group.

baseVolume.description: The base volume for this PiT Group.

repositoryVolume.description: The copy-on-write (CoW) Repository for this PiT group.

maxRepositoryCapacity.description: The maximum allowable repository size (in bytes) based on current cluster size. Only applicable if there is at least one PiT in the PiT group.

maxBaseCapacity.description: The maximum allowable base volume size (in bytes) based on current cluster size. Only applicable if there is at least one PiT in the PiT group.

unusableRepositoryCapacity.description: The amount of repository capacity that is unusable due to limited addressability of the current cluster size.

repFullPolicy.description: The behavior on repository full condition. Overridden by consistency group setting if this PITGroup is associated with a consistency group.

fullWarnThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold percentage.

autoDeleteLimit.description: The auto-delete indicator. If non-zero, the oldest PiT will be automatically deleted when creating a new one to keep the total number of PiTs limited to the number specified. This value is overridden by the consistency group setting if this PITGroup is associated with a consistency group.

rollbackStatus.description: The status of the rollback (if rollback is indicated in VolumeAction above).

rollbackPriority.description: The importance of the rollback operation.

consistencyGroup.description: If true, this PiT group is part of a consistency group.

consistencyGroupRef.description: A reference to the parent consistency group, if applicable. This value will be NULL if this PiT group is not part of a consistency group.

creationPendingStatus.description: The status of Pending PiT Creation.

volumeHandle.description: The PiT group SSID. This is provided primarily for debug purposes.

repositoryCapacity.description: The aggregate capacity of the repository in bytes

name.description: The name of the new snapshot group.

warningThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold, as a percentage of the      repository volume capacity.

autoDeleteLimit.description: The automatic deletion indicator. If non-zero, the oldest snapshot      image will be automatically deleted when creating a new snapshot image to keep the total      number of snapshot images limited to the number specified.

fullPolicy.description: The behavior on when the data repository becomes full. This value      is overridden by consistency group setting if this snapshot group is associated with a      consistency group.

rollbackPriority.description: The importance of the rollback operation. This value is overridden by consistency group setting if this snapshot group is associated with a consistency group.

targetObject.description: The SYMbol reference of the target object.

dailySchedule.description: The daily schedule times for all schedule methods.

daysOfWeek.description: The days of the week for the weekly schedule method.

monthsOfYear.description: The months of the year for the monthly by date schedule method.

daysOfMonth.description: The days of the month for the monthly by date schedule method.

startDate.description: The start date for the schedule.

endDate.description: The end date for the schedule, 0 for no end date.

ScheduleCreateRequest.description: Creates a Schedule for a Snapshot (PiT) or Legacy Snapshot.

baseMappableObjectId.description: The identifier of the volume or thin volume to use as the base for the new snapshot group.

name.description: The name of the new snapshot group.

repositoryPercentage.description: The size of the repository in relation to the size of the base volume.

warningThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold, as a percentage of the repository volume capacity.

autoDeleteLimit.description: The automatic deletion indicator. If non-zero, the oldest snapshot image will be automatically deleted when creating a new snapshot image to keep the total number of snapshot images limited to the number specified. This value is overridden by the consistency group setting if this snapshot group is associated with a consistency group.

fullPolicy.description: The behavior on when the data repository becomes full. This value is overridden by consistency group setting if this snapshot group is associated with a consistency group.

storagePoolId.description: The identifier  of the storage pool on which to allocate the repository volume. Ignored if a repositoryCandidate is provided.

repositoryCandidate.description: Allows a repository candidate to be manually specified for use in the creation. By default, the best candidate will be selected.

schedule.description: An optional schedule  to be used to automatically create snapshot images.

pitGroupBytesUsed.description: The total number of bytes used in the repository for all PiTs in the group.

pitGroupBytesAvailable.description: The total number of bytes available for ongoing copy-on-write operations.

groupRef.description: The PiT Group for which this utilization information applies.

pitUtilization.description: The repository utilization of each specific PiT in the PiT group.

pitRef.description: A reference to the specific PiT for which utilization is being reported.

bytesUsed.description: The total number of bytes in use in the repository for this specific PiTs metadata, copy-on-write indexes, and copy-on-write data.

groupId.description: The identifier of the snapshot group for the new snapshot image.

Sequence numbers are assigned to volume groups when they are created or imported into a storage array. The controller assigns the lowest unused sequence number during a creation or import operation.

offline.description: An indication of whether the volume group is currently offline. A volume group can be taken offline by the operator in preparation for removing its drives and transporting them to another storage array.

trayLossProtection.description: An indication as to whether the volume group has tray loss protection.

state.description: The state of the volume group.

spindleSpeedMatch.description: Set to true if all of the drives in the group have matching normalized spindle speeds. (Normalized spindle speeds are standardized norms (e.g., 5400, 7200, etc.) that are used for spindle speed matching, even though actual spindle speeds may be within a designated delta of the normalized speed.)

spindleSpeed.description: The spindle speed of the drives composing the pool (RPM)

isInaccessible.description: True if the volume group contains incompatible drives that have been locked out.

securityType.description: security status of the drive group

drawerLossProtection.description: This field is set to true when the volume group has drawer loss protection; otherwise it is set to false

protectionInformationCapable.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

protectionInformationCapabilities.description: This structure contains a protectionInformationCapable field which is set to true if all drives in the volume group are Protection Information (PI) capable. It also contains a field that is set to the protection type for the volume group.

driveBlockFormat.description: Identifies the drive block format of the volume candidate.

reservedSpaceAllocated.description: This field will be used to report whether or not reserved space has been claimed on all drives in the volume group. The recovery-volume script will include this field for each volume group record it creates, so that during volume recovery the volume group is recreated correctly.

securityLevel.description: Refines the information in the securityType field to describe the set of drives.

dulbeEnabled.description: An indication as to whether DULBE is enabled on the drives in the volume group.

blkSizeSupported.description: Lists the block size(s) supported for volumes created in this volume group.

blkSizeRecommended.description: The recommended block size for volumes created within this volume group.

raidStatus.description: The raid status reflects the worst case raid level of any volume on the group

drivePhysicalType.description: Defines the physical interface type of the underlying drives.

driveMediaType.description: Defines whether is an SSD or a spinning drive.

normalizedSpindleSpeed.description: The normalized spindle speed of the drives composing the pool. Ex: 7200, 5400, 15000. If drives have mismatched spindle speeds, this value may not be accurate.

diskPool.description: True if the RAID Level is defined as raidDiskPool.

physicalLocation.description: The physical location of the Ethernet interface. The parent reference in Location identifies the physical component (e.g., controller or host card) where the interface circuitry is located, and the position field is a firmware-assigned 1-relative number signifying "1st ethernet interface relative to the parent," "2nd ethernet interface relative to the parent," etc. This "interface number" is independent of the interface's channel association.

isNetworkTraceCapable.description: Can capture network traces if true.

enableRemoteAccess.description: If set to true, the controller is enabled for establishment of a remote access session. Depending on the controller platform, the method for remote access could be rlogin or telnet

flushStart.description: Specifies the level of fullness of dirty data in the controller's write cache which, when reached, will cause the controller to begin flushing data from cache to disk. This value is specified as a percentage, in the range 0-100, of the overall write cache capacity of the controller. After flushing begins, it will continue until enough data has been flushed to drop the percentage of dirty data to or below the value specified in the cacheFlushStop parameter.

flushStop.description: Specifies the amount of cache data that will be flushed to disk when a cache flush operation is initiated. This value is specified as an integer in the range 0-100 that represents the percentage of the controller's write cache data that can remain in the dirty, or unflushed, state. When demand flush operations are started, data will be flushed from cache to disk until the overall amount of dirty data drops to or below the percentage specified by this value.

Maximum amount of time in seconds that the access token may be active.

groupRef.description: The reference (key) for the mirror group.

worldWideName.description: The world wide name of the mirror group. This can be used to identify the AMG pair on both arrays. The AsyncMirrorGroupRef is not guaranteed to be unique across multiple arrays.

label.description: The user assigned name for the mirror group.

groupState.description: The Mirror Group State. This is determined primarily by the presence or lack of a recovery point.

localRole.description: The current role of this (local) array with respect to this mirror group.

remoteRole.description: The current role of the peer (remote) array with respect to this mirror group.

roleChangeProgress.description: This field indicates the current state of the role change process. This may be an extended condition due to the data sync needed for an orderly role change or the recovery point rollback needed for a no-sync or forced role change.

syncIntervalMinutes.description: The time in minutes between starting points of periodic synchronization intervals. A value of ARVM_MANUAL_SYNC_INTERVAL indicates synchronization intervals are manually started by the user.

syncCompletionTimeAlertThresholdMinutes.description: The threshold (in minutes) for notifying the user that periodic synchronization has taken too long to complete. A value of ARVM_SYNC_COMPLETION_TIME_THRESHOLD_NONE indicates no threshold is set.

recoveryPointAgeAlertThresholdMinutes.description: The recovery point age objective (in minutes). The user is notified via needs-attention when the age of the last good recovery point exceeds this value. A value of ARVM_RECOVERY_POINT_AGE_THRESHOLD_NONE indicates no threshold is set.

repositoryUtilizationWarnThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold (0-100 percent). A needs attention condition will be generated if the percent of the repository capacity currently utilized exceeds this threshold.

mirrorChannelRemoteTarget.description: The path to the remote array to be used by this AMG (a reference to the associated RemoteTarget).

orphanGroup.description: If true, the mirror group is an orphan.

connectionType.description: The connection type used to create this mirror group.

remoteTargetWwn.description: The WWN of the target array in the mirroring relationship. This field may not be immediately available after an AMG is created.

remoteTargetName.description: The user label of the target array in the mirroring relationship. This field may not be immediately available after an AMG is created, and will not be available in embedded mode.

remoteTargetId.description: The id of the target array in the mirroring relationship. This field may not be immediately available after an AMG is created, and will not be available in embedded mode.

remoteTarget.description: The connection information for the remote StorageSystem.

name.description: The user label to assign to the new asynchronous mirror group.

secondaryArrayId.description: The id of the secondary storage system.

manualSync.description: True to set the synchronization method to manual, otherwise false. Note, when the  synchronization method is set to manual, the other synchronization fields in the  request will be ignored.

recoveryWarnThresholdMinutes.description: The recovery warning threshold in minutes. Note, the user will be warned when  the age of the last good failures point exceeds this value.

repoUtilizationWarnThreshold.description: The repository utilization warning threshold percentage.

interfaceType.description: The intended protocol to use if both Fibre and iSCSI are available.

syncWarnThresholdMinutes.description: The threshold in minutes for notifying the user that periodic synchronization  has taken too long to complete.

AsyncMirrorGroupCreateRequest.description: The asynchronous mirror group create request. This is issued to the storage system  designated to the primary role.

connections.description: The list of connections to the remote storage system.

AsyncMirrorGroupConnectionsResponse.description: The asynchronous mirror group connections response.

localPortName.description: The local port name. This is the unique wwn of the local port and is only valid if the interface type is fc.

remotePortName.description: The remote port name. This is the unique wwn of the remote port and is only valid if the interface type is fc.

remotePortId.description: The remote port id. This is the switch port identifier for the remote port and is only  valid if the interface type is fc.

localPortId.description: The local port id. This is the switch port identifier for the local port and is only  valid if the interface type is fc.

controller.description: The local controller acting as the initiator for the connection.

ioInterfaceType.description: The remote target connections IO interface type.

localPortRef.description: The local port reference. This is the local initiator port for these connections.

remoteTargetConnections.description: The details of the connections to the remote target.

ioInterfaceType.description: This enumeration defines the different I/O interface types that may be reported as part of the configuration information associated with a controller.

iscsiConnectionDetail.description: This field is returned if the value of ioInterfaceType is equal to IO_IF_ISCSI.

fibreConnectionDetail.description: This field is returned if the value of ioInterfaceType is equal to IO_IF_FC.

pitDataBytes.description: The total number of bytes used in the repository for copy-on-write data and related metadata.

deltaLogBytes.description: The total number of bytes used for the delta logs (bitmaps).

bytesAvailable.description: The total number of bytes available for ongoing copy-on-write operations.

mirrorRef.description: The mirror group member for which this utilization information applies.

percentComplete.description: The completion percentage for the operation. If the operation is not currently running this value will be equal to PERCENT_COMPLETE_OP_NOT_RUNNING.

timeToCompletion.description: The estimated time to completion in minutes. If the time is not known this value will be equal to TIME_TO_COMPLETION_UNKNOWN.

syncBytes.description: The amount of data that remains to be synchronized in the current synchronization step.

mirrorRef.description: A reference to the async mirror member.

trackingBytes.description: Amount of data (in bytes) marked as unsynchronized in the tracking delta log for this member.

groupPercentComplete.description: Completion percentage for the operation across the entire group. If synchronization is not currently running this value will be equal to PERCENT_COMPLETE_OP_NOT_RUNNING.

groupTimeToCompletion.description: Estimated time to completion in minutes for all members in the group that are undergoing synchronization. If the time is not known this value will be equal to TIME_TO_COMPLETION_UNKNOWN.

groupRef.description: Reference to the async mirror group.

memberProgress.description: List of progress information for each mirror group member.

groupTrackingBytes.description: The amount of data (in bytes) marked as unsynchronized in the tracking delta logs for the entire group.

deleteRecoveryPointIfNecessary.description: True to delete the failures point on the secondary if necessary, otherwise false.

batchId.description: The batch ID for this batch.

apiUrl.description: The set of URLs that the batch was initiated against. Note that for batches with more than one job, there may be multiple URLs.

state.description: The current state of the batch.

httpStatusCode.description: The numeric HTTP result code returned for this job step.

httpStatusPhrase.description: A short phrase describing the HTTP status code.

httpReturnBody.description: The JSON body returned from this job step. This data must be decoded by the client as it will be specific for the type of call made.

jobName.description: The name of this job. This value will be the batch name plus the job ID.

jobId.description: The numeric ID for this individual job.

jobComplete.description: If true then this job has completed.

percentComplete.description: The percent complete for this step (may be estimated).

systemId.description: The System Id that this job executed against.

systemName.description: The name of the system that this job executed against.

executionUrl.description: The URL that this command executed against.  For dual controller systems this provides the path to the controller that executed the command.

executionMillis.description: The number of milliseconds that this job took to execute.

retriesAttempted.description: The number of retries that were attempted for this job.

stepResult.description: The detailed return data for this step.

batchId.description: The ID for this batch request.

startTime.description: The time that this batch was initiated.

batchComplete.description: If true the entire batch is complete.

percentComplete.description: The percent complete for the entire batch (estimated).

batchState.description: Describes the process state for this batch request.

numberJobs.description: The number of job status results contained within the batch response.

numberSystemIds.description: The number of system Ids the batch was executed against.

numberJobSteps.description: The number of individual job steps executed within this batch.

startTime.description: The time that this step started.

systemId.description: The Id of the system that had the failure.

systemName.description: The name of the system that had the failure.

sequenceNum.description: The sequence number of the operation that was performed on the system.

stepDuration.description: The duration that the step took in milliseconds.

objectName.description: The name of the object that was operated on.

statusDesc.description: A text description of the result status of the operation.

statusCode.description: The status code of the operation.

statusCodeSource.description: The status code source type enumeration.

jobId.description: The ID for this system replication job.

sourceSystemId.description: The ID of the source system.

targetSystemIds.description: The IDs of the target systems.

state.description: The current or final state of the job.

processFailureReason.description: A text reason that the overall process failed. Only set if the replication process failed, not if an individual array did not complete successfully.

percentComplete.description: The overall percent complete for this job.

systemFailureCount.description: The number of systems that incurred failures during processing.

startTime.description: The start time for this job.

elapsedTime.description: Total runtime for the job in seconds. If the job is still in progress, depicts time thus far.

sourceDocument.description: The source input document describing the system that was replicated.

configTypes.description: List of the types of configuration elements applied to the target systems.

failureEntries.description: A list of system failure records. Note, these values are only supplied if detailed results are requested.

httpVerb.description: Designates the type of HTTP request to be made (GET, POST, etc.).

apiURL.description: The URL for the operation that is to be called. For paths behind "storage-systems" that have a system ID, use a place holder for the ID {id}. This value will be substituted before making the call. Any other query parameters or path values should be specified directly in the URL.

systemIds.description: A list of storage system ID's (or WWN's) that the operation is performed against.

numberRetries.description: The number of times a given job will be retried if a timeout or failure occurs.

timeoutSeconds.description: The number of seconds to wait on an API call against a target system before timing out.

requestBodyDocument.description: The JSON payload body for this request (POST, PUT). Blank if there is no body.

batchName.description: The name of the batch to be started

batchGroupId.description: The optional group ID which can be used to group multiple batch operations together, if not specified a group id will be generated.

sourceSystemId.description: The ID of the source system.

targetSystemIds.description: The IDs of the target systems.

configurationElements.description: A list of input document elements to apply to the target systems.

filename.description: Optionally used to specify the filename

revocationChecking.description: Set to true to enable certificate revocation checking; by default this is not enabled.

strictCertVerificationEnabled.description: Set to true to enable strict certificate verification checking; by default this is not enabled.

arrayWWN.description: The storage system world wide name

alias.description: The alias for the certificate.  This value will only be present if the certificate is in the proxy server truststore.

subjectDN.description: The subject distinguished name for the certificate

status.description: The certificate status

isKeyEntry.description: Returns true if the entry identified by the given alias was created by a call to setKeyEntry, or created by a call to setEntry with a PrivateKeyEntry or a SecretKeyEntry.

type.description: Indicates if the certificate is self-signed, CA-signed or a root or intermediate certificate.  Root or intermediate certificates that were created without the basic constraints extension may show a value of 'selfSigned' instead of 'certificateAuthority'

dn.description: The distinguished name for the certificate.  This is used by the LDAP API to reference the LDAP object.  An example value would be "uid=john.doe,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com". If this value is provided then any values provided for the rdns will be ignored.

rdns.description: List of relative distinguished names that can be combined to create the distinguished name (dn).  These values will be ignored if a domain name (dn) is provided.

subjectAlternateNames.description: If provided, this will attach a Subject Alternate Name extension to the certificate to allow the user to bind additional properties (email address, DNS name, etc) to the subject of the certificate.

emailServerEncryption.description: The encryption to be used to communicate with the server. May be "none" (unencrypted), "smtps" (SSL/TLS encrypted connection),  or "starttls" (connection upgraded to SSL/TLS encryption). Defaults to "none" if no encryption type has been set previously.

emailServerPort.description: The port to be used to connect to the server. A value of 0 may be specified to use the default port based on the encryption type set. Default is encryption dependent: "none" defaults to 25, "smtps" defaults to 465, and "starttls" defaults to 587

maxSizeLimitHttps.description: The configured maximum HTTPS dispatch size in bytes. If the maximum size is not configured, the default is 50 MiB. A value of 0 allows for no size restriction. Otherwise, the minimum size allowed is 2 MiB.

maxSizeLimitSmtp.description: The configured maximum SMTP dispatch size in bytes. If the maximum size is not configured, the default is 5 MiB. A value of 0 allows for no size restriction.  Otherwise, the minimum size allowed is 2 MiB.

confirmLUNMappingCreation.description: This field has been deprecated and should not be used.

maxTraceSizeMB.description: Maximum (uncompressed) trace size in MB (million bytes, not MiB).

maxTraceDurationSeconds.description: Maximum duration of trace in seconds.

packetLengthBytes.description: Number of bytes to capture for each packet (the remainder of the packet is discarded). This is a mechanism for reducing the amount of customer data in the trace file.

interfaces.description: Interfaces on which to start a trace. Must be interfaces on the controller receiving the descriptor for which isNetworkTraceCapable is true. Multiple interfaces can be selected only if they have an IP address associated because the IP is used to filter the trace (which means broadcasts such as ARPs/DHCP/... will be excluded). To debug lower level protocols and capture all packets, select only a single interface.

remoteStorageId.description: The remote storage configuration associated with this remote volume import operation.

sourceVolumeId.description: The remote storage volume being used as a source for the remote volume import operation.

targetVolumeId.description: The local volume being used as a target/destination for the remote volume import operation.

copyRef.description: The volumeCopy associated with the remote volume import operation. Not required for most users, but available if needed to reference the associated VolumeCopy object.

transferRate.description: The estimated rate of data transfer in bytes/s.

estimatedCompletionTime.description: The approximate date and time the data transfer is expected to complete based on the observed rate of the import in RFC3339 format. Value will be null if it is unavailable.

estimatedRemainingTimeInSeconds.description: The estimated remaining time for the data transfer to complete in seconds. Value will be -1 if it is unavailable. This is based on the rate of the data transfer observed so far.

startTime.description: The date and time that the remote volume import operation started in RFC3339 format. Value will be null if it is unavailable.

priority.description: The priority of the remote volume import operation relative to other copies/imports and other I/O operations running on the system.

status.description: The current status of the remote volume import operation.

RemoteVolumeImport.description: Denotes details of the remote volume import operation request status and parameters.

priority.description: The priority of the remote volume import operation relative to other copies/imports and other I/O operations running on the system.

operation.description: The action to perform on the remote volume import operation.

RemoteVolumeImportControlRequest.description: Modify an existing remote volume import operation.

connectionStatus.description: The connection status between the local controller and the associated remote storage system. A status of "online" indicates that the connection is valid and fully operational. A status of "failedToConnect" indicates that a connection could not be established to the remote storage system. A status of "lossOfConnection" indicates that the connection to the remote storage system was lost. A status of "unknown" indicates that the process for getting the status has not yet completed.

connectionType.description: The connection type for the remote storage configuration.

iscsi.description: iSCSI connection information for the remote storage configuration. Only applicable if the connectionType is iscsi.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the network interface on the remote storage system.

port.description: The port on which the remote storage system listens for incoming connections.
