iscsiInterfaces.description: Network interface properties for the remote storage system.

RemoteStorageIscsiResponse.description: The iSCSI configuration for the remote storage configuration.

id.description: The unique identifier for the remote storage configuration.

name.description: The user label for the remote storage configuration.

status.description: The overall status of the remote storage connection. A status of "optimal" indicates that the remote storage configuration is valid and fully operational. A status of "nonOptimal" indicates that there are connection issues with one or both of the local controllers. A status of "unknown" indicates that the process for getting the status has not yet completed.

controllerInfo.description: The list of local controllers and their associated details.

genericTarget.description: Configuration details for the remote storage configuration.

iscsi.description: iSCSI connection information for the remote storage configuration.

RemoteStorageGenericTargetUpdateParamete.description: Updated configuration details for the remote storage configuration.

iscsiInterfaces.description: The list of network interfaces on the remote storage system.

RemoteStorageIscsiUpdateProperties.description: The updated iSCSI configuration for the remote storage configuration.

genericTarget.description: Configuration details for the remote storage configuration.

id.description: The id for the remote storage volume.

name.description: The user label for the remote storage volume.

volumeHandle.description: The SSID of the remote storage volume. This is the numerical value that uniquely identifies the remote storage volume on this storage system.

lunNumber.description: The logical unit number (LUN) associated with the remote storage volume.

worldWideName.description: The world wide unique identification value of the remote storage volume.

remoteVolumeWorldWideName.description: The world wide unique identifier of the volume on the remote storage system that is associated with the remote storage volume.

currentControllerId.description: The reference value of the controller that currently owns this remote storage volume.

preferredControllerId.description: The reference value of the controller that is the preferred owner of the remote storage volume.

blkSize.description: The block size (in bytes) of the remote storage volume.

capacity.description: The capacity (in bytes) of the remote storage volume.

status.description: The status of the remote storage volume. Unknown indicates the remote storage volume is being initialized or not ready.

offlineReason.description: Indicates why the remote storage volume is reporting a status of "offline". A status of "none" indicates that the remote storage volume is not currently "offline". A status of "failedToConnect" indicates that a connection could not be established to the remote volume. A status of "lossOfConnection" indicates that the connection to the remote volume was lost. A status of "inquiryDataMismatch" indicates that the current inquiry data for the remote volume does not match the original inquiry data. A status of "invalidBlockSize" indicates that the current block size of the remote volume does not match the original block size. A status of "invalidCapacity" indicates that the current capacity of the remote volume does not match the original capacity.

remoteStorageId.description: The identifier of the remote storage configuration associated with the remote storage volume.

protectionType.description: The PI protection type of the remote storage volume.

cache.description: The volume-specific caching parameters currently in effect for the remote storage volume.

perms.description: The operations allowed on the remote storage volume.

owningControllerId.description: The id for the preferred owning controller.

connectionType.description: The connection type for the remote storage configuration.

iscsi.description: iSCSI connection information for the remote storage configuration. Only applicable if the connectionType is iscsi.

RemoteStorageGenericTargetParameters.description: Configuration details for the remote storage configuration.

iscsiInterfaces.description: The list of network interfaces on the remote storage system.

RemoteStorageIscsiProperties.description: The iSCSI configuration for the remote storage configuration.

name.description: The user label to assign to the remote storage configuration.

genericTarget.description: Configuration details for the remote storage configuration.

name.description: The user label to assign to the remote storage volume.

remoteStorageId.description: The identifier of the remote storage configuration to be associated with the remote storage volume.

owningControllerId.description: The id for the preferred owning controller. By default this field will alternate between available controllers.

lunNumber.description: The logical unit number (LUN) of the volume on the remote storage system.

sourceVolumeId.description: A reference to an existing remote storage volume to be used as the source of the remote volume import operation.

targetVolumeId.description: A reference to an existing local volume to be used as the target/destination of the remote volume import operation.

priority.description: The priority of the remote volume import operation relative to other copies/imports and other I/O operations running on the system. If not specified, the value will default to medium.

RemoteVolumeImportRequest.description: Define a new volume import operation. Upon the completion of this operation, the contents of the volume on the remote storage system referenced by the remote storage volume object will be copied to the target volume. While this operation is in progress, all data on the source volume will be accessible (read/write capable) via the target volume. It is imperative that the source volume not be mounted or utilized while this import operation is in progress, as data/file-system corruption may occur.

interfaceRef.description: The interface reference.

channelPortRefs.description: The list of channel port references.

oneWayMaxRate.description: The maximum one way data transfer rate in bytes/s.

bidirectionalMaxRate.description: The maximum bi-directional data transfer rate in bytes/s.

currentInterfaceSpeed.description: The current speed of the interface.

maximumInterfaceSpeed.description: The maximum speed of the interface.

linkStatus.description: The link status of the interface.

header.description: HTTP response header. Only a subset of HTTP response headers are supported.

value.description: Value of the HTTP response header. A null or empty string will cause this header to be omitted from the HTTP response.

baseUrlPath.description: Base URL path in which to include this HTTP response header. A "/", null or empty string will cause this header to be added to every response.

HttpResponseHeader.description: Customized HTTP response headers. HTTP response headers can be customized on specific base URL paths and will override the default HTTP response header if it is already present.

IpRange.description: Range of IP addresses. startIP and endIP must be of the same IP version (IPv4 or IPv6)

maxRequestsPerSec.description: Rate limit maximum requests per seconds to allow. The value must be between 50 and 200, inclusive.

ipExcludeList.description: List of IP addresses to be excluded from rate limits.

httpResponseHeaders.description: Customized HTTP response headers. HTTP response headers can be customized on specific base URL paths and will override the default HTTP response header if it is already present.

relativeRedirectAllowed.description: Allow relative redirect for responses with HTTP status 302. True to allow only the path for the LOCATION response header, false to require the LOCATION header to be the full URL.

allowedManagementClients.description: List of allowed management client addresses. Used to restrict HTTPS and SYMbol clients to the ranges provided. An empty list means allow all addresses. WARNING: Incorrectly changing this setting may cause loss of HTTPS and SYMbol access that may only be corrected through the serial port or remote shell (disabled by default.)

Settings.description: Settings that apply to the entire Web Services instance.

TlsParamsResponse.description: TLS parameters that are currently available for inbound and outbound connections.

id.description: The reference ID for the community

name.description: The name of the community

permissions.description: The permission types for this SNMP Community

trapDestinations.description: The trap destinations configured for this community

sysName.description: The sysname of the storage system

sysLocation.description: The syslocation of the storage system

sysContact.description: The syscontact of the storage system

communities.description: The list of communities on the storage system

usmUsers.description: The list of USM users on the storage system

id.description: The reference ID for the trap destination

receiverAddress.description: IPV4 or IPV6 address for this trap destination

sendAuthenticationFailureTraps.description: If authentication failure traps should be sent to this destination

id.description: The reference ID for the USM user

name.description: The name of the USM user

permissions.description: The permission types for this SNMP USM user

engineIdType.description: The authoritative engine ID type of the USM user. May be "local" to use the local engine ID or "custom" to specify a remote engine ID to be used.

engineId.description: The authoritative engine ID of the USM user for the custom engine id type.

authProtocol.description: The SNMP authentication protocol for this SNMP USM user.

authPassword.description: The password for the authentication protocol for the this SNMP USM user.

privProtocol.description: The SNMP privacy protocol for this SNMP USM user.

privPassword.description: The password for the privacy protocol for the this SNMP USM user.

trapDestinations.description: The trap destinations configured for this USM user.

receiverAddress.description: IPV4 or IPV6 address for a configured trap destination

name.description: The name of the community

permissions.description: The permission types for this SNMP Community

trapDestinations.description: The trap destinations to configure on this community

sysName.description: The sysname of the storage system

sysLocation.description: The syslocation of the storage system

sysContact.description: The syscontact of the storage system

communities.description: The list of communities on the storage system

usmUsers.description: The list of USM users on the storage system

receiverAddress.description: IPV4 or IPV6 address for this trap destination

sendAuthenticationFailureTraps.description: If authentication failure traps should be sent to this destination

name.description: The name of the USM user.

permissions.description: The permission types for this SNMP USM user.

engineIdType.description: The authoritative engine ID type of the USM user. May be "local" to use the local engine ID or "custom" to specify a remote engine ID to be used. Defaults to "local".

engineId.description: The authoritative engine ID of the USM user for the custom engine id type.

authProtocol.description: The SNMP authentication protocol for this SNMP USM user. Defaults to "none".

authPassword.description: The SNMP authentication password for this SNMP USM user. The password must be specified when creating a new user with authentication enabled and for existing users if the authentication protocol is changed. If not specified (null or an empty string) for existing users, the password will not be changed. When specified, the password must be 8 to 128 characters in length.

privProtocol.description: The SNMP privacy protocol for this SNMP USM user. Defaults to "none".

privPassword.description: The SNMP privacy password for this SNMP USM user. The password must be specified when creating a new user with privacy enabled and for existing users if the privacy protocol is changed. If not specified (null or an empty string) for existing users, the password will not be changed. When specified, the password must be 8 to 128 characters in length.

trapDestinations.description: The trap destinations to configure on this USM user.

enableSshMfa.description: Settings for enabling SSH and SSH MFA.

authorizedKeys.description: Authorized SSH keys for the storage device.

mfaEnabled.description: Enable SSH MFA for this controller

enableSshMfa.description: Settings for enabling SSH and SSH MFA.

authorizedKeys.description: Authorized SSH keys for the storage device.

minRepositoryCapacityInBytes.description: The minimum repository size (in bytes) for a mirror repository.

maxRepositoryCapacityAsPercentOfMirrored.description: The maximum repository capacity as a percentage of the mirror capacity.

defaultRepositoryCapacityAsPercentOfMirr.description: The default repository capacity as a percentage of the mirror capacity.

defaultRepositoryUtilizationWarnThreshol.description: The default repository utilization warning threshold percentage.

minSyncIntervalInMinutes.description: The minimum sync interval in minutes.

defaultSyncIntervalInMinutes.description: The default sync interval in minutes.

defaultSyncCompletionTimeAlertThresholdI.description: The default sync completion time alert threshold in minutes.

defaultRecoveryPointAgeAlertThresholdInM.description: The default recovery point age alert threshold in minutes.

maxConnectivityTestTimeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum timeout (in seconds) allowed for async mirror group connectivity test.

maxLinkLatencyTestIterations.description: The maximum number of test iterations allowed for a link latency test.

maxLinkBandwidthTestIterations.description: The maximum number of test iterations allowed for a bandwidth test.

minRepositoryCapacityInHundredthsOfPerce.description: The minimum repository size as 1/100ths of a percent of mirror capacity.

defaultLinkLatencyTestIterations.description: The default number of test iterations for a link latency test.

defaultLinkBandwidthTestIterations.description: The default number of test iterations for a bandwidth test.

defaultRecentStatisticsListLength.description: The recommended default sample list length limit for recent statistics request.

maxRecentStatisticsListLength.description: The maximum sample list length allowed for a recent statistics request.

defaultLongestStatisticsListLength.description: The recommended default sample list length limit for a longest statistics request.

maxLongestStatisticsListLength.description: The maximum sample list length allowed for a longest statistics request.

defaultErrorStatisticsListLength.description: The recommended default sample list length limit for an error statistics request.

maxErrorStatisticsListLength.description: The maximum sample list length allowed for an error statistics request.

maxAllowedLinkLatencyInMicroseconds.description: Indicates the maximum allowed link latency between two remote volume mirror storage systems.

ArvmDefaultsResponse.description: The asynchronous remove volume mirror defaults.

concatVolumeMemberCapacityAlignmentSizeI.description: The capacity of a concat volume member that will be utilized by the associated concat volume  will be the nearest multiple of this value that is less than or equal to the total  concat volume member capacity.

lowHighSamplingSupported.description: True if controller firmware supports the low and high resolution sampling, otherwise false.

lowResolutionPeriodInSeconds.description: The duration (in seconds) for low resolution statistics samples to be saved.

highResolutionPeriodInSeconds.description: The duration (in seconds) for high resolution statistics samples to be saved.

poolUtilizationWarnThreshold.description: The pool utilization warning threshold as a percentage of the total user configurable capacity. A  MEL event is generated when the configured capacity exceeds the specified level of the configurable  capacity.

poolUtilizationCriticalThreshold.description: The pool utilization critical threshold as a percentage of the total user configurable capacity. A  MEL event is generated when the configured capacity exceeds the specified level of the configurable  capacity.

degradedReconstructPriority.description: One failed drive degraded reconstruction priority.

criticalReconstructPriority.description: Two failed drive reconstruction critical priority.

backgroundOperationPriority.description: The priority of other background operations (DVE, DCE, DCR, and IAF).

maxVolumeSizeInMb.description: The maximum volume size (in megabytes) for disk pools.

maxDceDriveCount.description: The maximum number of drives that can be used for Dynamic Capacity Expansion (DCE).

maxTotalDiskPoolSupportInMb.description: The maximum total size for all disk pools.

maxVolumeSynchronousCreationInMb.description: Volumes with a capacity with this size or smaller are created synchronously. Larger volumes are  completed as a background operation.

maxDcrDriveCount.description: The maximum number of drives that can be removed in a Disk Capacity Reduction (DCR) operation.

minimumDriveCount.description: The minimum number of drives required for defining a disk pool with HDD drives. This also defines the minimum number of drives required to create RAID 6 volumes regardless of media type.

minimumSsdDriveCount.description: The minimum SSD drive count required for defining a disk pool.

maxCommunities.description: The maximum number of communities that can be added when adding an SNMP community.

maxTrapDestinations.description: The maximum number of trap destinations that can be added when adding an SNMP trap destination.

maxCommunityNameStringLength.description: The maximum length of a community name.

maxSystemVariableStringLength.description: The maximum length of the user-settable system variables.

defaultSystemVariableValue.description: The default value for system variables that are settable.

maxUsmUsers.description: The maximum number of USM users that can be added when adding a USM user.

isLockdown.description: True if the storage system is in lockdown mode, otherwise false.

sevenSegmentCodes.description: The codes associated with the lockdown that would be shown on the seven segment display. This will  only be populated when using the embedded API on the controller. This may be null.

hasDrives.description: Deprecated since 07.00 - use limitedAccessState. True if the system has drives available to  create the primary database, otherwise false.

limitedAccessState.description: The limited access state. If the storage system has accessible drives, a value of none will be set.  If the storage system does not have any accessible drives and a drives key server error is detected,  a value of drivesSecurityKeyError will be set. If there are no accessible drives and no key server  error is detected, then a value of drivesUnavailable will be set. If there are any errors retrieving  data from the storage system to determine the appropriate value of this field, then a value of  unknown will be set.

lockdownClearable.description: True if the storage system is in lockdown mode and the lockdown is clearable, otherwise false. This  will only be populated when using the embedded API on the controller.

LockdownStatusResponse.description: The lockdown status response for the storage system.

maxTransferCount.description: The maximum number of MEL events to be transmitted at a time.

maxRecordCount.description: The maximum number of MEL events that can be logged.

maxViewsPerPit.description: The maximum number of views per PIT.

minRepositoryCapacityInBytes.description: The minimum repository size (in bytes) for the PIT group or PIT view repository. Note that  this is the absolute floor on the repository capacity, but a slightly higher minimum may  be imposed based on the capacity of the base volume. This is necessary to ensure rollback  operations have sufficient repository capacity for metadata.

maxPitGroupRepositoryCapacityAsPercentOf.description: The maximum repository size for a PIT group as a percentage of the base volume capacity.

maxPitViewRepositoryCapacityAsPercentOfB.description: The maximum repository size for a PIT view as a percentage of the base volume capacity.

defaultRepositoryCapacityAsPercentOfBase.description: The default repository capacity for a PIT group or PIT view as a percentage of the base volume capacity.

defaultRepositoryUtilizationWarnThreshol.description: The default repository utilization warning threshold percentage.

minConcatVolumeCapacityExpansion.description: The minimum capacity (in bytes) of a volume to be added to a concat volume for expansion.

maxRemoteTargetGroups.description: The maximum number of remote target groups that can exist within the storage system at one time.

maxRemoteTargetVolumes.description: The maximum number of remote target volumes that can exist within the storage system at one time.

maxVolumeCopies.description: The maximum number of remote target volume copies that can be established at one time.

enableResourceProvisionedVolumes.description: True if volume resource provisioning is enabled when an SSD volume is created  that supports this capability. If set to false, resource provisioning will be disabled when a volume is created. Note that for NVMe drives, this capability is supported if and only if all drives in the volume group or storage pool support the DULBE feature.

enabled.description: True if the access volume feature (and thus the UTM command transfer capability) is enabled, or false if it is disabled.

volumeHandle.description: An identifier value for the AccessVolume object. This will generally correspond to the logical unit number (LUN) that is used to access the volume for UTM protocol command transactions.

capacity.description: The (simulated) capacity of the AccessVolume maintained by the controller. Since there is essentially no true data storage capacity present for an AccessVolume, this value is used to determine the block addressing limit of the unit, which is an important aspect of the UTM command transfer protocol.

accessVolumeRef.description: The identifier value for this AccessVolume. Other objects may use this reference value to refer to the AccessVolume.

id.description: An identifier for the storage system used by the web service.

name.description: The user-assigned label of the storage system.

wwn.description: The world-wide name of the storage system. This acts as a unique identifier.

passwordStatus.description: The status for the stored password. Indicates the stored password's validity and if the array is in security lockout mode.

passwordSet.description: True if a stored password has been set and it is not an empty string.

status.description: The status for the storage system.

certificateStatus.description: The consolidated certificate status of all management paths.

ip1.description: The IP address for a management port on the slot A controller. If insufficient information is available to make this determination, then this field will contain a path from managementPaths.

ip2.description: The IP address for a management port on the slot B controller. If insufficient information is available to make this determination, then this field will contain a path from managementPaths.

managementPaths.description: A list of known paths that can be used to manage the system. These can be in the form of a hostname or an IP address.

controllers.description: The controllers for the storage system.

driveCount.description: The number of drives in the storage system.

trayCount.description: The number of drive trays in the storage system.

traceEnabled.description: True if trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system is enabled.

types.description: The types of drive trays in the storage system.

metaTags.description: The meta tags associated with the storage system.

hotSpareSize.description: The size of the hot spare drives.

usedPoolSpace.description: The total capacity of all storage pools that have been provisioned into volumes.

freePoolSpace.description: The unused capacity of all storage pools.

unconfiguredSpace.description: The total capacity of drives not configured into storage pools.

driveTypes.description: The drive types present in the storage system.

hostSpareCountInStandby.description: The number of hot spare drives that are not in use.

hotSpareCount.description: The total number of hot spare drives in the storage system.

hostSparesUsed.description: The number of hot spare drives that are in use.

resourceProvisionedVolumesEnabled.description: True if resource provisioning is enabled by default when an SSD volume that supports this capability is created, false otherwise.

appVersion.description: The version identifier of the "application" component of the currently-installed array firmware.

bootVersion.description: The version identifier of the "boot" component of the currently-installed array firmware.

accessVolume.description: The UTM (Universal Transport Mechanism) access volume. Used to convey configuration commands to the controllers.

unconfiguredSpaceByDriveType.description: The total capacity of drives not configured into storage pools for each drive type.

mediaScanPeriod.description: Selected media scan period, in days, 0 if media scan is suspended.

driveChannelPortDisabled.description: True if one or more drive channel ports have been disabled by the controllers to protect against faulty expansion cabling.

recoveryModeEnabled.description: True if recovery mode is enabled on the storage system.

autoLoadBalancingEnabled.description: True if auto load balance is enabled on the storage system.

hostConnectivityReportingEnabled.description: True if host connectivity reporting is enabled on the storage system.

remoteMirroringEnabled.description: True if remote mirroring is enabled on the storage system.

fcRemoteMirroringState.description: The remote mirroring state on the storage system.

asupEnabled.description: True if ASUP is enabled on the storage system.

securityKeyEnabled.description: True if a drive security key has been set/created.

externalKeyEnabled.description: True if an External security key has been created.

lastContacted.description: The last time that the device was considered accessible.

definedPartitionCount.description: The number of partitions calculated from the user's current mappings.

simplexModeEnabled.description: True if the redundancy mode of the system is simplex.

supportedManagementPorts.description: The management port types that are supported on the storage system. A type listed could be disabled even though it is supported.

invalidSystemConfig.description: True if the system has an invalid configuration preventing full functionality.

StorageSystemResponse.description: A Storage System is a collection of both physical components and logical components. Physical components include disk drives, controllers, fans, and other hardware. The physical disk drives are grouped into Storage Pools. The storage capacity of these Storage Pools is provisioned into logical Volumes. Some properties may be null if the array is offline.

isLun0RestrictedForDefaultPartition.description: True to indicate that one or more host bus adapter (HBA) host ports in the default host  group is using an I/O protocol that does not allow volumes to be mapped to LUN 0,  otherwise false.

capabilities.description: The list of storage system capabilities.

productCapabilities.description: The list of storage system product capabilities.

featureStates.description: The list of storage system feature states.

maxProvisionedCapacityInBytes.description: The maximum provisioned capacity in bytes.

minVirtualCapacityInBytes.description: The minimum virtual capacity in bytes.

maxVirtualCapacityInBytes.description: The maximum virtual capacity in bytes.

minAlertThreshold.description: The minimum alert threshold as a percentage.

defaultAlertThreshold.description: The default alert threshold as a percentage.

enableResourceProvisionedVolumes.description: Optional. True if volume resource provisioning is enabled when an SSD volume is created that  supports this capability. If set to false, resource provisioning will be disabled when a volume  is created. Note that for NVMe drives, this capability is supported if and only if all drives in  the volume group or storage pool support the DULBE feature. If the field is not set in the request, then no change to this setting will occur.

name.description: The user-assigned label of the storage system.

wwn.description: The world-wide name of the storage system. This acts as a unique identifier.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the chassis.

StorageSystemIdentificationResponse.description: The basic storage system information accessible to unauthenticated users. This is intended to provide the base amount of information necessary for proper identification before authentication.

alreadyExists.description: True if the storage system already exists, otherwise false.

id.description: The id to assign to the storage system. The id must be unique and if left null, a unique id will automatically be generated and assigned.

controllerAddresses.description: The list of controller ip addresses or hostnames.

acceptCertificate.description: True if any self-signed certificates on the storage system will be automatically accepted, otherwise false.

validate.description: True to enable validation of the added storage system, otherwise false.

password.description: The admin's password or the storage system admin password.

wwn.description: The world wide name of the storage system. Note, that this is only needed  for in-band management with an in-band agent that is managing more than a  single storage system. If provided, all alphabetical characters that are part of the wwn must be in uppercase.

enableTrace.description: True to enable trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system, otherwise false.

metaTags.description: Optional meta tags to associate to the storage system.

acceptCertificate.description: True to allow the storage system to automatically accept any self-signed certificates, otherwise false.

storedPassword.description: The new stored password. This only updates the stored password on the proxy. To  update the password on the storage system, use the passwords endpoint.

metaTags.description: Optional meta tags to associate to the storage system. This must be a complete  list. If the list of meta tags is not set or is empty no change will occur. If  you want to remove all tags, set the removeAllTags field in this request to true.  If all tags are set to be removed, that will be done first before this new  list is processed.

removeAllTags.description: True to remove all tags associated to the storage system, otherwise false.

enableTrace.description: True to enable trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system, otherwise false.

controllerAddresses.description: The list of controller ip addresses or hostnames.

isValidPassword.description: True if the provided password matches the stored password of the storage system, otherwise false.

StoredPasswordValidationResponse.description: Validation response for the stored password of the storage system.

password.description: The password to validate against the stored password of the storage system.

StoredPasswordValidationRequest.description: Validation request for the stored password of the storage system.

serialNumber.description: The tray's serial number.
The tray's new serial serial number.

poolId.description: The identifier of the storage pool from which the volume will be allocated.

name.description: The user label to assign to the new volume.

size.description: The size of the new volume. See 'sizeUnit' field.

segSize.description: The desired segment size for the new volume in KiB. The supported segment sizes can be found by querying the storage systems capabilities endpoint and inspecting the feature parameter's supported segment sizes (the field is FeatureParameters.supportedSegSizes). A zero value will set a system-specific default value.

owningControllerId.description: Sets the preferred owning controller. By default this field will alternate between available controllers.

metaTags.description: Optional array of meta data tags for the volume.

blockSize.description: Optional. The block size (in bytes) of the volume as seen by the initiator. The block size must be set to a supported value. If the block size is not set or is set to a value of 0, the controller will select the appropriate block size.

jobId.description: The data parity repair volume job id.

DataParityRepairVolumeAsyncResponse.description: The data parity repair volume response. Use the 'volumes/data-parity-repair-volume/jobs endpoint' to retrieve volume parity job status.

startingLba.description: Optional. The starting volume LBA for the repair operation.

endingLba.description: Optional. The ending volume LBA for the repair operation.

repairByReconstruct.description: Optional. True to fix by reconstructing.

repairByUnmapping.description: Optional. True to fix using unmap. Note that this is only applicable when if there are more unmapped than mapped segments in a stripe.

repairByUpdatingPParity.description: Optional. True to fix by updating P parity.

repairByUpdatingQParity.description: Optional. True to fix by updating Q parity.

repairByUpdatingData.description: Optional. True to fix by updating the data drive.

repairByWritingZeros.description: Optional. True to fix by writing zeros and updating parity.

repairPi.description: Optional. True to correct issues with PI.

suspectDrives.description: Optional. The list of drives' unique identifiers to be reconstructed.

DataParityRepairVolumeRequest.description: The data parity repair volume request. The starting and ending LBA fields are optional. If these fields are not present in the request, the default will be to perform the operation on the entire volume.

backgroundOperation.description: True if deletion is done in the background, otherwise false.

jobId.description: The data parity repair volume job id.

DataParityRepairVolumeJobResponse.description: The data parity repair volume response.

percentComplete.description: The completion percentage of a long-running operation on a volume.

timeToCompletion.description: The estimated elapsed time to completion in minutes. Note that this field is always set to -1 for basic RAID volumes.

expansionSize.description: The expansion size. Note that the specified expansion size must be greater than the current capacity. Refer to the 'sizeUnit' field.

readCacheEnable.description: Indicates whether read caching should be enabled for the volume.

writeCacheEnable.description: Indicates whether write-back caching should be enabled for the volume.

readAheadEnable.description: Indicates whether or not automatic cache read-ahead is enabled

cacheFlushModifier.description: The cache flush modifier value, which is used to specify the maximum amount of time that dirty data for this volume may be retained in the controller's write cache prior to being flushed to disk.

mirrorEnable.description: Indicates whether cache mirroring should be enabled for this volume. If enabled, all cache data will be mirrored across controllers to provide increased resilience to potential controller failures.

cacheWithoutBatteries.description: Indicates whether caching without batteries should be allowed for this volume. Note that setting this attribute to true may result in data loss if the array's cache hold-up battery fails, and then a disorderly power-down of the array occurs. This feature should be used only with extreme caution.

VolumeCacheSettings.description: Change configured cache settings for a volume.

name.description: The user label to assign to the new volume.

flashCache.description: If true, add the volume to the flashCache if one is defined. If false, remove from the flashCache if one exists.

metaTags.description: Optional array of Meta Data tags for the volume.

jobId.description: The check volume parity job id.

startLba.description: The starting LBA. This is an optional field and will default to the volume's starting LBA if not set.

endLba.description: The ending LBA. This is an optional field and will default to the volume's ending LBA if not set.

repairParityErrors.description: True to automatically repair parity errors detected; otherwise false to only check the volume parity. This is an optional field and will default to true.

repairMediaErrors.description: True to automatically repair media and EDC errors detected, otherwise false to only check the volume parity. This is an optional field and will default to true.

lba.description: The LBA on which the parity error was detected.

CheckVolumeParityError.description: Contains the data related to the detected parity error.

jobId.description: The check volume parity job id.

parityErrors.description: The detailed list of parity errors detected during the parity scan.

CheckVolumeParityJobErrorResponse.description: The check volume parity job errors response.

jobId.description: The check volume parity job id.

jobStartedTimestamp.description: The timestamp in ISO-8601 format representing the time the job was started.

repairParityErrors.description: True to automatically repair parity errors detected; otherwise false to only check the volume parity.

repairMediaErrors.description: True to automatically repair media and EDC errors detected, otherwise false to only check the volume parity.

runtimeInSec.description: The job run time in seconds.

estimatedTimeRemainingInSec.description: The job's estimated time remaining in seconds.

totalParityErrorsDetected.description: The total number of parity errors detected.

CheckVolumeParityJobResponse.description: The check volume parity job response.
